fields.name: Academy Glintstone Key
fields.short_description: Key to the seals binding both gates to the Academy of Raya Lucaria.
fields.description:
Key to the seals binding both gates to the Academy of Raya Lucaria.

Activates warp magic bound within the seals.

A glintstone key will remember its user, meaning once used it can never be passed on to another. The academy does not welcome the indolent.

fields.name: Aeonian Butterfly
fields.short_description: A butterfly with withered, scarlet wings found in the Swamp of Aeonia. Material used for crafting items.
fields.description:
A butterfly with withered, scarlet wings found in the Swamp of Aeonia. Material used for crafting items.

According to myth, these butterflies were once the wings of the Goddess of Rot herself.

fields.name: Albinauric Bloodclot
fields.short_description: The thick, coagulated blood of the Albinaurics. Material used for crafting items.
fields.description:
The thick, coagulated blood of the Albinaurics. Material used for crafting items.

Albinaurics are lifeforms made by human hands. Thus, many believe them to live impure lives, untouched by the Erdtree's grace.

fields.name: Alexander_s Innards
fields.short_description: A keepsake of the warrior jar Alexander. Found at the core of the dead flesh that once filled the great jar.
fields.description:
A keepsake of the warrior jar Alexander. Found at the core of the dead flesh that once filled the great jar.

The jars contain dregs inherited from those who came before. Thus are warriors passed from jar to jar, carrying dreams of greatness.

fields.name: Altus Bloom
fields.short_description: A golden-tinged flower from a succulent plant that blooms on the Altus Plateau. Material used for crafting items.
fields.description:
A golden-tinged flower from a succulent plant that blooms on the Altus Plateau. Material used for crafting items.

Said to be a funereal flower in an era long past, before the Erdtree grew.

fields.name: Amber Draught
fields.short_description: Small flask received from Preceptor Seluvis containing a gleaming amber draught for use in a scheme.
fields.description:
Small flask received from Preceptor Seluvis containing a gleaming amber draught for use in a scheme.

"Give it to Ranni and ensure she drinks it. And we'll be in a position to claim the very finest puppet ever crafted."

fields.name: Amber Starlight
fields.short_description: An ephemeral sliver that gives off a pale amber glow. What remains of a passing flash of starlight.
fields.description:
An ephemeral sliver that gives off a pale amber glow. What remains of a passing flash of starlight.

If the stars command our fates, then amber-hued stars must command the fates of the gods. Such is the belief that inspired the use of these shards to prepare a most special draught.

fields.name: Ancient Dragon Apostle_s Cookbook
fields.short_description: A record of crafting techniques taught by the capital's ancient dragon cult. Details techniques that harness lightning, the weapon of the ancient dragons.
fields.description:
A record of crafting techniques taught by the capital's ancient dragon cult. Details techniques that harness lightning, the weapon of the ancient dragons.

Acquire the knowledge to craft the following:

Lightning Grease
Drawstring Lightning Grease
Lightningbone Arrow
Lightningbone Arrow (Fletched)
Lightningbone Bolt

fields.name: Ancient Dragon Prayerbook
fields.short_description: Prayerbook of the capital's ancient dragon cult. A lost tome that never reached the Lands Between. Contains red lightning incantations.
fields.description:
Prayerbook of the capital's ancient dragon cult. A lost tome that never reached the Lands Between. Contains red lightning incantations.

Can be given to a learned cleric to gain access to the following incantations:

Ancient Dragons' Lightning Spear
Ancient Dragons' Lightning Strike

fields.name: Armorer_s Cookbook
fields.short_description: A record of crafting techniques left by an armorer who served the great general Radahn. Contains knowledge of dealing with rot; the application of fire in particular.
fields.description:
A record of crafting techniques left by an armorer who served the great general Radahn. Contains knowledge of dealing with rot; the application of fire in particular.

Acquire the knowledge to craft the following:

Fire Grease
Drawstring Fire Grease
Fireproof Dried Liver

fields.name: Arteria Leaf
fields.short_description: Dark red leaves with thick, swollen veins. Material used for crafting items. Exceedingly rare to find.
fields.description:
Dark red leaves with thick, swollen veins. Material used for crafting items. Exceedingly rare to find.

A faint pulse can be felt in the veins. Stirs the blood, providing an enlivening effect.

fields.name: Assassin_s Prayerbook
fields.short_description: Prayerbook of the Roundtable Hold's assassins.
fields.description:
Prayerbook of the Roundtable Hold's assassins.

Can be given to a learned cleric to gain access to the following incantations:

Assassin's Approach
Darkness

fields.name: Beast Blood
fields.short_description: Fresh beast blood, glinting with gold. Material used for crafting items. Found by hunting carnivorous beasts.
fields.description:
Fresh beast blood, glinting with gold. Material used for crafting items. Found by hunting carnivorous beasts.

This glimmering blood never rots or decays.

fields.name: Beast Eye
fields.short_description: Claw-marked stone eye received from Gurranq, Beast Clergyman.
fields.description:
Claw-marked stone eye received from Gurranq, Beast Clergyman.

It is said to tremble when near Deathroot.

The murky violet iris writhes as if alive. "I am not sated... Feed me more...Death..."

fields.name: Beast Liver
fields.short_description: The fresh liver of a beast; a luscious fruit of life. Material used for crafting items. Found by hunting herbivorous beasts.
fields.description:
The fresh liver of a beast; a luscious fruit of life. Material used for crafting items. Found by hunting herbivorous beasts.

Dried liver boosts damage negation.

fields.name: Bernahl_s _ Rogier_s _ Iji_s Bell Bearing
fields.short_description: A relic catalogued from the Ashen archives.
fields.description: A fragment of a forgotten age, recorded by the Emporium. Its true purpose is veiled, but its presence is undeniable.

fields.name: Black Knifeprint
fields.short_description: On the Night of the Black Knives, someone stole a fragment of Death from Maliketh, the Black Blade, and imbued its power into the assassins' daggers.
fields.description:
On the Night of the Black Knives, someone stole a fragment of Death from Maliketh, the Black Blade, and imbued its power into the assassins' daggers.

This mark is evidence of the ritual, and hides the truth of the conspiracy.

fields.name: Black Whetblade
fields.short_description: Black whetblade with a cipher engraved. Can be used as a whetstone knife.
fields.description:
Black whetblade with a cipher engraved. Can be used as a whetstone knife.

When applying an affinity using physical or occult-type ashes of war, an additional affinity of poison, blood, or occult can be chosen.

fields.name: Blood-Tainted Excrement
fields.short_description: The bloody excrement of a carnivorous beast. Material used for crafting items. Found in the land of the new dynasty.
fields.description:
The bloody excrement of a carnivorous beast. Material used for crafting items. Found in the land of the new dynasty.

Mixed inside with half-digested flesh are dense colonies of tiny eggs of unknown but assuredly revolting origin.

fields.name: Bloodrose
fields.short_description: Blood-slick roses that bloom in blood-soaked soil. Material used for crafting items.
fields.description:
Blood-slick roses that bloom in blood-soaked soil. Material used for crafting items.

Particularly beloved by those who serve the Lord of Blood. Glory to his inevitable reign.

fields.name: Budding Cave Moss
fields.short_description: Faintly luminescent moss that grows in dark caves, speckled with tiny, yellow flowers. Material used for crafting items.
fields.description:
Faintly luminescent moss that grows in dark caves, speckled with tiny, yellow flowers. Material used for crafting items.

It is primarily used in perfumes.

fields.name: Budding Horn
fields.short_description: A rarely-seen specimen of a young, budding horn. Material used for crafting items. Found by hunting herbivorous beasts.
fields.description:
A rarely-seen specimen of a young, budding horn. Material used for crafting items. Found by hunting herbivorous beasts.

This horn began to sprout on a beast that typically bears no horn. Perhaps it's a vestige of the primordial crucible.

fields.name: Carian Inverted Statue
fields.short_description: Statuette of a scholar, with ground and sky inverted.
fields.description:
Statuette of a scholar, with ground and sky inverted.

Reveals the hidden form of the Carian Study Hall, which connects to the divine tower.

To unveil the secret, affix it to the pedestal of the celestial globe.

fields.name: Cave Moss
fields.short_description: Faintly luminescent moss that grows in dark caves. Material used in crafting items.
fields.description:
Faintly luminescent moss that grows in dark caves. Material used in crafting items.

A fundamental ingredient for medicinal boluses.

fields.name: Celestial Dew
fields.short_description: A hidden Tear found in the Eternal City. Also known as a Night Tear.
fields.description:
A hidden Tear found in the Eternal City. Also known as a Night Tear.

Allows one to carry out an Absolution at the Church of Vows, reversing all antagonizations.

Once upon a time, the stars of the night sky guided fate, and this is a recollection of those times.

fields.name: Cerulean Crystal Tear
fields.short_description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
fields.description:
A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.

Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. The resulting concoction restores half of one's maximum FP.

fields.name: Cerulean Crystal Tear
fields.short_description: A relic catalogued from the Ashen archives.
fields.description: A fragment of a forgotten age, recorded by the Emporium. Its true purpose is veiled, but its presence is undeniable.

fields.name: Cerulean Hidden Tear
fields.short_description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
fields.description:
A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.

Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. The resulting concoction eliminates all FP consumption.

However, this effect is only brief and will quickly expire.

fields.name: Chrysalids_ Memento
fields.short_description: Memento left by the chrysalids sacrificed for grafting. A brooch wrapped in red velvet. Traces of blood are visible.
fields.description:
Memento left by the chrysalids sacrificed for grafting. A brooch wrapped in red velvet. Traces of blood are visible.

Faintly visible spirits try to convey something, but their voices cannot be heard.

fields.name: Conspectus Scroll _ Academy Scroll
fields.short_description: A relic catalogued from the Ashen archives.
fields.description: A fragment of a forgotten age, recorded by the Emporium. Its true purpose is veiled, but its presence is undeniable.

fields.name: Copy of Great Rune of the Unborn
fields.short_description: A relic catalogued from the Ashen archives.
fields.description: A fragment of a forgotten age, recorded by the Emporium. Its true purpose is veiled, but its presence is undeniable.

fields.name: Crab Eggs
fields.short_description: Eggs of large crabs which dwell in the shallows. Material used for crafting items.
fields.description:
Eggs of large crabs which dwell in the shallows. Material used for crafting items.

A nutritious foodstuff that warms from within. The flavor is exquisite. Only those of comfort and means know the truth: a crab's eggs are more delectable than its meat.

fields.name: Cracked Crystal
fields.short_description: A cracked, impure, degraded, and altogether unremarkable crystal. Material used for crafting items.
fields.description:
A cracked, impure, degraded, and altogether unremarkable crystal. Material used for crafting items.

Widely found in crystal tunnels.

fields.name: Cracked Pot
fields.short_description: This empty pot somehow mends itself when broken. Essential vessel for crafting cracked pot items.
fields.description:
This empty pot somehow mends itself when broken. Essential vessel for crafting cracked pot items.

The materials and magics sealed within deploy their effects when the pot is thrown.

fields.name: Crafting Kit
fields.short_description: Leather bag containing a pestle and mortar, small blade, and various other tools.
fields.description:
Leather bag containing a pestle and mortar, small blade, and various other tools.

Enables item crafting from the main menu.

Provides both means to fight and means to survive.

fields.name: Crimson Bubbletear
fields.short_description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
fields.description:
A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.

Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. The resulting concoction automatically heals one's HP in the moment before death.

However, this effect only occurs once, and will expire after a certain duration.

fields.name: Crimson Crystal Tear
fields.short_description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
fields.description:
A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.

Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. The resulting concoction restores half of one's maximum HP.

fields.name: Crimson Crystal Tear
fields.short_description: A relic catalogued from the Ashen archives.
fields.description: A fragment of a forgotten age, recorded by the Emporium. Its true purpose is veiled, but its presence is undeniable.

fields.name: Crimsonburst Crystal Tear
fields.short_description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
fields.description:
A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.

Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. The resulting concoction gradually restores one's HP over time.

fields.name: Crimsonspill Crystal Tear
fields.short_description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
fields.description:
A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.

Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. The resulting concoction temporarily raises one's maximum HP.

fields.name: Crimsonwhorl Bubbletear
fields.short_description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
fields.description:
A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.

Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. The resulting concoction converts incoming damage into recovered HP instead. However, physical damage cannot be converted.

This effect is only brief and will quickly expire.

fields.name: Crystal Bud
fields.short_description: A young plant, crystalized before it could mature. Material used for crafting items.
fields.description:
A young plant, crystalized before it could mature. Material used for crafting items.

Widely found in Liurnia Lake.

fields.name: Crystal Cave Moss
fields.short_description: Faintly luminescent moss that grows in dark caves, laced with fine crystals. Material used for crafting items.
fields.description:
Faintly luminescent moss that grows in dark caves, laced with fine crystals. Material used for crafting items.

Among the mosses, it possesses unique medicinal properties.

fields.name: Cursemark of Death
fields.short_description: Cursemark carved into the discarded flesh of Ranni the Witch. Also known as the half-wheel wound of the centipede.
fields.description:
Cursemark carved into the discarded flesh of Ranni the Witch. Also known as the half-wheel wound of the centipede.

This cursemark was carved at the moment of Death of the first demigod, and should have taken the shape of a circle.

However, two demigods perished at the same time, breaking the cursemark into two half-wheels.

Ranni was the first of the demigods whose flesh perished, while the Prince of Death perished in soul alone.

fields.name: Dancer_s Castanets
fields.short_description: Castanets used by dancers from foreign lands. Received from Patches.
fields.description:
Castanets used by dancers from foreign lands. Received from Patches.

The passionate dance comprises no seductiveness, but merely a dignified beauty.

fields.name: Dark Moon Ring
fields.short_description: Ring depicting a leaden full moon. Symbolic of a cold oath, the ring is supposed to be given by Lunar Princess Ranni to her consort.
fields.description:
Ring depicting a leaden full moon. Symbolic of a cold oath, the ring is supposed to be given by Lunar Princess Ranni to her consort.

Ranni is an Empyrean, meaning her consort would by rights earn the title of lord.

A warning is engraved within; "Whoever thou mayest be, take not the ring from this place, the solitude beyond the night is better mine alone."

fields.name: Deathroot
fields.short_description: A source that gives rise to Those Who Live in Death.
fields.description:
A source that gives rise to Those Who Live in Death.

The beast clergyman, found at Bestial Sanctum in the distant east, collects and devours these roots.

On the night of the dire plot the stolen Rune of Death enabled the first Death of a demigod. Later, the Rune of Death spread across the Lands Between through the underground roots of the Greattree, sprouting in the form of Deathroot.

fields.name: Dectus Medallion (Left)
fields.short_description: Left half of a split medallion depicting the Erdtree.
fields.description:
Left half of a split medallion depicting the Erdtree.

Brandishing the medallion with both halves conjoined will activate the Grand Lift of Dectus, connecting the Altus Plateau to Liurnia.

The right half is said to reside in Fort Faroth in the Dragonbarrow, far to the east.

fields.name: Dectus Medallion (Right)
fields.short_description: Right half of a split medallion depicting the Erdtree.
fields.description:
Right half of a split medallion depicting the Erdtree.

Brandishing the medallion with both halves conjoined will activate the Grand Lift of Dectus, connecting the Altus Plateau to Liurnia.

The left half is said to reside in the coastal Fort Haight to the far west.

fields.name: Dewkissed Herba
fields.short_description: A herb that grows in the false night in and around the Eternal City. Material used for crafting items.
fields.description:
A herb that grows in the false night in and around the Eternal City. Material used for crafting items.

Soaked in arcane dew, it gives off the faint glow of starlight.

fields.name: Dexterity-Knot Crystal Tear
fields.short_description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
fields.description:
A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.

Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. The resulting concoction temporarily boosts one's dexterity.

fields.name: Discarded Palace Key
fields.short_description: A key discarded by Lunar Princess Ranni alongside her very flesh.
fields.description:
A key discarded by Lunar Princess Ranni alongside her very flesh.

Opens a treasure chest passed down to Carian Princesses.

It is said to be found in the Grand Library of Raya Lucaria with her mother Rennala.

fields.name: Dragon Cult Prayerbook
fields.short_description: Prayerbook of the capital's ancient dragon cult. A text of the knights' faith that arose after the War of the Ancient Dragons.
fields.description:
Prayerbook of the capital's ancient dragon cult. A text of the knights' faith that arose after the War of the Ancient Dragons.

Can be given to a learned cleric to gain access to the following incantations:

Lightning Spear
Honed Bolt
Electrify Armament

fields.name: Dragon Heart
fields.short_description: Dragon heart seized by a dragon tracker. Riddled with Gravel Stone, this grotesque organ continues to beat vivaciously.
fields.description:
Dragon heart seized by a dragon tracker. Riddled with Gravel Stone, this grotesque organ continues to beat vivaciously.

An offering used in the Dragon Communion. Consume a dragon's heart at the altar to make its power yours.

While a terrible and savage-looking thing, the heart has a peculiar beauty to it.

fields.name: Drawing-Room Key
fields.short_description: Key to Volcano Manor's drawing room.
fields.description:
Key to Volcano Manor's drawing room.

The door can be found in the westward corridor, upon the left hand side.

fields.name: Erdleaf Flower
fields.short_description: A dusky yellow flower that has started to fade to brown, found throughout the Lands Between. Material used for crafting items.
fields.description:
A dusky yellow flower that has started to fade to brown, found throughout the Lands Between. Material used for crafting items.

Said to be fed by leaves that fell from the Erdtree in days of antiquity.

fields.name: Eye of Yelough
fields.short_description: A shrub fruit bursting with ripened pulp. Material used for crafting items.
fields.description:
A shrub fruit bursting with ripened pulp. Material used for crafting items.

Grown in lands afflicted by frenzy, it's used for its pain-relieving properties... Though it's also known to be a dangerous intoxicant.

fields.name: Faded Erdleaf Flower
fields.short_description: An Erdleaf flower that has faded to a pale scarlet, found blooming in rotten lands. Material used in crafting items.
fields.description:
An Erdleaf flower that has faded to a pale scarlet, found blooming in rotten lands. Material used in crafting items.

Said to be fed by leaves that fell from the Erdtree in days of antiquity.

fields.name: Faith-Knot Crystal Tear
fields.short_description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
fields.description:
A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.

Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. The resulting concoction temporarily boosts one's faith.

fields.name: Fevor_s Cookbook
fields.short_description: A record of crafting techniques left by a man who was utterly captivated by St. Trina. He continued the search for her in his slumber.
fields.description:
A record of crafting techniques left by a man who was utterly captivated by St. Trina. He continued the search for her in his slumber.

Acquire the knowledge to craft the following:

Sleep Pot

fields.name: Fingerprint Grape
fields.short_description: Eyeball of the knight Vyke, inflamed yellow. Seared with a repulsive fingerprint burn akin to those that marred his entire body.
fields.description:
Eyeball of the knight Vyke, inflamed yellow. Seared with a repulsive fingerprint burn akin to those that marred his entire body.

If offered to the blind maiden, it will lead her to the source of the distant light, allowing her to become a Finger Maiden.

fields.name: Fingerslayer Blade
fields.short_description: The hidden treasure of the Eternal City of Nokron; a blade said to have been born of a corpse.
fields.description:
The hidden treasure of the Eternal City of Nokron; a blade said to have been born of a corpse.

This blood-drenched fetish is proof of the high treason committed by the Eternal City and symbolizes its downfall.

Cannot be wielded by those without a fate, but is said to be able to harm the Greater Will and its vassals.

fields.name: Fire Blossom
fields.short_description: A half-ashen and smoldering flower that blooms on the Mountaintops of the Giants. Material used for crafting items.
fields.description:
A half-ashen and smoldering flower that blooms on the Mountaintops of the Giants. Material used for crafting items.

Fertilized by the sparks from the forge at the peak where burns the flame of ruin.

fields.name: Fire Monks_ Prayerbook
fields.short_description: Prayerbook of the Fire Monks, who came from the Mountaintops of the Giants far to the north.
fields.description:
Prayerbook of the Fire Monks, who came from the Mountaintops of the Giants far to the north.

Can be given to a learned cleric to gain access to the following incantations:

O, Flame!
Surge, O Flame!

fields.name: Flame-Shrouding Cracked Tear
fields.short_description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
fields.description:
A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.

Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. The resulting concoction temporarily boosts the power of one's fire attacks.

fields.name: Flight Pinion
fields.short_description: Flight feather of birds.
fields.description:
Flight feather of birds.

Material used for crafting items.

Commonly used for arrow fletchings.

fields.name: Formic Rock
fields.short_description: Rock formed from solidified giant ant venom. Highly acidic. Material used for crafting items.
fields.description:
Rock formed from solidified giant ant venom. Highly acidic. Material used for crafting items.

Found near Ainsel River and other places where giant ants live.

fields.name: Four-Toed Fowl Foot
fields.short_description: A four-toed fowl's foot. Material used for crafting items.
fields.description:
A four-toed fowl's foot. Material used for crafting items.

In the Lands Between, having three digits is seen as a bad omen. As such, the four-toed fowl's foot is a gift of great luck indeed.

fields.name: Frenzied_s Cookbook
fields.short_description: A record of crafting techniques left by those afflicted by the madness of the flame of frenzy. Contains techniques discovered in desperation.
fields.description:
A record of crafting techniques left by those afflicted by the madness of the flame of frenzy. Contains techniques discovered in desperation.

Acquire the knowledge to craft the following:

Clarifying Boluses

fields.name: Fulgurbloom
fields.short_description: Yellow flower that grows in lightning-struck lands. Material used for crafting items.
fields.description:
Yellow flower that grows in lightning-struck lands. Material used for crafting items.

Imbued with traces of lightning's essence.

fields.name: Giant_s Prayerbook
fields.short_description: Prayerbook that contains the secrets of the Fire Giants. Kept hidden by the prelates who monitor the Giant's Flame.
fields.description:
Prayerbook that contains the secrets of the Fire Giants. Kept hidden by the prelates who monitor the Giant's Flame.

Can be given to a learned cleric to gain access to the following incantations:

Giantsflame Take Thee
Flame, Fall Upon Them

fields.name: Glass Shard
fields.short_description: Glass shard covered in dirt.
fields.description:
Glass shard covered in dirt.

Because it sparkles in the light, it might be mistaken for an object of value when seen from afar.

It cannot produce light by itself. Essentially worthless.

fields.name: Glintstone Craftman_s Cookbook
fields.short_description: A record of crafting techniques left by a glintstone craftsman who served the academy. Contains information on "faux sorceries," such as they were called.
fields.description:
A record of crafting techniques left by a glintstone craftsman who served the academy. Contains information on "faux sorceries," such as they were called.

Acquire the knowledge to craft the following:

Magic Pot
Roped Magic Pot
Shield Grease

fields.name: Glintstone Firefly
fields.short_description: A firefly whose glowing tail has hardened into glintstone, widely found in Liurnia Lake. Material used for crafting items.
fields.description:
A firefly whose glowing tail has hardened into glintstone, widely found in Liurnia Lake. Material used for crafting items.

Alas, now that its tail is glintstone, it can no longer beguile potential mates.

fields.name: Glintstone Whetblade
fields.short_description: Glintstone whetblade with a cipher engraved. Can be used as a whetstone knife.
fields.description:
Glintstone whetblade with a cipher engraved. Can be used as a whetstone knife.

When applying an affinity using physical or magic-type ashes of war, an additional affinity of magic or frost can be chosen.

fields.name: Godrick_s Great Rune
fields.short_description: A Great Rune of the shardbearer Godrick. Its blessing raises all attributes.
fields.description:
A Great Rune of the shardbearer Godrick. Its blessing raises all attributes.

This Great Rune is known as the anchor ring, found in the center of the Elden Ring.

The first demigods were The Elden Lord Godfrey and his offspring, the golden lineage.

fields.name: Godrick_s Great Rune
fields.short_description: A relic catalogued from the Ashen archives.
fields.description: A fragment of a forgotten age, recorded by the Emporium. Its true purpose is veiled, but its presence is undeniable.

fields.name: Godskin Prayerbook
fields.short_description: Prayerbook bound in supple skin. Incantations of the god-slaying black flame are written within.
fields.description:
Prayerbook bound in supple skin. Incantations of the god-slaying black flame are written within.

Can be given to a learned cleric to gain access to the following incantations:

Black Flame
Black Flame Blade

fields.name: Gold Firefly
fields.short_description: Firefly that gives off a golden light. Material used in crafting items. Found near bodies of water close to Minor Erdtrees.
fields.description:
Firefly that gives off a golden light. Material used in crafting items. Found near bodies of water close to Minor Erdtrees.

The light of fireflies is believed to have an alluring magic. Golden light is considered to invite runes.

fields.name: Gold-Tinged Excrement
fields.short_description: Someone's excrement. It has a golden tinge. Material used for crafting items. Often hidden in woods and thickets.
fields.description:
Someone's excrement. It has a golden tinge. Material used for crafting items. Often hidden in woods and thickets.

Gold-tinged excrement is a highly stable substance; it doesn't dry out, nor does it lose its customary warmth or scent. For better or for worse, it remains as it is.

fields.name: Golden Centipede
fields.short_description: The golden, desiccated remains of a centipede. Material used for crafting items.
fields.description:
The golden, desiccated remains of a centipede. Material used for crafting items.

Kept as a fetish by Golden Order fundamentalists, especially the hunters of Those Who Live in Death. As such, they're found near churches and similar.

fields.name: Golden Order Principia
fields.short_description: Prayerbook of the Golden Order fundamentalists. A dense and complex academic treatise that contains the Order's fundamental principles.
fields.description:
Prayerbook of the Golden Order fundamentalists. A dense and complex academic treatise that contains the Order's fundamental principles.

Can be given to a learned cleric to gain access to the following incantations:

Radagon's Rings of Light
Law of Regression

fields.name: Golden Rowa
fields.short_description: A Rowa fruit tinted with gold. Material used for crafting items.
fields.description:
A Rowa fruit tinted with gold. Material used for crafting items.

Easily found near the Erdtree.

fields.name: Golden Sewing Needle
fields.short_description: Sewing needle made of gold. Unique item made to alter demigod attire.
fields.description:
Sewing needle made of gold. Unique item made to alter demigod attire.

One of the tools brought by Radagon when he entered into marriage with Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon, and joined the Carian line.

fields.name: Golden Sunflower
fields.short_description: A golden sunflower that grows facing the Erdtree. Material used for crafting items. Found near Minor Erdtrees.
fields.description:
A golden sunflower that grows facing the Erdtree. Material used for crafting items. Found near Minor Erdtrees.

At the foot of the Erdtree, they retain their color, along with a powerful holy essence.

fields.name: Golden Tailoring Tools
fields.short_description: Tailoring tools made from gold. Tools brought with the red-haired Radagon when he married into the Carian line.
fields.description:
Tailoring tools made from gold. Tools brought with the red-haired Radagon when he married into the Carian line.

With these, even demigod attire can be altered at a site of grace.

fields.name: Gowry_s _ Sellen_s _ Thops_s Bell Bearing
fields.short_description: A relic catalogued from the Ashen archives.
fields.description: A fragment of a forgotten age, recorded by the Emporium. Its true purpose is veiled, but its presence is undeniable.

fields.name: Grave Violet
fields.short_description: A purple flower than blooms in graveyards. Material used for crafting items.
fields.description:
A purple flower than blooms in graveyards. Material used for crafting items.

The hue of ghostflame, it's believed to be useful in calling forth spirits.

fields.name: Gravel Stone
fields.short_description: A small clump of sharp, pointed stones. Material used for crafting items.
fields.description:
A small clump of sharp, pointed stones. Material used for crafting items.

Such compound stones, found in lands once beset by ancient dragons, are said to be the scales of those very beasts.

fields.name: Great Dragonfly Head
fields.short_description: Head of a large dragonfly. Material used for crafting items.
fields.description:
Head of a large dragonfly. Material used for crafting items.

Long believed to have the ability to neutralize poisons.

fields.name: Greenburst Crystal Tear
fields.short_description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
fields.description:
A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.

Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. The resulting concoction temporarily boosts stamina recovery speed.

fields.name: Greenspill Crystal Tear
fields.short_description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
fields.description:
A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.

Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. The resulting concoction temporarily raises one's maximum stamina.

fields.name: Haligtree Secret Medallion (Left)
fields.short_description: Left half of a split medallion depicting the Haligtree.
fields.description:
Left half of a split medallion depicting the Haligtree.

Brandishing the medallion with both halves conjoined will activate the Grand Lift of Rold, granting access to a hidden path.

In other words, this secret medallion will guide the bearer to the land of Miquella's Haligtree.

fields.name: Haligtree Secret Medallion (Right)
fields.short_description: Right half of a split medallion depicting the Haligtree.
fields.description:
Right half of a split medallion depicting the Haligtree.

Brandishing the medallion with both halves conjoined will activate the Grand Lift of Rold, granting access to a hidden path.

In other words, this secret medallion will guide the bearer to the land of Miquella's Haligtree.

fields.name: Hefty Beast Bone
fields.short_description: Thick, solid beast bones. Material used for crafting items. Found by hunting particularly large beasts.
fields.description:
Thick, solid beast bones. Material used for crafting items. Found by hunting particularly large beasts.

Commonly used to make disposable weapons.

fields.name: Herba
fields.short_description: Evergreen leaves that give off a faint light. Material used for crafting items.
fields.description:
Evergreen leaves that give off a faint light. Material used for crafting items.

This very common medicinal plant can be found in thickets and elsewhere.

fields.name: Holy-Shrouding Cracked Tear
fields.short_description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
fields.description:
A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.

Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. The resulting concoction temporarily boosts the power of one's holy attacks.

fields.name: Human Bone Shard
fields.short_description: Fragment of bone with dun mottling. Material used for crafting items. Found by hunting Those Who Live in Death.
fields.description:
Fragment of bone with dun mottling. Material used for crafting items. Found by hunting Those Who Live in Death.

Lamentably brittle, it crumbles at the lightest caress.

fields.name: Imbued Sword Key
fields.short_description: Stone key shaped like a sword. A special item, imbued with rich blue magic.
fields.description:
Stone key shaped like a sword. A special item, imbued with rich blue magic.

Breaks the seal on the imp statues guarding the sending gates enshrined in each belfry, but remains embedded in the statue after use, meaning it can only be used once as an item.

Think well before using one.

fields.name: Intelligence-Knot Crystal Tear
fields.short_description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
fields.description:
A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.

Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. The resulting concoction temporarily boosts one's intelligence.

fields.name: Irina_s Letter
fields.short_description: Letter given by Irina, addressed to her father, the commander of Castle Morne.
fields.description:
Letter given by Irina, addressed to her father, the commander of Castle Morne.

Gorgeous silken handkerchief, lightly stained with blood. Words can be made out within.

fields.name: Iron Whetblade
fields.short_description: Iron whetblade with a cipher engraved. Can be used as a whetstone knife.
fields.description:
Iron whetblade with a cipher engraved. Can be used as a whetstone knife.

When applying an affinity using ashes of war, an additional affinity of heavy, keen, or quality can be chosen.

fields.name: Land Octopus Ovary
fields.short_description: Puffy, milky white ovary of a land octopus. Material used for crafting items.
fields.description:
Puffy, milky white ovary of a land octopus. Material used for crafting items.

Land octopuses eat humans in order to bear young, and theirs is the blood that runs through these ovaries.

fields.name: Larval Tear
fields.short_description: Core of a creature of mimicry known as a silver tear. As much a substance as it is a living organism.
fields.description:
Core of a creature of mimicry known as a silver tear. As much a substance as it is a living organism.

Material required by the amber egg cradled by Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon, to birth people anew.

Being born anew allows the reallocation of attributes boosted by leveling up.

fields.name: Leaden Hardtear
fields.short_description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
fields.description:
A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.

Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. The resulting concoction temporarily boosts one's poise.

fields.name: Lightning-Shrouding Cracked Tear
fields.short_description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
fields.description:
A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.

Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. The resulting concoction temporarily boosts the power of one's lightning attacks.

fields.name: Living Jar Shard
fields.short_description: A fragment of a living jar, hardened after its death. Material used for crafting items.
fields.description:
A fragment of a living jar, hardened after its death. Material used for crafting items.

Such fragments command a high price due to the magical power locked within. This leaves the living jars unfortunate targets for poachers.

fields.name: Lord of Blood_s Favor
fields.short_description: Pure white oath-cloth given by Varr. The final trial to be anointed a Knight of Mohg, Lord of Blood.
fields.description:
Pure white oath-cloth given by Varr. The final trial to be anointed a Knight of Mohg, Lord of Blood.

"Soak the cloth with a maiden's blood... The blood of anyone's maiden will do. You are maidenless, after all."

fields.name: Lord of Blood_s Favor
fields.short_description: A relic catalogued from the Ashen archives.
fields.description: A fragment of a forgotten age, recorded by the Emporium. Its true purpose is veiled, but its presence is undeniable.

fields.name: Lump of Flesh
fields.short_description: A lump of beast flesh filled with rich juices. Material used for crafting items. Found by hunting carnivorous beasts.
fields.description:
A lump of beast flesh filled with rich juices. Material used for crafting items. Found by hunting carnivorous beasts.

Meat suitable for a rustic feast.

fields.name: Magic-Shrouding Cracked Tear
fields.short_description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
fields.description:
A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.

Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. The resulting concoction temporarily boosts the power of one's magic attacks.

fields.name: Malenia_s Great Rune
fields.short_description: A Great Rune of the shardbearer Malenia. The blessing of this half-rotted rune reduces the healing power of Flask of Crimson Tears.
fields.description:
A Great Rune of the shardbearer Malenia. The blessing of this half-rotted rune reduces the healing power of Flask of Crimson Tears.

And yet, due to the infusion of Malenia's spirit of resistance, attacks made immediately after receiving damage will partially recover HP.

Malenia is daughter to Queen Marika and Radagon, and her Great Rune should have been the most sacred of all.

fields.name: Malenia_s Great Rune
fields.short_description: A relic catalogued from the Ashen archives.
fields.description: A fragment of a forgotten age, recorded by the Emporium. Its true purpose is veiled, but its presence is undeniable.

fields.name: Map (Ainsel River)
fields.short_description: Map of Ainsel River and environs.
fields.description:
Map of Ainsel River and environs.

Two great rivers flow beneath the Lands Between, the Siofra and the Ainsel. This vast region is said to be the grave of civilizations that flourished before the Erdtree.

fields.name: Map (Altus Plateau)
fields.short_description: Map of Altus Plateau and environs.
fields.description:
Map of Altus Plateau and environs.

The Altus Plateau, where the Erdtree's base can be found, contains the Royal Capital of Leyndell to the east, and Mt. Gelmir to the west. Scars from the Shattering remain apparent to this day.

fields.name: Map (Caelid)
fields.short_description: Map of Caelid and environs.
fields.description:
Map of Caelid and environs.

Caelid, known as the locale of the last battle between General Radahn and Malenia, Blade of Miquella, is a vast land consummately marred by scarlet rot.

fields.name: Map (Consecrated Snowfield)
fields.short_description: Map of Consecrated Snowfield and environs.
fields.description:
Map of Consecrated Snowfield and environs.

The route through this land, crossed east to west by a frozen river, leads to Miquella's Haligtree. This is the path taken by those unchosen, though it is a trial all the same.

fields.name: Map (Deeproot Depths)
fields.short_description: Map of Deeproot Depths and environs.
fields.description:
Map of Deeproot Depths and environs.

At the very depths of the Erdtree's majestic roots lies the source of the Ainsel and the Siofra rivers. Here too begins the network of Greattree roots that spread throughout the Lands Between.

fields.name: Map (Dragonbarrow)
fields.short_description: Map of Dragonbarrow and environs.
fields.description:
Map of Dragonbarrow and environs.

The dragons that escaped the scarlet rot made a nest of the plateau to Caelid's north. Thus it was named "Dragonbarrow," and none dare to enter.

fields.name: Map (Lake of Rot)
fields.short_description: Map of Lake of Rot and environs.
fields.description:
Map of Lake of Rot and environs.

A great lake of standing water downstream of the Ainsel River. It is said that the divine essence of an outer god is sealed away in this land.

fields.name: Map (Leyndell, Royal Capital)
fields.short_description: Map of the Royal Capital of Leyndell and environs.
fields.description:
Map of the Royal Capital of Leyndell and environs.

Leyndell, City of the Erdtree, is a metropolis enclosed by double ramparts. The inner wall remains unbreached to this day.

fields.name: Map (Limgrave, East)
fields.short_description: Map of the eastern region of Limgrave.
fields.description:
Map of the eastern region of Limgrave.

Other than the Mistwood which envelops the south, it is known for its lands which lead to Caelid, a path trod by many a soldier in the past.

fields.name: Map (Limgrave, West)
fields.short_description: Map of the western region of Limgrave.
fields.description:
Map of the western region of Limgrave.

The demesne of Limgrave, far south of the Erdtree, is bordered to the northwest by the cliffs of Stormveil, and under its ever-clouded skies roll the great steppes of the pale lands.

fields.name: Map (Liurnia, East)
fields.short_description: Map of Liurnia's eastern region.
fields.description:
Map of Liurnia's eastern region.

The majority of Liurnia, known for its vast forests and ever-present fog, is sinking into a lake. The eastern coast is home to a highroad running north and south.

fields.name: Map (Liurnia, North)
fields.short_description: Map of Liurnia's northern region.
fields.description:
Map of Liurnia's northern region.

The Academy of Raya Lucaria towers over the north, while at its base spreads the town built around it, now flooded. Two highroads end their journeys here.

fields.name: Map (Liurnia, West)
fields.short_description: Map of Liurnia's western region.
fields.description:
Map of Liurnia's western region.

The majority of Liurnia, known for its vast forests and ever-present fog, is sinking into a lake. The western coast has always been closely associated with Carian royalty.

fields.name: Map (Mohgwyn Palace)
fields.short_description: Map of Mohgwyn Palace and environs.
fields.description:
Map of Mohgwyn Palace and environs.

In the lightless depths lies the grave of an ancient civilization. It is here Mohg, the Lord of Blood, is building his palace, to be the seat of his coming dynasty named Mohgwyn. And whatever nightmares that may bring.

fields.name: Map (Mountaintops of the Giants, East)
fields.short_description: Map of Eastern Mountaintops of the Giants.
fields.description:
Map of Eastern Mountaintops of the Giants.

The remote, desolate eastern summit is the highest point in all the Lands Between, overlooking even the Flame Peak to the south.

fields.name: Map (Mountaintops of the Giants, West)
fields.short_description: Map of Western Mountaintops of the Giants.
fields.description:
Map of Western Mountaintops of the Giants.

Marching ground during the War against the Giants. They carved winding paths in the cliff walls right up to the summit, leading to the untrodden snow-laden region beyond.

fields.name: Map (Mt. Gelmir)
fields.short_description: Map of Mt. Gelmir and environs.
fields.description:
Map of Mt. Gelmir and environs.

Mt. Gelmir, which houses the Volcano Manor at its summit, is characterized by sheer cliffs and ominous skies. These qualities only became more pronounced after the Shattering.

fields.name: Map (Siofra River)
fields.short_description: Map of Siofra River and environs
fields.description:
Map of Siofra River and environs

Two great rivers flow beneath the Lands Between, the Siofra and the Ainsel. This vast region is said to be the grave of civilizations that flourished before the Erdtree.

fields.name: Map (Weeping Peninsula)
fields.short_description: Map of the Weeping Peninsula.
fields.description:
Map of the Weeping Peninsula.

The peninsula, to Limgrave's south, is named for its unceasing rainfall, redolent of lament.

fields.name: Melted Mushroom
fields.short_description: A mushroom that grows in the false night in and around the Eternal City. Material used for crafting items.
fields.description:
A mushroom that grows in the false night in and around the Eternal City. Material used for crafting items.

It drips with a viscous fluid that behaves much like oil.

fields.name: Memory Stone
fields.short_description: A black, lightly beguiling stone. Prized by the sorcerers who produce them.
fields.description:
A black, lightly beguiling stone. Prized by the sorcerers who produce them.

Increases memory slots.

Said to be a fragment of the black moon that once hung above the Eternal City.

fields.name: Mending Rune of Perfect Order
fields.short_description: Rune discovered by the noble Goldmask. Used to restore the fractured Elden Ring when brandished by the Elden Lord.
fields.description:
Rune discovered by the noble Goldmask. Used to restore the fractured Elden Ring when brandished by the Elden Lord.

A rune of transcendental ideology which will attempt to perfect the Golden Order.

The current imperfection of the Golden Order, or instability of ideology, can be blamed upon the fickleness of the gods no better than men. That is the fly in the ointment.

fields.name: Mending Rune of the Death-Prince
fields.short_description: Rune gestated by Fia, the Deathbed Companion. Used to restore the fractured Elden Ring when brandished by the Elden Lord.
fields.description:
Rune gestated by Fia, the Deathbed Companion. Used to restore the fractured Elden Ring when brandished by the Elden Lord.

Formed of the two hallowbrand half-wheels combined, it will embed the principle of life within Death into Order.

The Golden Order was created by confining Destined Death. Thus, this new Order will be one of Death restored.

fields.name: Mending Rune of the Fell Curse
fields.short_description: Loathsome rune gestated by the Dung Eater. Used to restore the fractured Elden Ring when brandished by the Elden Lord.
fields.description:
Loathsome rune gestated by the Dung Eater. Used to restore the fractured Elden Ring when brandished by the Elden Lord.

The reviled curse will last eternally, and the world's children, grandchildren, and every generation hence, will be its pustules.

If Order is defiled entirely, defilement is defilement no more, and for every curse, a cursed blessing.

fields.name: Miniature Ranni
fields.short_description: A doll resembling Ranni the Witch. From head to toe every detail is perfect.
fields.description:
A doll resembling Ranni the Witch. From head to toe every detail is perfect.

This unresponsive doll seems pleasantly cool.

fields.name: Miniature Ranni
fields.short_description: A relic catalogued from the Ashen archives.
fields.description: A fragment of a forgotten age, recorded by the Emporium. Its true purpose is veiled, but its presence is undeniable.

fields.name: Miquella_s Lily
fields.short_description: A delicate water lily of unalloyed gold that has started to fade and wilt. Material used for crafting items. Exceedingly rare to find.
fields.description:
A delicate water lily of unalloyed gold that has started to fade and wilt. Material used for crafting items. Exceedingly rare to find.

A flower signifying faith in the Haligtree. Thought to be beloved by the Empyrean Miquella in his youth.

fields.name: Miquella_s Needle
fields.short_description: One of the unalloyed gold needles that Miquella crafted to ward away the meddling of outer gods.
fields.description:
One of the unalloyed gold needles that Miquella crafted to ward away the meddling of outer gods.

Capable of subduing the flame of frenzy if inherited, allowing one to cheat fate and avoid becoming Lord of Frenzied Flame.

However, the needle is as yet unfinished and can only be used in the heart of the storm beyond time said to be found in Faram Azula.

fields.name: Miranda Powder
fields.short_description: Pollen from a man-eating miranda flower. Material used for crafting items.
fields.description:
Pollen from a man-eating miranda flower. Material used for crafting items.

Throughout history, perfumers have prized this extremely fragrant form of miranda pollen, not yet scattered into the air.

fields.name: Miriel_s _ Corhyn_s _ D_s Bell Bearing
fields.short_description: A relic catalogued from the Ashen archives.
fields.description: A fragment of a forgotten age, recorded by the Emporium. Its true purpose is veiled, but its presence is undeniable.

fields.name: Missionary_s Cookbook
fields.short_description: A record of crafting techniques left by a man who, unable to become a Finger Maiden, instead became a missionary, and went forth to spread holy teachings.
fields.description:
A record of crafting techniques left by a man who, unable to become a Finger Maiden, instead became a missionary, and went forth to spread holy teachings.

Acquire the knowledge to craft the following:

Holyproof Dried Liver

fields.name: Mohg_s Great Rune
fields.short_description: A Great Rune of the shardbearer Mohg. Its blessing grants a blessing of blood to summoned phantoms, and imparts a Phantom Great Rune upon successful invasion.
fields.description:
A Great Rune of the shardbearer Mohg. Its blessing grants a blessing of blood to summoned phantoms, and imparts a Phantom Great Rune upon successful invasion.

Mohg and Morgott are twin brothers, and their Great Runes are naturally similar.

But Mohg's rune is soaked in accursed blood, from his devout love for the wretched mire that he was born into far below the earth.

fields.name: Mohg_s Great Rune
fields.short_description: A relic catalogued from the Ashen archives.
fields.description: A fragment of a forgotten age, recorded by the Emporium. Its true purpose is veiled, but its presence is undeniable.

fields.name: Morgott_s Great Rune
fields.short_description: A Great Rune of the shardbearer Morgott. Its blessing greatly raises maximum HP.
fields.description:
A Great Rune of the shardbearer Morgott. Its blessing greatly raises maximum HP.

This Great Rune is the anchor ring that houses the base, and proves two things:

That the Omen King was born of the golden lineage, and that he was indeed the Lord of Leyndell.

fields.name: Morgott_s Great Rune
fields.short_description: A relic catalogued from the Ashen archives.
fields.description: A fragment of a forgotten age, recorded by the Emporium. Its true purpose is veiled, but its presence is undeniable.

fields.name: Mushroom
fields.short_description: A fungal growth that thrives in damp thickets and elsewhere. Material used for crafting items.
fields.description:
A fungal growth that thrives in damp thickets and elsewhere. Material used for crafting items.

Its thick, spongy flesh makes it a key component in throwing pots.

fields.name: Nascent Butterfly
fields.short_description: An arcane butterfly with translucent wings. Material used for crafting items. Exceedingly rare to find.
fields.description:
An arcane butterfly with translucent wings. Material used for crafting items. Exceedingly rare to find.

This butterfly appears as if it's just emerged from its cocoon for its entire life.

fields.name: Nomadic Warrior_s Cookbook
fields.short_description: A record of crafting techniques left by roaming nomad warriors. Contains knowledge for surviving in the face of utter scarcity.
fields.description:
A record of crafting techniques left by roaming nomad warriors. Contains knowledge for surviving in the face of utter scarcity.

Acquire the knowledge to craft the following:

Bone Arrow
Bone Arrow (Fletched)
Bone Bolt

fields.name: Old Fang
fields.short_description: A rarely-seen specimen of beast fang. Material used for crafting items. Found by hunting carnivorous beasts.
fields.description:
A rarely-seen specimen of beast fang. Material used for crafting items. Found by hunting carnivorous beasts.

These multiple, overlapping fangs grow from a single root. Perhaps they're a vestige of the primordial crucible.

fields.name: Opaline Bubbletear
fields.short_description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
fields.description:
A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.

Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. Provides significant damage negation.

However, this effect only occurs once, and will expire after a certain duration.

fields.name: Opaline Hardtear
fields.short_description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
fields.description:
A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.

Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. The resulting concoction temporarily boosts all forms of damage negation.

fields.name: Patches_ _ Kale_s _ Gostoc_s _ Blackguard_s _ Pidia_s Bell Bearing
fields.short_description: A relic catalogued from the Ashen archives.
fields.description: A fragment of a forgotten age, recorded by the Emporium. Its true purpose is veiled, but its presence is undeniable.

fields.name: Perfume Bottle
fields.short_description: Glass bottles used by perfumers. Used to seal various scent compounds.
fields.description:
Glass bottles used by perfumers. Used to seal various scent compounds.

Essential vessel for crafting perfume items.

The art of perfuming was once jealously guarded in the capital, but after the perfumers were drafted into service during the Shattering, the art became widely practiced throughout the Lands Between.

fields.name: Perfumer_s Cookbook
fields.short_description: A record of crafting techniques left by a military perfumer. Contains martial techniques beyond the repertoire of an ordinary physician.
fields.description:
A record of crafting techniques left by a military perfumer. Contains martial techniques beyond the repertoire of an ordinary physician.

Acquire the knowledge to craft the following:

Spark Aromatic
Uplifting Aromatic

fields.name: Poisonbloom
fields.short_description: Flower that grows in toxic terrain. Material used for crafting items.
fields.description:
Flower that grows in toxic terrain. Material used for crafting items.

Dripping with a deep-green poisonous liquid.

fields.name: Purifying Crystal Tear
fields.short_description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
fields.description:
A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.

Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. The resulting concoction purifies the curse from Mohg, Lord of Blood's terrifying rite of blood.

fields.name: Radahn_s Great Rune
fields.short_description: A Great Rune of the shardbearer Radahn. Its blessing raises maximum HP, FP and Stamina.
fields.description:
A Great Rune of the shardbearer Radahn. Its blessing raises maximum HP, FP and Stamina.

Radahn was amongst the children of Rennala and Radagon, who became demigod stepchildren after Radagon's union with Queen Marika.

The Great Rune burns, to resist the encroachment of the scarlet rot.

fields.name: Radahn_s Great Rune
fields.short_description: A relic catalogued from the Ashen archives.
fields.description: A fragment of a forgotten age, recorded by the Emporium. Its true purpose is veiled, but its presence is undeniable.

fields.name: Red-Hot Whetblade
fields.short_description: Red-hot whetblade with a cipher engraved. Can be used as a whetstone knife.
fields.description:
Red-hot whetblade with a cipher engraved. Can be used as a whetstone knife.

When applying an affinity using physical or flame-type ashes of war, an additional affinity of fire or flame art can be chosen.

fields.name: Rimed Crystal Bud
fields.short_description: A young plant, frozen into a crystal before it could mature. Material used for crafting items.
fields.description:
A young plant, frozen into a crystal before it could mature. Material used for crafting items.

Widely found in cold regions.

fields.name: Rimed Rowa
fields.short_description: A berry-like fruit, thought to be the original strain of Rowa. Material used for crafting items. Found in frigid highlands.
fields.description:
A berry-like fruit, thought to be the original strain of Rowa. Material used for crafting items. Found in frigid highlands.

This hardy species takes root even when frozen solid.

fields.name: Ritual Pot
fields.short_description: This empty pot somehow mends itself when broken. Special item with greater durability than a cracked pot.
fields.description:
This empty pot somehow mends itself when broken. Special item with greater durability than a cracked pot.

Essential vessel for crafting ritual pot items.

The materials and magics sealed within deploy their effects when the pot is thrown.

fields.name: Rold Medallion
fields.short_description: Conjoined split medallion depicting the Flame Peak.
fields.description:
Conjoined split medallion depicting the Flame Peak.

Brandishing the medallion activates the Grand Lift of Rold, connecting Leyndell to the Mountaintops of the Giants.

The forge of the flame of ruin is said to be found upon their peaks, and it is here Melina wishes to travel in resuming your journey together.

fields.name: Root Resin
fields.short_description: Resin secreted from the roots of the Greattree. Can also be found near trees on the surface. Material used in crafting items.
fields.description:
Resin secreted from the roots of the Greattree. Can also be found near trees on the surface. Material used in crafting items.

The roots of the Greattree were once linked to those of the Erdtree, or so they say, and it is for this reason catacombs are built around Greattree roots.

fields.name: Rowa Fruit
fields.short_description: Berry-like red fruits that grow in shrubs. Material used for crafting items.
fields.description:
Berry-like red fruits that grow in shrubs. Material used for crafting items.

Easily found everywhere in the Lands Between, it has a wide variety of uses.

fields.name: Royal House Scroll
fields.short_description: Sorcery scroll of the Carian royal family, the heads of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.
fields.description:
Sorcery scroll of the Carian royal family, the heads of the Academy of Raya Lucaria.

Can be given to a learned sorcerer to gain access to the following sorceries:

Glintblade Phalanx
Carian Slicer

fields.name: Ruin Fragment
fields.short_description: Stone fragment found near places where ruins have fallen from the sky. Can be used for crafting, or simply for throwing at enemies.
fields.description:
Stone fragment found near places where ruins have fallen from the sky. Can be used for crafting, or simply for throwing at enemies.

These shards of stone are believed to have once been part of a temple in the sky. They glow with a faint light from within.

fields.name: Ruptured Crystal Tear
fields.short_description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
fields.description:
A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.

Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. Causes the resulting concoction to explode.

A defective crystal tear which possesses absolutely no medicinal qualities. A lesson said to be learned the hard way for some; faith can be a volatile matter, after all.

fields.name: Ruptured Crystal Tear
fields.short_description: A relic catalogued from the Ashen archives.
fields.description: A fragment of a forgotten age, recorded by the Emporium. Its true purpose is veiled, but its presence is undeniable.

fields.name: Rusty Key
fields.short_description: Rusted iron key.
fields.description:
Rusted iron key.

Opens a locked door in Stormveil Castle.

fields.name: Rya_s Necklace
fields.short_description: A necklace worn and treasured by Irina. Given to her as a farewell gift.
fields.description: A necklace worn and treasured by Irina. Given to her as a farewell gift.

fields.name: Rykard_s Great Rune
fields.short_description: A Great Rune of the shardbearer Rykard. Its blessing restores HP upon defeating enemies.
fields.description:
A Great Rune of the shardbearer Rykard. Its blessing restores HP upon defeating enemies.

Rykard was amongst the children of Rennala and Radagon, who became demigod stepchildren after Radagon's union with Queen Marika.

But Rykard fed himself to the blasphemous serpent, Great Rune and all.

fields.name: Rykard_s Great Rune
fields.short_description: A relic catalogued from the Ashen archives.
fields.description: A fragment of a forgotten age, recorded by the Emporium. Its true purpose is veiled, but its presence is undeniable.

fields.name: Sacramental Bud
fields.short_description: An immature bud containing fresh blood. Material used for crafting items.
fields.description:
An immature bud containing fresh blood. Material used for crafting items.

Believed to originate long ago from a strain of buds cultivated with youthful, sacramental blood.

fields.name: Sanctified Whetblade
fields.short_description: Sanctified whetblade with a cipher engraved. Can be used as a whetstone knife.
fields.description:
Sanctified whetblade with a cipher engraved. Can be used as a whetstone knife.

When applying an affinity using physical or golden-type ashes of war, an additional affinity of sacred or lightning can be chosen.

fields.name: Sanctuary Stone
fields.short_description: A rare piece of stone fragment found near places where ruins have fallen from the sky. Material used for crafting items.
fields.description:
A rare piece of stone fragment found near places where ruins have fallen from the sky. Material used for crafting items.

It feeds and strengthens the light as it shines.

fields.name: Seedbed Curse
fields.short_description: Curse grown on a corpse killed and defiled by the Dung Eater. A tender pox afflicted with omen horns.
fields.description:
Curse grown on a corpse killed and defiled by the Dung Eater. A tender pox afflicted with omen horns.

The Dung Eater cultivates the seedbed curse on corpses.

By doing so he prevents dead souls returning to the Erdtree, leaving them forever cursed. One of the most loathsome things found in all the Lands Between.

fields.name: Sellen_s Primal Glintstone
fields.short_description: Glintstone from within the sorceress Sellen's body. Seemingly half-alive, blood vessels are visible within.
fields.description:
Glintstone from within the sorceress Sellen's body. Seemingly half-alive, blood vessels are visible within.

In essence, a primal glintstone is a sorcerer's soul. If transplanted into a compatible new body, Sellen will rise again.

"My apprentice, do you think it distasteful?"

fields.name: Sellian Sealbreaker
fields.short_description: Glintstone key received from the sorceress Sellen.
fields.description:
Glintstone key received from the sorceress Sellen.

Capable of breaking the seal that keeps Master Lusat confined.

Sellia, Town of Sorcery can be found in Caelid. This key was said to have been found in the possession of a Sellian sorcerer.

fields.name: Seluvis_s Bell Bearing
fields.short_description: Preceptor Seluvis's bell bearing, found upon his perished flesh.
fields.description:
Preceptor Seluvis's bell bearing, found upon his perished flesh.

Offer to the Twin Maiden Husks at the Roundtable Hold to gain access to new items.

fields.name: Seluvis_s Introduction
fields.short_description: Scroll bearing a royal coat of arms. A letter of introduction written by Preceptor Seluvis.
fields.description:
Scroll bearing a royal coat of arms. A letter of introduction written by Preceptor Seluvis.

Addressed to a glintstone sorceress by the name of Sellen.

The contents of the scroll cannot be discerned.

fields.name: Seluvis_s Potion
fields.short_description: Small flask received from Preceptor Seluvis containing a cloudy tonic of bluish black.
fields.description:
Small flask received from Preceptor Seluvis containing a cloudy tonic of bluish black.

"Find Nepheli, and ensure she drinks it."

fields.name: Serpent_s Amnion
fields.short_description: Amnion from the mother's womb which cradled the poor unwanted offspring of a repellant birthing ritual.
fields.description:
Amnion from the mother's womb which cradled the poor unwanted offspring of a repellant birthing ritual.

It will never dry out, remaining damp indefinitely.

fields.name: Sewer-Gaol Key
fields.short_description: Filthy key received from the Dung Eater.
fields.description:
Filthy key received from the Dung Eater.

Unlocks sewer-gaol door said to lie beneath Leyndell, the Royal Capital.

fields.name: Sewing Needle
fields.short_description: A large sewing needle, curved like a fang. Boc the demi-human's prized possession.
fields.description: A large sewing needle, curved like a fang. Boc the demi-human's prized possession.

fields.name: Shabriri Grape
fields.short_description: A yellowing, oozing eyeball of the infirm. The surface is shriveled, and the inside is squishy, not unlike a large, overly-ripe grape.
fields.description:
A yellowing, oozing eyeball of the infirm. The surface is shriveled, and the inside is squishy, not unlike a large, overly-ripe grape.

Give to the blind maiden to guide her to the distant light.

fields.name: Silver Firefly
fields.short_description: Firefly that gives off a silvery light. Material used in crafting items. Found near bodies of cold water untouched by sunlight.
fields.description:
Firefly that gives off a silvery light. Material used in crafting items. Found near bodies of cold water untouched by sunlight.

The light of fireflies is believed to have an alluring magic. Silver light is considered to invite riches.

fields.name: Silver Tear Husk
fields.short_description: A hardened husk shed by a formless life form known as the Silver Tear, found in and around the Eternal City. Material used for crafting items.
fields.description:
A hardened husk shed by a formless life form known as the Silver Tear, found in and around the Eternal City. Material used for crafting items.

The Silver Tear makes mockery of life, reborn again and again into imitation. Perhaps, one day, it will be reborn a lord...

fields.name: Sliver of Meat
fields.short_description: A slice of thinly carved beast flesh. Material used for crafting items. Found by hunting herbivorous beasts.
fields.description:
A slice of thinly carved beast flesh. Material used for crafting items. Found by hunting herbivorous beasts.

The dried meat toughens the constitution.

fields.name: Slumbering Egg
fields.short_description: Owl eggs that will never hatch. Material used for crafting items.
fields.description:
Owl eggs that will never hatch. Material used for crafting items.

Prized as a symbol of the most sublime slumber.

fields.name: Smoldering Butterfly
fields.short_description: An eternally burning butterfly found near wildfires and elsewhere. Material used for crafting items.
fields.description:
An eternally burning butterfly found near wildfires and elsewhere. Material used for crafting items.

Serves as the kindling for a number of items.

fields.name: Speckled Hardtear
fields.short_description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
fields.description:
A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.

Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. The resulting concoction temporarily raises all resistances and heals all status ailments.

fields.name: Spiked Cracked Tear
fields.short_description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
fields.description:
A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.

Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. The resulting concoction increases the power of charged attacks for a certain duration.

fields.name: Spirit Calling Bell
fields.short_description: A bell capable of summoning various spirits from ashen remains. It usually requires FP to use.
fields.description:
A bell capable of summoning various spirits from ashen remains. It usually requires FP to use.

Spirits can only be summoned in the vicinity of a rebirth monument. When summoning is possible, the monument icon will be visible on the left side of the screen.

Only one type of spirit may be summoned at once, and none may be summoned during multiplayer.

fields.name: Stonebarb Cracked Tear
fields.short_description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
fields.description:
A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.

Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. The resulting concoction makes one's attacks more likely to break enemy stances. However, the effect lasts only for a short time.

fields.name: Stonesword Key
fields.short_description: A sword-shaped stone key.
fields.description:
A sword-shaped stone key.

Breaks the seal on imp statues, but remains embedded in the statue after use, meaning it can only be used once as an item.

Think well before using one.

fields.name: Stormhawk Feather
fields.short_description: A feather from a hawk that lived as one with the storms. Material used for crafting items.
fields.description:
A feather from a hawk that lived as one with the storms. Material used for crafting items.

These feathers, enveloped in swirling winds, are often used for arrow fletching.

fields.name: Stormhawk King
fields.short_description: A relic catalogued from the Ashen archives.
fields.description: A fragment of a forgotten age, recorded by the Emporium. Its true purpose is veiled, but its presence is undeniable.

fields.name: Strength-Knot Crystal Tear
fields.short_description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
fields.description:
A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.

Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. The resulting concoction temporarily boosts one's strength.

fields.name: String
fields.short_description: Boasting no special qualities, this is merely a goodly length of string.
fields.description:
Boasting no special qualities, this is merely a goodly length of string.

Material used for crafting items. Often carried by demi-humans.

Used to make certain items easier to use.

fields.name: Strip of White Flesh
fields.short_description: Thin strips of flesh taken from a bloodless creature. Material used for crafting items.
fields.description:
Thin strips of flesh taken from a bloodless creature. Material used for crafting items.

The dried meat toughens the constitution, boosting resistance. It's known for its long-lasting effect.

fields.name: Tailoring Tools
fields.short_description: A portable set of tailoring tools.
fields.description:
A portable set of tailoring tools.

Enables armor alterations at sites of grace.

fields.name: Talisman Pouch
fields.short_description: Small, withered bag, knitted by hand. Bestowed upon the ruling lord, or those attempting to become lord, by the elderly Finger Reader.
fields.description:
Small, withered bag, knitted by hand. Bestowed upon the ruling lord, or those attempting to become lord, by the elderly Finger Reader.

Increases talisman equip slots.

As the voices of the Two Fingers, Finger Readers are said to live lives eternal, and one is even supposed to have served as a wetnurse to royalty.

fields.name: Tarnished Golden Sunflower
fields.short_description: A large flower that blooms facing the Erdtree. Material used for crafting items. Found near Minor Erdtrees.
fields.description:
A large flower that blooms facing the Erdtree. Material used for crafting items. Found near Minor Erdtrees.

Though wilted and faded, it still retains holy essence.

fields.name: Thin Animal Bones
fields.short_description: A relic catalogued from the Ashen archives.
fields.description: A fragment of a forgotten age, recorded by the Emporium. Its true purpose is veiled, but its presence is undeniable.

fields.name: Thorny Cracked Tear
fields.short_description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
fields.description:
A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.

Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. The resulting concoction makes consecutive attacks grow stronger the longer they continue. However, the effect lasts only for a short time.

fields.name: Tonic of Forgetfulness
fields.short_description: Tonic in a small brass vial.
fields.description:
Tonic in a small brass vial.

Banishes distress and bitter memories.

A gift bestowed by Rykard, sworn to blasphemy, to Lady Tanith, who unfortunately had no use for it. "My Lord, there could be no greater distress than to forget you."

fields.name: Toxic Mushroom
fields.short_description: A mushroom covered in toxic mold that grows in rotten lands. Material used for crafting items.
fields.description:
A mushroom covered in toxic mold that grows in rotten lands. Material used for crafting items.

A skilled hand can repurpose its toxic mold into an effective ward against scarlet rot.

fields.name: Trina_s Lily
fields.short_description: A light-purple water lily that is on the verge of wilting. Material used for crafting items. Exceedingly rare to find.
fields.description:
A light-purple water lily that is on the verge of wilting. Material used for crafting items. Exceedingly rare to find.

A symbol of faith in St. Trina. Dulls the senses, preventing agitation.

fields.name: Turtle Neck Meat
fields.short_description: A splendid, lengthy cut of turtle neck meat. Material used for crafting items.
fields.description:
A splendid, lengthy cut of turtle neck meat. Material used for crafting items.

Considered an especially nutritious ingredient In the south of the Lands Between.

fields.name: Twiggy Crystal Tear
fields.short_description: A relic catalogued from the Ashen archives.
fields.description: A fragment of a forgotten age, recorded by the Emporium. Its true purpose is veiled, but its presence is undeniable.

fields.name: Two Fingers Prayerbook
fields.short_description: Prayerbook containing incantations of the Two Fingers. An item once entrusted to Tarnished worthy of lordship.
fields.description:
Prayerbook containing incantations of the Two Fingers. An item once entrusted to Tarnished worthy of lordship.

Can be given to a learned cleric to gain access to the following incantations:

Lord's Heal
Lord's Aid

fields.name: Unalloyed Gold Needle
fields.short_description: An intricately crafted needle of unalloyed gold. Removed by Millicent from her flesh. Bears no trace of befouled blood, but is faintly moist with dew.
fields.description:
An intricately crafted needle of unalloyed gold. Removed by Millicent from her flesh. Bears no trace of befouled blood, but is faintly moist with dew.

"There is something I must return to Malenia. The dignity, the sense of self, that allowed her to resist the call of the scarlet rot."

fields.name: Unalloyed Gold Needle
