fields.short_description: A relic catalogued from the Ashen archives.
fields.description: A fragment of a forgotten age, recorded by the Emporium. Its true purpose is veiled, but its presence is undeniable.

fields.name: Unalloyed Gold Needle
fields.short_description: A relic catalogued from the Ashen archives.
fields.description: A fragment of a forgotten age, recorded by the Emporium. Its true purpose is veiled, but its presence is undeniable.

fields.name: Valkyrie_s Prosthesis
fields.short_description: Golden prosthesis once used by the one-armed valkyrie. A masterwork of craftsmanship, with practice and skill it can be used as proficiently as a real arm.
fields.description:
Golden prosthesis once used by the one-armed valkyrie. A masterwork of craftsmanship, with practice and skill it can be used as proficiently as a real arm.

When Maleigh Marais, Lord of the Shaded Castle, embraced this prosthesis, he claimed to feel the presence of his personal goddess.

fields.name: Volcanic Stone
fields.short_description: A smoldering rock containing hot gas. Material used for crafting items.
fields.description:
A smoldering rock containing hot gas. Material used for crafting items.

Found on Mt. Gelmir.

fields.name: Volcano Manor Invitation
fields.short_description: Letter given by Rya as thanks for retrieving her necklace.
fields.description:
Letter given by Rya as thanks for retrieving her necklace.

Contains an invitation to Volcano Manor.

"Brave Tarnished, Seek the Altus Plateau in the realm of the Erdtree.

Prove yourself by making this journey, and the Volcano Manor will fully extend its invitation. To fight, amongst a family of champions."

fields.name: Weathered Dagger
fields.short_description: Dagger received from Fia, the Deathbed Companion.
fields.description:
Dagger received from Fia, the Deathbed Companion.

She wishes for it to be returned to its rightful owner.

It was once a special weapon of gold and silver intertwined, but is now worn down and marred by a black gash.

fields.name: Weathered Map
fields.short_description: A relic catalogued from the Ashen archives.
fields.description: A fragment of a forgotten age, recorded by the Emporium. Its true purpose is veiled, but its presence is undeniable.

fields.name: Weathered Map
fields.short_description: A relic catalogued from the Ashen archives.
fields.description: A fragment of a forgotten age, recorded by the Emporium. Its true purpose is veiled, but its presence is undeniable.

fields.name: Whetstone Knife
fields.short_description: Whetstone with a cipher inscription, made to look like a small knifeblade.
fields.description:
Whetstone with a cipher inscription, made to look like a small knifeblade.

Allows the use of ashes of war at a site of grace to bestow new battle arts and affinities to armaments as skills.

The battle arts and affinities will depend on the ashes of war used.

fields.name: Windy Crystal Tear
fields.short_description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
fields.description:
A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.

Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. The resulting concoction increases the effectiveness of dodge rolls for a certain duration. However, damage taken is also increased during the concoction's effect.

fields.name: Winged Crystal Tear
fields.short_description: A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.
fields.description:
A crystal tear formed slowly over the ages where the Erdtree's bounty falls to the ground.

Can be mixed in the Flask of Wondrous Physick. Temporarily reduces equipment load.

fields.name: Yellow Ember
fields.short_description: An ember taken from the eye socket of a corpse. Material used for crafting items.
fields.description:
An ember taken from the eye socket of a corpse. Material used for crafting items.

A sign that the deceased suffered from the flame of frenzy. This grape has ripened and burst.

fields.name: Ancestral Spirit_s Horn
fields.short_description: Item cut from the horns of the Regal Ancestor Spirit.
fields.description:
Item cut from the horns of the Regal Ancestor Spirit.

Restore FP upon defeating enemies.

A number of new growths bud from the antler-like horns of the fallen king, each glowing with light. Thus does new life grow from death, and from death, one obtains power.

ArtsName.fmg

fields.name: Arrow_s Reach Talisman
fields.short_description: A talisman depicting three arrows. Carried by hunters of beasts.
fields.description:
A talisman depicting three arrows. Carried by hunters of beasts.

Increases the effective range of bows.

fields.name: Arrow_s Sting Talisman
fields.short_description: A talisman depicting three iron arrows. Carried by soldiers long ago.
fields.description:
A talisman depicting three iron arrows. Carried by soldiers long ago.

Raises attack power of arrows and bolts.

fields.name: Arsenal Charm +1
fields.short_description: An iron charm that resembles a mass of weaponry. Greatly boosts maximum equipment load.
fields.description:
An iron charm that resembles a mass of weaponry. Greatly boosts maximum equipment load.

This talisman was derived from an unusual greatsword once wielded by a hero hungry for vengeance.

fields.name: Arsenal Charm
fields.short_description: An iron charm that resembles a mass of weaponry. Boosts maximum equipment load.
fields.description:
An iron charm that resembles a mass of weaponry. Boosts maximum equipment load.

This talisman was derived from an unusual greatsword once wielded by a hero hungry for vengeance.

fields.name: Assassin_s Cerulean Dagger
fields.short_description: An assassin's dagger, misshapen and stained in cerulean. Critical hits restore FP.
fields.description:
An assassin's dagger, misshapen and stained in cerulean. Critical hits restore FP.

This charm is modelled after the darkly gleaming blades used in the Night of Black Knives. Those which gave the demigods their first taste of Death.

fields.name: Assassin_s Crimson Dagger
fields.short_description: An assassin's dagger, misshapen and stained in crimson. Critical hits restore HP.
fields.description:
An assassin's dagger, misshapen and stained in crimson. Critical hits restore HP.

This charm is modelled after the darkly gleaming blades used in the Night of Black Knives. Those which gave the demigods their first taste of Death.

fields.name: Axe Talisman
fields.short_description: A talisman depicting an axe and a warrior. Enhances charge attacks.
fields.description:
A talisman depicting an axe and a warrior. Enhances charge attacks.

The Lord who led the Long March bore an axe, and his loyal warriors honored him by wielding axes of their own, making them very effective at dealing decisive blows.

fields.name: Blessed Dew Talisman
fields.short_description: Talisman depicting a drop of the Erdtree's sap, a blessed boon.
fields.description:
Talisman depicting a drop of the Erdtree's sap, a blessed boon.

Gradually restores HP.

It was once thought that the blessed sap of the Erdtree would drip from its boughs foreverbut that age of plenty swiftly came to a close, and with time, the Erdtree became more an object of faith.

fields.name: Blue Dancer Charm
fields.short_description: A cloth doll depicting a dancer garbed in blue. An ancient heirloom of some sort.
fields.description:
A cloth doll depicting a dancer garbed in blue. An ancient heirloom of some sort.

Raises attack power with lower equipment load.

The dancer in blue represents a fairy, who in legend bestowed a flowing sword upon a blind swordsman. Blade in hand, the swordsman sealed away an ancient goda god that was Rot itself.

fields.name: Blue-Feathered Branch Sword
fields.short_description: A talisman adorned with blue feathers, once used in ancient death rituals. Raises defense when HP is low.
fields.description:
A talisman adorned with blue feathers, once used in ancient death rituals. Raises defense when HP is low.

The heart sings when one draws close to death, and thus does one cling so tenaciously to lifeto render up a death worth offering.

fields.name: Boltdrake Talisman +1
fields.short_description: Talisman depicting a duo of yellow ancient dragons. Greatly boosts lightning damage negation.
fields.description:
Talisman depicting a duo of yellow ancient dragons. Greatly boosts lightning damage negation.

The ancient dragons, who ruled in the prehistoric era before the Erdtree, would protect their lord as a wall of living rock. And so it is that the shape of the dragon has become symbolic of all manner of protections.

fields.name: Boltdrake Talisman +2
fields.short_description: Talisman depicting a trio of yellow ancient dragons. Vastly boosts lightning damage negation.
fields.description:
Talisman depicting a trio of yellow ancient dragons. Vastly boosts lightning damage negation.

The ancient dragons, who ruled in the prehistoric era before the Erdtree, would protect their lord as a wall of living rock. And so it is that the shape of the dragon has become symbolic of all manner of protections.

fields.name: Boltdrake Talisman
fields.short_description: Talisman depicting a yellow ancient dragon. Boosts lightning damage negation.
fields.description:
Talisman depicting a yellow ancient dragon. Boosts lightning damage negation.

The ancient dragons, who ruled in the prehistoric era before the Erdtree, would protect their lord as a wall of living rock. And so it is that the shape of the dragon has become symbolic of all manner of protections.

fields.name: Bull-Goat_s Talisman
fields.short_description: A talisman depicting the horns of a bull-goat. Raises poise.
fields.description:
A talisman depicting the horns of a bull-goat. Raises poise.

Bull-goats are associated with the stout and mighty Tragoth, said to be unflinching in combatnow a silent comrade to those who fight.

fields.name: Carian Filigreed Crest
fields.short_description: A talisman adorned with the royal crest.
fields.description:
A talisman adorned with the royal crest.

Lowers FP consumed by skills.

An honor said to have once been awarded to Carian knights who served as direct retainers to the kingdom's princesses. Now there is only one princess: Ranni, daughter of Rennala.

fields.name: Cerulean Amber Medallion +1
fields.short_description: A medallion with cerulean amber inlaid. Greatly boosts maximum FP.
fields.description:
A medallion with cerulean amber inlaid. Greatly boosts maximum FP.

The Erdtree's old sap becomes amber, treasured as the most precious of jewels in the age of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord.

A primordial life energy resides inside.

fields.name: Cerulean Amber Medallion +2
fields.short_description: A medallion with cerulean amber inlaid. Vastly boosts maximum FP.
fields.description:
A medallion with cerulean amber inlaid. Vastly boosts maximum FP.

The Erdtree's old sap becomes amber, treasured as the most precious of jewels in the age of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord.

A primordial life energy resides inside.

fields.name: Cerulean Amber Medallion
fields.short_description: A medallion with cerulean amber inlaid. Boosts maximum FP.
fields.description:
A medallion with cerulean amber inlaid. Boosts maximum FP.

The Erdtree's old sap becomes amber, treasured as the most precious of jewels in the age of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord.

A primordial life energy resides inside.

fields.name: Cerulean Seed Talisman
fields.short_description: A cerulean-colored talisman patterned after an Erdtree seed. Boosts FP restoration from the Flask of Cerulean Tears.
fields.description:
A cerulean-colored talisman patterned after an Erdtree seed. Boosts FP restoration from the Flask of Cerulean Tears.

The Erdtree was once perfect and eternal, and thus was it believed that Erdtree seeds could not exist.

fields.name: Clarifying Horn Charm
fields.short_description: An accoutrement worn by the ancestral followers. Raises focus. (Focus governs resistance to sleep and madness.)
fields.description:
An accoutrement worn by the ancestral followers. Raises focus. (Focus governs resistance to sleep and madness.)

Said to be a budding horn. The ancestral followers believe that the horns of a long-lived beast continue to bud like antlers, over and over again, until the beast one day becomes an ancestral spirit.

fields.name: Clarifying Horn Charm
fields.short_description: A relic catalogued from the Ashen archives.
fields.description: A fragment of a forgotten age, recorded by the Emporium. Its true purpose is veiled, but its presence is undeniable.

fields.name: Claw Talisman
fields.short_description: A talisman depicting a claw and an assassin. Enhances jump attacks.
fields.description:
A talisman depicting a claw and an assassin. Enhances jump attacks.

The assassins of Ravenmount are killers by trade. They assail their victims while dressed as birds of prey.

fields.name: Companion Jar
fields.short_description: A talisman given by the jars to their friends. Raises potency of thrown jars.
fields.description:
A talisman given by the jars to their friends. Raises potency of thrown jars.

Though the jars are brought to life by human flesh and blood, they are all rather kindly folk. Perhaps they were made to be better than their innards.

fields.name: Concealing Veil
fields.short_description: Talisman put together from dark cloth with a lustrous sheen.
fields.description:
Talisman put together from dark cloth with a lustrous sheen.

Completely conceals the wearer's presence while crouching at a distance from foes.

Part of one of the concealing veils used by the assassins on the Night of Black Knives.

fields.name: Crepus_s Vial
fields.short_description: Small mysterious bottle with a dark mist sealed within.
fields.description:
Small mysterious bottle with a dark mist sealed within.

Eliminates all sound made by the wearer during movement.

A ritual implement used by Roundtable Hold assassins. There was a time when Tarnished who had strayed from guidance feared nothing more than utter silence.

fields.name: Crimson Amber Medallion +1
fields.short_description: A medallion with crimson amber inlaid. Greatly boosts maximum HP.
fields.description:
A medallion with crimson amber inlaid. Greatly boosts maximum HP.

The Erdtree's old sap becomes amber, treasured as the most precious of jewels in the age of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord.

A primordial life energy resides inside.

fields.name: Crimson Amber Medallion +2
fields.short_description: A medallion with crimson amber inlaid. Vastly boosts maximum HP.
fields.description:
A medallion with crimson amber inlaid. Vastly boosts maximum HP.

The Erdtree's old sap becomes amber, treasured as the most precious of jewels in the age of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord.

A primordial life energy resides inside.

fields.name: Crimson Amber Medallion
fields.short_description: A medallion with crimson amber inlaid. Boosts maximum HP.
fields.description:
A medallion with crimson amber inlaid. Boosts maximum HP.

The Erdtree's old sap becomes amber, treasured as the most precious of jewels in the age of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord.

A primordial life energy resides inside.

fields.name: Crimson Seed Talisman
fields.short_description: A crimson-colored talisman patterned after an Erdtree seed. Boosts HP restoration from the Flask of Crimson Tears.
fields.description:
A crimson-colored talisman patterned after an Erdtree seed. Boosts HP restoration from the Flask of Crimson Tears.

The Erdtree was once perfect and eternal, and thus was it believed that Erdtree seeds could not exist.

fields.name: Crucible Feather Talisman
fields.short_description: A talisman fashioned from feathers that embody the aspects of various creatures. Said to have grown on the human body long ago.
fields.description:
A talisman fashioned from feathers that embody the aspects of various creatures. Said to have grown on the human body long ago.

Improves the effectiveness of dodge rolls, but increases damage taken at all times.

A vestige of the crucible of primordial life. Born partially of devolution, it was considered a signifier of the divine in ancient times, but is now increasingly disdained as an impurity as civilization has advanced.

fields.name: Crucible Knot Talisman
fields.short_description: A talisman fashioned from a bony knot that embodies the aspects of various creatures. Said to have grown on the human body long ago.
fields.description:
A talisman fashioned from a bony knot that embodies the aspects of various creatures. Said to have grown on the human body long ago.

Reduces damage and impact of headshots taken.

A vestige of the crucible of primordial life. Born partially of devolution, it was considered a signifier of the divine in ancient times, but is now increasingly disdained as an impurity as civilization has advanced.

fields.name: Crucible Scale Talisman
fields.short_description: A talisman fashioned from a scale that embodies the aspects of various creatures. Said to have grown on the human body long ago.
fields.description:
A talisman fashioned from a scale that embodies the aspects of various creatures. Said to have grown on the human body long ago.

Reduces damage taken from critical hits.

A vestige of the crucible of primordial life. Born partially of devolution, it was considered a signifier of the divine in ancient times, but is now increasingly disdained as an impurity as civilization has advanced.

fields.name: Curved Sword Talisman
fields.short_description: A talisman depicting a curved sword and a swordsman. Enhances guard counters.
fields.description:
A talisman depicting a curved sword and a swordsman. Enhances guard counters.

It is said that a blind swordsman was the originator of this techniquethe art of allowing one's opponent to strike so as to leave them vulnerable to a well-timed reply.

fields.name: Daedicar_s Woe
fields.short_description: Disturbing likeness of a woman whose skin was flayed. She smiles with a serene tenderness.
fields.description:
Disturbing likeness of a woman whose skin was flayed. She smiles with a serene tenderness.

Increases damage taken.

It is said that this woman, named Daedica, indulged in every form of adultery and wicked pleasure imaginable, giving birth to a myriad of grotesque children.

fields.name: Dagger Talisman
fields.short_description: A talisman depicting a dagger and a surgeon. Enhances critical hits.
fields.description:
A talisman depicting a dagger and a surgeon. Enhances critical hits.

The white-garbed field surgeons come to the aid of friend and foe alike by dealing a final deadly thrust to spare them from the prolonged agony of a mortal wound. A sense of mercy is a catalyst for bloodlust.

fields.name: Dragoncrest Greatshield Talisman
fields.short_description: Legendary talisman of wrought iron depicting a massive ancient dragon. Enormously boosts physical damage negation.
fields.description:
Legendary talisman of wrought iron depicting a massive ancient dragon. Enormously boosts physical damage negation.

The ancient dragons, who ruled in the prehistoric era before the Erdtree, would protect their lord as a wall of living rock. And so it is that the shape of the dragon has become symbolic of all manner of protections.

fields.name: Dragoncrest Shield Talisman +1
fields.short_description: Wrought iron talisman depicting a duo of ancient dragons. Greatly boosts physical damage negation.

The ancient dragons, who ruled in the prehistoric era before the Erdtree, would protect their lord as a wall of living rock. And so it is that the shape of the dragon has become symbolic of all manner of protections.

fields.name: Erdtree_s Favor +1
fields.short_description: A talisman depicting a special blessing of the Erdtree. Raises maximum HP, stamina, and equip load.
fields.description:
A talisman depicting a special blessing of the Erdtree. Raises maximum HP, stamina, and equip load.

It is said that when the Age of the Erdtree began, such blessings were personally bestowed upon their recipients by Queen Marika herself.

fields.name: Erdtree_s Favor +2
fields.short_description: A legendary talisman depicting a special blessing of the Erdtree.
fields.description:
A legendary talisman depicting a special blessing of the Erdtree.

Greatly raises maximum HP, stamina, and equip load.

It is said that when the Age of the Erdtree began, such blessings were personally bestowed upon their recipients by Queen Marika herself.

fields.name: Erdtree_s Favor
fields.short_description: A talisman depicting a special blessing of the Erdtree. Slightly raises maximum HP, stamina, and equip load.
fields.description:
A talisman depicting a special blessing of the Erdtree. Slightly raises maximum HP, stamina, and equip load.

It is said that when the Age of the Erdtree began, such blessings were personally bestowed upon their recipients by Queen Marika herself.

fields.name: Faithful_s Canvas Talisman
fields.short_description: A talisman bearing an icon that depicts a group of masked figures. Raises potency of incantations.
fields.description:
A talisman bearing an icon that depicts a group of masked figures. Raises potency of incantations.

The figures represent the flock at prayer, their firm belief in the intangible inspiring even the solitary founder of their religion.

What is faith if not an affirmation?

fields.name: Fire Scorpion Charm
fields.short_description: A talisman carried by assassins who strike unseen. Patterned on a scorpion freshly shed of its exoskeleton, its claws seizing a heart that burns with fire.
fields.description:
A talisman carried by assassins who strike unseen. Patterned on a scorpion freshly shed of its exoskeleton, its claws seizing a heart that burns with fire.

Raises fire attack power, but lowers damage negation.

fields.name: Flamedrake Talisman +1
fields.short_description: Talisman depicting a duo of red ancient dragons. Greatly boosts fire damage negation.
fields.description:
Talisman depicting a duo of red ancient dragons. Greatly boosts fire damage negation.

The ancient dragons, who ruled in the prehistoric era before the Erdtree, would protect their lord as a wall of living rock. And so it is that the shape of the dragon has become symbolic of all manner of protections.

fields.name: Flamedrake Talisman +2
fields.short_description: Talisman depicting a trio of red ancient dragons. Vastly boosts fire damage negation.
fields.description:

The ancient dragons, who ruled in the prehistoric era before the Erdtree, would protect their lord as a wall of living rock. And so it is that the shape of the dragon has become symbolic of all manner of protections.

fields.short_description: Talisman depicting a red ancient dragon. Boosts fire damage negation.
fields.description:
Talisman depicting a red ancient dragon. Boosts fire damage negation.

The ancient dragons, who ruled in the prehistoric era before the Erdtree, would protect their lord as a wall of living rock. And so it is that the shape of the dragon has become symbolic of all manner of protections.

fields.name: Flock_s Canvas Talisman
fields.short_description: A talisman bearing an icon that depicts a mass of masked figures. Greatly raises potency of incantations.
fields.description:
A talisman bearing an icon that depicts a mass of masked figures. Greatly raises potency of incantations.

The figures represent the flock at prayer, their firm belief in the intangible inspiring even the solitary founder of their religion.

What is faith if not an affirmation?

fields.name: Furled Finger_s Trick Mirror
fields.short_description: A small, clouded mirror that reflects an image of a golden figure.
fields.description:
A small, clouded mirror that reflects an image of a golden figure.

Makes the bearer take on the appearance of a Host of Fingers.

One of the ritual implements created by the Tarnished to deceive invaders.

fields.name: Godfrey Icon
fields.short_description: A legendary talisman depicting the Elden Lord Godfrey. Raises charge attack power of sorceries, incantations, and skills.
fields.description:
A legendary talisman depicting the Elden Lord Godfrey. Raises charge attack power of sorceries, incantations, and skills.

Godfrey was a ferocious warrior. When he vowed to become a lord, he took the Beast Regent Serosh upon on his back to suppress the ceaseless lust for battle that raged within.

fields.name: Godskin Swaddling Cloth
fields.short_description: Sacred cloth of the Godskin Apostles, made from supple skin sewn together.
fields.description:
Sacred cloth of the Godskin Apostles, made from supple skin sewn together.

Successive attacks restore HP.

The Gloam-Eyed Queen cradles newborn apostles swaddled in this cloth. Soon they will grow to become the death of the gods.

fields.name: Gold Scarab
fields.short_description: A talisman facsimile of a scarab, the carrier of treasures and precious things.
fields.description:
A talisman facsimile of a scarab, the carrier of treasures and precious things.

This golden scarab increases the amount of runes obtained from defeating enemies.

fields.name: Graven-Mass Talisman
fields.short_description: A talisman depicting the first school of graven magesa nightmare that would continue to haunt the academy.
fields.description:
A talisman depicting the first school of graven magesa nightmare that would continue to haunt the academy.

Greatly raises potency of sorceries.

The primeval current is a forbidden tradition of glintstone sorcery. To those who cleave to its teachings, the act of collecting sorcerers to fashion them into the seeds of stars is but another path of scientific inquiry.

fields.name: Graven-School Talisman
fields.short_description: A talisman depicting a school of graven mages, the nightmare of the academy.
fields.description:
A talisman depicting a school of graven mages, the nightmare of the academy.

Raises potency of sorceries.

The primeval current is a forbidden tradition of glintstone sorcery. To those who cleave to its teachings, the act of collecting sorcerers to fashion them into the seeds of stars is but another path of scientific inquiry.

fields.name: Great-Jar_s Arsenal
fields.short_description: A charm that resembles a great jar overflowing with weaponry. Vastly boosts maximum equipment load.
fields.description:
A charm that resembles a great jar overflowing with weaponry. Vastly boosts maximum equipment load.

The great jar grants this talisman to their warriors. Carry as much as you cangrow big and strong.

fields.name: Greatshield Talisman
fields.short_description: Talisman depicting a knight holding a greatshield. Boosts guarding ability.
fields.description:
Talisman depicting a knight holding a greatshield. Boosts guarding ability.

The knights of Leyndell once modelled themselves after the Tree Sentinels. Their purpose is to protect that which deserves protection, and thus the shield always comes before the sword.

fields.name: Green Turtle Talisman
fields.short_description: A talisman in the shape of a green turtle. Raises stamina recovery speed.
fields.description:
A talisman in the shape of a green turtle. Raises stamina recovery speed.

Turtles are known as a nutritious ingredient, symbolic of inexhaustible power.

However, those who hold turtles to be wise creatures consider the practice of eating their meat to be barbarous.

fields.name: Haligdrake Talisman +1
fields.short_description: Talisman depicting a duo of golden ancient dragons. Greatly boosts holy damage negation.
fields.description:
Talisman depicting a duo of golden ancient dragons. Greatly boosts holy damage negation.

The ancient dragons, who ruled in the prehistoric era before the Erdtree, would protect their lord as a wall of living rock. And so it is that the shape of the dragon has become symbolic of all manner of protections.

fields.name: Haligdrake Talisman +2
fields.short_description: Talisman depicting a trio of golden ancient dragons. Vastly boosts holy damage negation.
fields.description:
Talisman depicting a trio of golden ancient dragons. Vastly boosts holy damage negation.

The ancient dragons, who ruled in the prehistoric era before the Erdtree, would protect their lord as a wall of living rock. And so it is that the shape of the dragon has become symbolic of all manner of protections.

fields.name: Haligdrake Talisman
fields.short_description: Talisman depicting a golden ancient dragon. Boosts holy damage negation.
fields.description:
Talisman depicting a golden ancient dragon. Boosts holy damage negation.

The ancient dragons, who ruled in the prehistoric era before the Erdtree, would protect their lord as a wall of living rock. And so it is that the shape of the dragon has become symbolic of all manner of protections.

fields.name: Hammer Talisman
fields.short_description: A talisman depicting a hammer and a knight. Enhances stamina-reducing attacks against a blocking opponent.
fields.description:
A talisman depicting a hammer and a knight. Enhances stamina-reducing attacks against a blocking opponent.

Hammers are highly effective against shield-bearing foes, so much so that they are known as "knight-killers."

fields.name: Host_s Trick Mirror
fields.short_description: A small, clouded mirror that reflects a flesh-and-blood figure.
fields.description:
A small, clouded mirror that reflects a flesh-and-blood figure.

Makes the bearer take on the appearance of a summoned cooperator.

One of the ritual implements created by the Tarnished to deceive invaders.

fields.name: Immunizing Horn Charm +1
fields.short_description: An accoutrement worn by the ancestral followers. Greatly raises immunity. (Immunity governs resistance to poison and rot.)
fields.description:
An accoutrement worn by the ancestral followers. Greatly raises immunity. (Immunity governs resistance to poison and rot.)

Said to be a budding horn. The ancestral followers believe that the horns of a long-lived beast continue to bud like antlers, over and over again, until the beast one day becomes an ancestral spirit.

fields.name: Immunizing Horn Charm
fields.short_description: An accoutrement worn by the ancestral followers. Raises immunity. (Immunity governs resistance to poison and rot.)
fields.description:
An accoutrement worn by the ancestral followers. Raises immunity. (Immunity governs resistance to poison and rot.)

Said to be a budding horn. The ancestral followers believe that the horns of a long-lived beast continue to bud like antlers, over and over again, until the beast one day becomes an ancestral spirit.

fields.name: Kindred of Rot_s Exultation
fields.short_description: A talisman depicting the exultation of pests.
fields.description:
A talisman depicting the exultation of pests.

Raises attack power when poisoning or rot occurs in the vicinity.

"Rot for the scarlet goddess. O scarlet blossoms, flourish in distant lands, and return to us, the unwanted children."

fields.name: Lance Talisman
fields.short_description: A talisman depicting a lance and a knight. Enhances attacks while on horseback.
fields.description:
A talisman depicting a lance and a knight. Enhances attacks while on horseback.

Knights on horseback are deadly foes. They see all below from their lofty position, meeting little meaningful resistance as they charge ahead.

fields.name: Lightning Scorpion Charm
fields.short_description: A talisman carried by assassins who strike unseen. Patterned on a scorpion freshly shed of its exoskeleton, its claws seizing a heart that sparks with lightning.
fields.description:
A talisman carried by assassins who strike unseen. Patterned on a scorpion freshly shed of its exoskeleton, its claws seizing a heart that sparks with lightning.

Raises lightning attack power, but lowers damage negation.

fields.name: Longtail Cat Talisman
fields.short_description: A brooch depicting Lacrima, the long-tailed cat.
fields.description:
A brooch depicting Lacrima, the long-tailed cat.

Renders the wearer immune to fall damage. However, it cannot prevent falling to one's death.

Lacrima features in the fables of Raya Lucaria, in which she is described as a faerie cat who was fond of playing in the great bell tower.

fields.name: Lord of Blood_s Exultation
fields.short_description: A talisman depicting the exultation of the Lord of Blood.
fields.description:
A talisman depicting the exultation of the Lord of Blood.

Raises attack power when blood loss occurs in the vicinity.

"Render up your offerings of blood to your Lord. Drench my consort's chamber. Slake his cocoon's thirst. His awakening shall herald the dawn of our dynasty."

fields.name: Magic Scorpion Charm
fields.short_description: A talisman carried by assassins who strike unseen. Patterned on a scorpion freshly shed of its exoskeleton, its claws seizing a heart that shimmers with magic.
fields.description:
A talisman carried by assassins who strike unseen. Patterned on a scorpion freshly shed of its exoskeleton, its claws seizing a heart that shimmers with magic.

Raises magic attack power, but lowers damage negation.

fields.name: Marika_s Scarseal
fields.short_description: An eye engraved with an Elden Rune. Said to be the seal of Queen Marika.
fields.description:
An eye engraved with an Elden Rune. Said to be the seal of Queen Marika.

Raises mind, intelligence, faith, and arcane, but also increases damage taken.

These seals represent the lifelong duty of those chosen by the gods.

fields.name: Marika_s Soreseal
fields.short_description: This legendary talisman is an eye engraved with an Elden Rune, said to be the seal of Queen Marika.
fields.description:
This legendary talisman is an eye engraved with an Elden Rune, said to be the seal of Queen Marika.

Greatly raises mind, intelligence, faith, and arcane, but also increases damage taken by a similar measure.

Solemn duty weighs upon the one beholden; not unlike a gnawing curse from which there is no deliverance.

fields.name: Millicent_s Prosthesis
fields.short_description: Part of the golden prosthesis used by Millicent. The hand is locked into a fist that once raised a sword aloft.
fields.description:
Part of the golden prosthesis used by Millicent. The hand is locked into a fist that once raised a sword aloft.

Boosts dexterity and raises attack power with successive attacks.

The despair of sweet betrayal transformed Millicent from a mere bud into a magnificent flower. And one day, she will be rebornas a beautiful scarlet valkyrie.

fields.name: Moon of Nokstella
fields.short_description: This legendary talisman is a treasure of Nokstella, the Eternal City.
fields.description:
This legendary talisman is a treasure of Nokstella, the Eternal City.

Increases memory slots.

This talisman represents the lost black moon. The moon of Nokstella was the guide of countless stars.

fields.name: Mottled Necklace +1
fields.short_description: A vividly-colored accoutrement precious to the ancestral followers.
fields.description:
A vividly-colored accoutrement precious to the ancestral followers.

Greatly raises immunity, robustness, and focus.

Said to be a budding horn. The ancestral followers believe that the horns of a long-lived beast continue to bud like antlers, over and over again, until the beast one day becomes an ancestral spirit.

fields.name: Mottled Necklace
fields.short_description: A vividly-colored accoutrement precious to the ancestral followers.
fields.description:
A vividly-colored accoutrement precious to the ancestral followers.

Raises immunity, robustness, and focus.

Said to be a budding horn. The ancestral followers believe that the horns of a long-lived beast continue to bud like antlers, over and over again, until the beast one day becomes an ancestral spirit.

fields.name: Old Lord_s Talisman
fields.short_description: A legendary talisman depicting the ancient king whose seat lies at the heart of the storm beyond time.
fields.description:
A legendary talisman depicting the ancient king whose seat lies at the heart of the storm beyond time.

Extends the duration of sorceries and incantations.

It is said that the ancient royal city of Farum Azula has been slowly crumbling since time immemorial.

fields.name: Pearldrake Talisman +1
fields.short_description: Talisman depicting a duo of pearlescent ancient dragons. Greatly boosts non-physical damage negation.
fields.description:
Talisman depicting a duo of pearlescent ancient dragons. Greatly boosts non-physical damage negation.

The ancient dragons, who ruled in the prehistoric era before the Erdtree, would protect their lord as a wall of living rock. And so it is that the shape of the dragon has become symbolic of all manner of protections.

fields.name: Pearldrake Talisman +2
fields.short_description: Talisman depicting a trio of pearlescent ancient dragons. Vastly boosts non-physical damage negation.
fields.description:
Talisman depicting a trio of pearlescent ancient dragons. Vastly boosts non-physical damage negation.

The ancient dragons, who ruled in the prehistoric era before the Erdtree, would protect their lord as a wall of living rock. And so it is that the shape of the dragon has become symbolic of all manner of protections.

fields.name: Pearldrake Talisman
fields.short_description: Talisman depicting a pearlescent ancient dragon. Boosts non-physical damage negation.
fields.description:
Talisman depicting a pearlescent ancient dragon. Boosts non-physical damage negation.

The ancient dragons, who ruled in the prehistoric era before the Erdtree, would protect their lord as a wall of living rock. And so it is that the shape of the dragon has become symbolic of all manner of protections.

fields.name: Perfumer_s Talisman
fields.short_description: A talisman depicting a set of perfume bottles. Raises potency of perfume items.
fields.description:
A talisman depicting a set of perfume bottles. Raises potency of perfume items.

There are gardens known only to the perfumers. Whether hidden on the fringes of the highlands, or obscured by shadows inside caves, the flowers blossom in secret, waiting to impart their scent.

fields.name: Primal Glintstone Blade
fields.short_description: An old glintstone blade that has been stained with blood.
fields.description:
An old glintstone blade that has been stained with blood.

Reduces FP consumption of sorceries and incantations at the cost of maximum HP.

The old sorcerers would slice open their hearts with these blades to imbue a primal glintstone with their soul, and thus did they die.

fields.name: Prince of Death_s Cyst
fields.short_description: A fetid, overgrown cyst taken from facial flesh. Greatly raises vitality. (Vitality governs resistance to the effects of Death.)
fields.description:
A fetid, overgrown cyst taken from facial flesh. Greatly raises vitality. (Vitality governs resistance to the effects of Death.)

It is said that this cyst came from the corrupted visage of one unable to die a true Death. Indeed, it comes from the Prince of Death, scion of the golden bough and First of the Dead among the demigods.

fields.name: Prince of Death_s Pustule
fields.short_description: A fetid pustule taken from facial flesh. Raises vitality. (Vitality governs resistance to the effects of Death.)
fields.description:
A fetid pustule taken from facial flesh. Raises vitality. (Vitality governs resistance to the effects of Death.)

It is said that this pustule came from the visage of the Prince of Death, he who used to be called Godwyn. As First Dead of the demigods, it's said he's buried deep under the capital, at the Erdtree's roots.

fields.name: Prince of Death_s Pustule
fields.short_description: A relic catalogued from the Ashen archives.
fields.description: A fragment of a forgotten age, recorded by the Emporium. Its true purpose is veiled, but its presence is undeniable.

fields.name: Prosthesis-Wearer Heirloom
fields.short_description: A talisman engraved with a scene from a heroic tale. Raises dexterity.
fields.description:
A talisman engraved with a scene from a heroic tale. Raises dexterity.

Though born into the accursed rot, when the young girl encountered her mentor and his flowing blade, she gained wings of unparalleled strength.

fields.name: Radagon_s Icon
fields.short_description: A relic catalogued from the Ashen archives.
fields.description: A fragment of a forgotten age, recorded by the Emporium. Its true purpose is veiled, but its presence is undeniable.

fields.name: Radagon_s Scarseal
fields.short_description: An eye engraved with an Elden Rune. Said to be the seal of King Consort Radagon.
fields.description:
An eye engraved with an Elden Rune. Said to be the seal of King Consort Radagon.

Raises vigor, endurance, strength, and dexterity, but also increases damage taken.

These seals represent the lifelong duty of those chosen by the gods.

fields.name: Radagon_s Soreseal
fields.short_description: This legendary talisman is an eye engraved with an Elden Rune, said to be the seal of King Consort Radagon.
fields.description:
This legendary talisman is an eye engraved with an Elden Rune, said to be the seal of King Consort Radagon.

Greatly raises vigor, endurance, strength, and dexterity, but also increases damage taken by a similar measure.

Solemn duty weighs upon the one beholden; not unlike a gnawing curse from which there is no deliverance.

fields.name: Red-Feathered Branch Sword
fields.short_description: A talisman adorned with red feathers, once used in ancient death rituals. Raises attack power when HP is low.
fields.description:
A talisman adorned with red feathers, once used in ancient death rituals. Raises attack power when HP is low.

The heart sings when one draws close to death, and a glorious end awaits those who cling so tenaciously to life.

fields.name: Ritual Shield Talisman
fields.short_description: A talisman patterned after shields used in ritual combat held to honor the Erdtree.
fields.description:
A talisman patterned after shields used in ritual combat held to honor the Erdtree.

Raises defense when HP is at maximum.

The practice had died out by the age of King Consort Radagon, but remains of the arenas where ritual combat took place can still be found in every land.

fields.name: Ritual Sword Talisman
fields.short_description: A talisman patterned after swords used in ritual combat held to honor the Erdtree.
fields.description:
A talisman patterned after swords used in ritual combat held to honor the Erdtree.

Raises attack power when HP is at maximum.

The practice had died out by the age of King Consort Radagon, but remains of the arenas where ritual combat took place can still be found in every land.

fields.name: Roar Medallion
fields.short_description: A bronze medallion depicting a roaring giant. Enhances roars and breath attacks.
fields.description:
A bronze medallion depicting a roaring giant. Enhances roars and breath attacks.

In ancient times, the giants were mortal enemies of the Erdtree. Their bellowing roars desolated nature, triggered avalanches, and whipped up storms of flame.

fields.name: Rotten Winged Sword Insignia
fields.short_description: A talisman depicting a raised prosthetic blade. An honor bestowed upon the valkyries who serve the Goddess of Rot.
fields.description:
A talisman depicting a raised prosthetic blade. An honor bestowed upon the valkyries who serve the Goddess of Rot.

Greatly raises attack power with successive attacks.

The four sisters were born in the Swamp of Aeonia, and came to the Haligtree under the aegis of Gowry. And yet, those buds were doomed to never blossom.

fields.name: Sacred Scorpion Charm
fields.short_description: A talisman carried by assassins who strike unseen. Patterned on a scorpion freshly shed of its exoskeleton, its claws seizing a heart with a blessed glow.
fields.description:
A talisman carried by assassins who strike unseen. Patterned on a scorpion freshly shed of its exoskeleton, its claws seizing a heart with a blessed glow.

Raises holy attack power, but lowers damage negation.

fields.name: Sacrificial Twig
fields.short_description: A talisman fashioned from a dried twig, so slender that it might snap at the slightest touch.
fields.description:
A talisman fashioned from a dried twig, so slender that it might snap at the slightest touch.

Prevents rune loss upon death, but will be lost itself in exchange.

Believed to be a twig pruned from the Erdtree long, long ago.

fields.name: Shabriri_s Woe
fields.short_description: Disturbing likeness of a man whose eyes have been gouged out. The corners of his mouth are upturned in an almost flirtatious manner.
fields.description:
Disturbing likeness of a man whose eyes have been gouged out. The corners of his mouth are upturned in an almost flirtatious manner.

Constantly attracts enemies' aggression.

It is said that the man, named Shabriri, had his eyes gouged out as punishment for the crime of slander, and, with time, the blight of the flame of frenzy came to dwell in the empty sockets.

fields.name: Shard of Alexander
fields.short_description: Shard of the late Alexander, a shattered warrior jar.
fields.description:
Shard of the late Alexander, a shattered warrior jar.

Greatly boosts the attack power of skills.

Scraps of stewed flesh cling to the shard, and tatters of ornaments can be seen mingled within the slime. Relics of a red-haired champion, it would seem.

fields.name: Silver Scarab
fields.short_description: A talisman facsimile of a scarab, the carrier of treasures and precious things.
fields.description:
A talisman facsimile of a scarab, the carrier of treasures and precious things.

This silver scarab enhances item discovery.

fields.name: Spear Talisman
fields.short_description: A talisman depicting a spear and a soldier. Enhances the counterattacks that are unique to thrusting weapons.
fields.description:
A talisman depicting a spear and a soldier. Enhances the counterattacks that are unique to thrusting weapons.

Spears are standard weapons for soldiers in the Lands Between. They made it possible to respond to a ferocious foe with an equally ferocious counterattack.

fields.name: Spelldrake Talisman +1
fields.short_description: Talisman depicting a duo of blue ancient dragons. Greatly boosts magic damage negation.
fields.description:
Talisman depicting a duo of blue ancient dragons. Greatly boosts magic damage negation.

The ancient dragons, who ruled in the prehistoric era before the Erdtree, would protect their lord as a wall of living rock. And so it is that the shape of the dragon has become symbolic of all manner of protections.

fields.name: Spelldrake Talisman +2
fields.short_description: Talisman depicting a trio of blue ancient dragons. Vastly boosts magic damage negation.
fields.description:
Talisman depicting a trio of blue ancient dragons. Vastly boosts magic damage negation.

The ancient dragons, who ruled in the prehistoric era before the Erdtree, would protect their lord as a wall of living rock. And so it is that the shape of the dragon has become symbolic of all manner of protections.

fields.name: Spelldrake Talisman
fields.short_description: Talisman depicting a blue ancient dragon. Boosts magic damage negation.
fields.description:
Talisman depicting a blue ancient dragon. Boosts magic damage negation.

The ancient dragons, who ruled in the prehistoric era before the Erdtree, would protect their lord as a wall of living rock. And so it is that the shape of the dragon has become symbolic of all manner of protections.

fields.name: Stalwart Horn Charm +1
fields.short_description: An accoutrement worn by the ancestral followers. Greatly raises robustness. (Robustness governs resistance to blood loss and frost.)
fields.description:
An accoutrement worn by the ancestral followers. Greatly raises robustness. (Robustness governs resistance to blood loss and frost.)

Said to be a budding horn. The ancestral followers believe that the horns of a long-lived beast continue to bud like antlers, over and over again, until the beast one day becomes an ancestral spirit.

fields.name: Stalwart Horn Charm
fields.short_description: An accoutrement worn by the ancestral followers. Raises robustness. (Robustness governs resistance to blood loss and frost.)
fields.description:
An accoutrement worn by the ancestral followers. Raises robustness. (Robustness governs resistance to blood loss and frost.)

Said to be a budding horn. The ancestral followers believe that the horns of a long-lived beast continue to bud like antlers, over and over again, until the beast one day becomes an ancestral spirit.

fields.name: Stargazer Heirloom
fields.short_description: A talisman engraved with the legend of a queen. Raises intelligence.
fields.description:
A talisman engraved with the legend of a queen. Raises intelligence.

The young astrologer gazed at the night sky as she walked. She had always chased the stars every step of her journey. Then she met the full moonand, in time, the astrologer became a queen.

fields.name: Starscourge Heirloom
fields.short_description: A talisman engraved with a scene from a heroic tale. Raises strength.
fields.description:
A talisman engraved with a scene from a heroic tale. Raises strength.

The mightiest hero of the demigods confronted the falling stars aloneand thus did he crush them, his conquest sealing the very fate of the stars.

fields.name: Taker_s Cameo
fields.short_description: A talisman engraved with a stern likeness of Praetor Rykard, master of Volcano Manor.
fields.description:
A talisman engraved with a stern likeness of Praetor Rykard, master of Volcano Manor.

Restores HP upon defeating enemies.

When Rykard turned to heresy, taking by force became the rule. The gods themselves were no different, after all.

fields.name: Twinblade Talisman
fields.short_description: A talisman depicting a twinblade and a confessor. Enhances the final hit ending a chain of attacks.
fields.description:
A talisman depicting a twinblade and a confessor. Enhances the final hit ending a chain of attacks.

The twinblade technique is a tradition of the confessors, who closely guard the secret of how they preserve the momentum of their attacks. Thus is the final strike of their onslaught all the more deadly.

fields.name: Two Fingers Heirloom
fields.short_description: A talisman engraved with the legend of the Two Fingers. Raises faith.
fields.description:
A talisman engraved with the legend of the Two Fingers. Raises faith.

Fingers cannot speak, yet these were eloquent. Persistently did they wriggle, spelling out mysteries in the air. Thus did we gain the words. The words of our faith.

fields.name: Viridian Amber Medallion +1
fields.short_description: A medallion with viridian amber inlaid. Greatly boosts maximum stamina.
fields.description:
A medallion with viridian amber inlaid. Greatly boosts maximum stamina.

The Erdtree's old sap becomes amber, treasured as the most precious of jewels in the age of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord.

A primordial life energy resides inside.

fields.name: Viridian Amber Medallion +2
fields.short_description: A medallion with viridian amber inlaid. Vastly boosts maximum stamina.
fields.description:
A medallion with viridian amber inlaid. Vastly boosts maximum stamina.

The Erdtree's old sap becomes amber, treasured as the most precious of jewels in the age of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord.

A primordial life energy resides inside.

fields.name: Viridian Amber Medallion
fields.short_description: A medallion with viridian amber inlaid. Boosts maximum stamina.
fields.description:
A medallion with viridian amber inlaid. Boosts maximum stamina.

The Erdtree's old sap becomes amber, treasured as the most precious of jewels in the age of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord.

A primordial life energy resides inside.

fields.name: Warrior Jar Shard
fields.short_description: Shard of a shattered warrior jar.
fields.description:
Shard of a shattered warrior jar.

Boosts the attack power of skills.

Scraps of stewed flesh cling to the shard, and tatters of ornaments can be seen mingled within the slime. Relics of ancient royal warriors, perhaps.

fields.name: Winged Sword Insignia
fields.short_description: A talisman depicting a raised prosthetic blade. An honor bestowed upon the knights who fought alongside Malenia the Severed.
fields.description:
A talisman depicting a raised prosthetic blade. An honor bestowed upon the knights who fought alongside Malenia the Severed.

Raises attack power with successive attacks.

The wings symbolize Malenia and her undefeated prowess. Though she never knew relief from the accursed rot she was born into, her blade was forever beautifuland relentless.

fields.name: Albinauric Shield
fields.short_description: Tall oval shield made of metal carried by young Albinaurics. The ornamentation represents the primordial drop of dew from which they are said to have been created. Boasts exceptional magic damage n...
fields.description: Tall oval shield made of metal carried by young Albinaurics. The ornamentation represents the primordial drop of dew from which they are said to have been created. Boasts exceptional magic damage negation. The Albinaurics' most formidable foes were sorcerers, after all.

fields.name: Ant_s Skull Plate
fields.short_description: Huge head of one of the giant ants which inhabit the two underground rivers, used without modification as a shield. Excels at repelling enemy attacks.
fields.description:
Huge head of one of the giant ants which inhabit the two underground rivers, used without modification as a shield. Excels at repelling enemy attacks.

Giant ants are venomous creatures, granting a boost to immunity when wielding this shield.

fields.name: Banished Knight_s Shield
fields.short_description: A tall medium-sized metal shield. Given to knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes.
fields.description:
A tall medium-sized metal shield. Given to knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes.

Most of these knights were sent to the fringes, where they were forced to start anew with only despair for company.

fields.name: Beast Crest Heater Shield
fields.short_description: A medium-sized metal shield. Easier to handle than a kite shield.
fields.description:
A medium-sized metal shield. Easier to handle than a kite shield.

Features a beast as its crest, serving to remind warriors not to succumb to the arousal of battle. Fight with passion, but become not its prisoner.

fields.name: Beastman_s Jar Shield
fields.short_description: Shield fashioned from a tall broken jar carried by the beastmen of Farum Azula. There is a particular knack to wielding it.
fields.description:
Shield fashioned from a tall broken jar carried by the beastmen of Farum Azula. There is a particular knack to wielding it.

The beastmen have always fired earthenware jars for the express purpose of making shields. Such are their ways, strange though they are.

fields.name: Black Leather Shield
fields.short_description: Roundshield covered in black leather. On the larger side for a medium-sized shield.
fields.description:
Roundshield covered in black leather. On the larger side for a medium-sized shield.

From the north, this shield depicts the polar star in rivets of gold. The inside is lined with fur, protecting the carrier from frost.

fields.name: Blue Crest Heater Shield
fields.short_description: A medium-sized metal shield. Easier to handle than a kite shield.
fields.description:
A medium-sized metal shield. Easier to handle than a kite shield.

The crest represents a forest and river.

fields.name: Blue-Gold Kite Shield
fields.short_description: A standard medium-sized metal shield. Highly reputed for its solid build and reliability.
fields.description:
A standard medium-sized metal shield. Highly reputed for its solid build and reliability.

The design represents the Erdtree foregrounded against a blue sky.

fields.name: Blue-White Wooden Shield
fields.short_description: Small wooden roundshield that has been reinforced with metal. It is light and easy to handle, but cannot offer the damage negation of a true metal shield.
fields.description:
Small wooden roundshield that has been reinforced with metal. It is light and easy to handle, but cannot offer the damage negation of a true metal shield.

The design is said to represent the stars of the night sky, portending fate.

fields.name: Brass Shield
fields.short_description: On the larger side for a medium-sized shield, the face has been covered in brass.
fields.description:
On the larger side for a medium-sized shield, the face has been covered in brass.

Commonly employed in the Shattering.

fields.name: Briar Greatshield
fields.short_description: Greatshield from a foreign land, used by Elemer of the Briar. Attacks with this armament utilize the iron thorns that have been wound around its frame.
fields.description:
Greatshield from a foreign land, used by Elemer of the Briar. Attacks with this armament utilize the iron thorns that have been wound around its frame.

Originates from Eochaid, a land of proudly solitary ascetics.

fields.name: Buckler
fields.short_description: A small metal roundshield. The bump in the center is designed to parry.
fields.description:
A small metal roundshield. The bump in the center is designed to parry.

A well-timed parry deflects an enemy's attack, breaking their stance and leaving them open to a critical hit. Though risk is inherent, this shield favors aggression.

fields.name: Candletree Wooden Shield
fields.short_description: A tall, medium-sized wooden shield. Light for its size, and easy to handle.
fields.description:
A tall, medium-sized wooden shield. Light for its size, and easy to handle.

Thought to represent a surreptitious prophecy of cardinal sin, the lit candle-tree design was forbidden.

fields.name: Carian Knight_s Shield
fields.short_description: A teardrop-shaped, medium-sized shield embedded with blue glintstones. Carried by knights who served the Carian royal family.
fields.description:
A teardrop-shaped, medium-sized shield embedded with blue glintstones. Carried by knights who served the Carian royal family.

Excels when facing magic or holy attacks. Just who were these knights preparing to fight?

fields.name: Coil Shield
fields.short_description: Armament designed for gladiatorial combat. Rises above its peers as a particularly showy specimen.
fields.description:
Armament designed for gladiatorial combat. Rises above its peers as a particularly showy specimen.

The sculpted bronze snake is a poisonous breed, boosting the wielder's resistance to poison.

fields.name: Crossed Tree Towershield
fields.short_description: An iron greatshield large enough to cover the entire body. Emblazoned with an old, interleaving tree.
fields.description:
An iron greatshield large enough to cover the entire body. Emblazoned with an old, interleaving tree.

Greatshields boast high damage negation and guard capacity, making enemy attacks easy to repel.

fields.name: Crucible Hornshield
fields.short_description: Greatshield of red-tinged gold carried by Crucible Knights. Features a great horn.
fields.description:
Greatshield of red-tinged gold carried by Crucible Knights. Features a great horn.

An ancient holiness dwells within. The crucible horn skewers foes when performing shield bashes.

fields.name: Cuckoo Greatshield
fields.short_description: Metal greatshield painted with a peering cuckoo. Carried by the enchanted knights sworn to the academy.
fields.description:
Metal greatshield painted with a peering cuckoo. Carried by the enchanted knights sworn to the academy.

Boasting high magic damage negation, this shield is used to hunt down mages. "Our enemy is none other than Caria itself."

fields.name: Distinguished Greatshield
fields.short_description: Greatshield featuring sumptuous ornamentation used by the scions of great families.
fields.description:
Greatshield featuring sumptuous ornamentation used by the scions of great families.

Due to their excessive size, these shields were at times seen as the hallmark of little lordlings who were too timid to earn a few nicks and scratches.

fields.name: Dragon Towershield
fields.short_description: Tower shield engraved with a dragon, symbol of protection. Heavy even among greatshields, it possesses exceptional guarding ability.
fields.description:
Tower shield engraved with a dragon, symbol of protection. Heavy even among greatshields, it possesses exceptional guarding ability.

The ancient dragons, who ruled in the prehistoric era before the Erdtree, would protect their lord as a wall of living rock.

fields.name: Dragonclaw Shield
fields.short_description: Greatshield said to have been whittled from the claw of a great, ancient dragon, wielded by grotesque Tree Sentinels who yet serve the Erdtree.
fields.description:
Greatshield said to have been whittled from the claw of a great, ancient dragon, wielded by grotesque Tree Sentinels who yet serve the Erdtree.

Imbued with lightning.

fields.name: Eclipse Crest Greatshield
fields.short_description: Metal greatshield painted with a sun in eclipse. Carried by the headless mausoleum knights.
fields.description:
Metal greatshield painted with a sun in eclipse. Carried by the headless mausoleum knights.

The eclipsed sun, drained of color, is the protective star of soulless demigods. It aids the mausoleum knights by keeping Destined Death at bay.

fields.name: Eclipse Crest Heater Shield
fields.short_description: A medium-sized metal shield. Easier to handle than a kite shield.
fields.description:
A medium-sized metal shield. Easier to handle than a kite shield.

The sun in eclipse is said to be the symbol of the Wandering Mausoleum where the soulless demigods slumber.

fields.name: Erdtree Greatshield
fields.short_description: Weighty greatshield forged of gold carried by the order of Tree Sentinels, heavily equipped knights. Blessed by an old incantation of protection.
fields.description:
Weighty greatshield forged of gold carried by the order of Tree Sentinels, heavily equipped knights. Blessed by an old incantation of protection.

The living rampart of the Erdtree, the Tree Sentinels are the standard to which all defenders of the Erdtree aspire.

fields.name: Fingerprint Stone Shield
fields.short_description: A great stone shield with an intricately carved fingerprint design. One of the heaviest of all greatshields. Part of the tomb of an ancient god, the Readerless Fingers relayed their message through...
fields.description: A great stone shield with an intricately carved fingerprint design. One of the heaviest of all greatshields. Part of the tomb of an ancient god, the Readerless Fingers relayed their message through these imprints, said to be the very seeds from which frenzy first sprouted.

fields.name: Flame Crest Wooden Shield
fields.short_description: A tall, medium-sized wooden shield. Light for its size, and easy to handle. Carried by soldiers of the village that is afflicted by frenzy.
fields.description:
A tall, medium-sized wooden shield. Light for its size, and easy to handle. Carried by soldiers of the village that is afflicted by frenzy.

The yellow flame is the symbol of the affliction, serving as a warning to those who might approach the village.

fields.name: Gilded Greatshield
fields.short_description: Metal greatshield coated with gold. Carried by knights loyal to Godrick.
fields.description:
Metal greatshield coated with gold. Carried by knights loyal to Godrick.

The red tinge in the gold coat mirrors the primordial matter that became the Erdtree. The color of homeward yearning.

fields.name: Gilded Iron Shield
fields.short_description: Small metal roundshield. Heavier than a wooden shield, but boasts higher damage negation.
fields.description:
Small metal roundshield. Heavier than a wooden shield, but boasts higher damage negation.

Though the gold leaf is peeling and the effect is slight, it still boosts holy damage negation.

fields.name: Golden Beast Crest Shield
fields.short_description: Shield of dull gold with a beast engraved as its crest. Lighter than most greatshields, and subsequently easier to wield.
fields.description:
Shield of dull gold with a beast engraved as its crest. Lighter than most greatshields, and subsequently easier to wield.

The beast depicted is Serosh, aged counselor who guides the golden lineage.

fields.name: Golden Greatshield
fields.short_description: Oval greatshield made of gold, carried by knights who protect the Royal Capital of Leyndell.
fields.description:
Oval greatshield made of gold, carried by knights who protect the Royal Capital of Leyndell.

Knights of Leyndell are reputed for their sturdiness, exemplified by this shield's exceptional guard capacity.

fields.name: Great Turtle Shell
fields.short_description: Shield fashioned from a great turtle shell. The natural curve helps it contend with foes' attacks.
fields.description:
Shield fashioned from a great turtle shell. The natural curve helps it contend with foes' attacks.

The turtle is a symbol of tirelessness, and this shield boosts stamina recovery speed.

fields.name: Haligtree Crest Greatshield
fields.short_description: Metal greatshield depicting the Haligtree with unalloyed gold. Carried by knights who have vowed to serve Miquella's Haligtree. Possesses high holy damage negation. Yet now, with the Haligtree miss...
fields.description: Metal greatshield depicting the Haligtree with unalloyed gold. Carried by knights who have vowed to serve Miquella's Haligtree. Possesses high holy damage negation. Yet now, with the Haligtree misshapen, this wondrous rendition is a fleeting fantasy.

fields.name: Hawk Crest Wooden Shield
fields.short_description: A tall, medium-sized wooden shield. Light for its size, and easy to handle.
fields.description:
A tall, medium-sized wooden shield. Light for its size, and easy to handle.

Adorned with a long-forgotten crest of Stormveil, ancient in design.

fields.name: Heater Shield
fields.short_description: A medium-sized metal shield, comparatively easy to handle.
fields.description:
A medium-sized metal shield, comparatively easy to handle.

Metal shields reliably negate physical damage when guarding, a trait which made them highly trusted on the battlefield.

fields.name: Horse Crest Wooden Shield
fields.short_description: A tall, medium-sized wooden shield. Light for its size, and easy to handle.
fields.description:
A tall, medium-sized wooden shield. Light for its size, and easy to handle.

The circular horsehead design evokes a swift gallop.

fields.name: Ice Crest Shield
fields.short_description: Small metal roundshield. Heavier than a wooden shield, but boasts higher damage negation.
fields.description:
Small metal roundshield. Heavier than a wooden shield, but boasts higher damage negation.

The ice crest originates from a Carian princess. Though the effect is slight, it boosts magic damage negation and resistance to frost.

fields.name: Icon Shield
fields.short_description: Greatshield painted with a divine scene; the recipience of a blessed tear from the Erdtree. An item that looks back fondly on the age of plenty.
fields.description:
Greatshield painted with a divine scene; the recipience of a blessed tear from the Erdtree. An item that looks back fondly on the age of plenty.

The divine scene acts in and of itself as a sacred invocation; gradually restoring the carrier's HP.

fields.name: Inverted Hawk Heater Shield
fields.short_description: A medium-sized metal shield. Easier to handle than a kite shield.
fields.description:
A medium-sized metal shield. Easier to handle than a kite shield.

The inverted hawk is the emblem of the company of slaves ordered to explore the Eternal City.

fields.name: Inverted Hawk Towershield
fields.short_description: An iron greatshield large enough to cover the entire body. Features an inverted hawk crest.
fields.description:
An iron greatshield large enough to cover the entire body. Features an inverted hawk crest.

Greatshields boast high damage negation and guard capacity, making enemy attacks easy to repel.

fields.name: Iron Roundshield
fields.short_description: An ordinary small roundshield made of metal. Heavier than a wooden shield, but boasts higher damage negation.
fields.description:
An ordinary small roundshield made of metal. Heavier than a wooden shield, but boasts higher damage negation.

Finely balanced, this shield is easy to use.

fields.name: Jellyfish Shield
fields.short_description: The head of a spirit jellyfish, commonly found floating above sacred ground throughout the Lands Between, wielded without modification as a shield.
fields.description:
The head of a spirit jellyfish, commonly found floating above sacred ground throughout the Lands Between, wielded without modification as a shield.

The see-through head is extremely light, but its flesh is supple, providing absolutely no protection from piercing attacks.

fields.name: Kite Shield
fields.short_description: A standard medium-sized metal shield.
fields.description:
A standard medium-sized metal shield.

Metal shields reliably negate physical damage when guarding, a trait which made them highly trusted on the battlefield.

fields.name: Large Leather Shield
fields.short_description: A roundshield covered in leather. On the larger side for a medium-sized shield.
fields.description:
A roundshield covered in leather. On the larger side for a medium-sized shield.

Though its damage negation may be lacking compared to a metal shield, it can handle a wider range of attack affinities.

fields.name: Lordsworn_s Shield
fields.short_description: Wooden tower shield. Lightweight for a greatshield and easy to handle. Commonly used in the Shattering.
fields.description:
Wooden tower shield. Lightweight for a greatshield and easy to handle. Commonly used in the Shattering.

Greatshields boast high damage negation and guard capacity, making enemy attacks easy to repel.

fields.name: Man-Serpent_s Shield
fields.short_description: Small copper dome-shaped roundshield carried by the man-serpents of Mt. Gelmir.
fields.description:
Small copper dome-shaped roundshield carried by the man-serpents of Mt. Gelmir.

Said to have been tempered in lava, it boasts great resistance to fire.

fields.name: Manor Towershield
fields.short_description: An iron greatshield large enough to cover the entire body. Depicts the Roundtable Hold, gathering place of champions.
fields.description:
An iron greatshield large enough to cover the entire body. Depicts the Roundtable Hold, gathering place of champions.

Greatshields boast high damage negation and guard capacity, making enemy attacks easy to repel.

fields.name: Marred Leather Shield
fields.short_description: Leather shield of Stormveil soldiers. Much like the castle, it is marred by mottling and thorns.
fields.description:
Leather shield of Stormveil soldiers. Much like the castle, it is marred by mottling and thorns.

Some say it is the curse of grafting which causes such affliction, while others talk of its root being something altogether more sinister hidden deep within the castle.

fields.name: Marred Wooden Shield
fields.short_description: Wooden shield of Stormveil soldiers. Much like the castle, it is marred by mottling and thorns.
fields.description:
Wooden shield of Stormveil soldiers. Much like the castle, it is marred by mottling and thorns.

Some say it is the curse of grafting which causes such affliction, while others talk of its root being something altogether more sinister hidden deep within the castle.

fields.name: One-Eyed Shield
fields.short_description: Tricksome shield made from white stone depicting a malformed one-eyed god. The barrel of a firearm pokes through the open mouth.
fields.description:
Tricksome shield made from white stone depicting a malformed one-eyed god. The barrel of a firearm pokes through the open mouth.

Once worshipped by the giants, this evil deity is believed to have been slain by Queen Marika.

fields.name: Perfumer_s Shield
fields.short_description: Golden shield used by the perfumers of Leyndell during military service.
fields.description:
Golden shield used by the perfumers of Leyndell during military service.

Made to be thin and light of weight, even those lacking strength can employ this immunity-boosting shield.

fields.name: Pillory Shield
fields.short_description: Pillory made to punish serious felons, used as a shield. Though made of good, sturdy wood, it is only a makeshift tool and performs as such.
fields.description:
Pillory made to punish serious felons, used as a shield. Though made of good, sturdy wood, it is only a makeshift tool and performs as such.

Perhaps due to its use as a device with which the guilty were made to endure prolonged suffering, it raises vitality.

fields.name: Red Crest Heater Shield
fields.short_description: A medium-sized metal shield. Easier to handle than a kite shield.
fields.description:
A medium-sized metal shield. Easier to handle than a kite shield.

The crest symbolizes red wings.

fields.name: Red Thorn Roundshield
fields.short_description: A small, wooden roundshield. It is light and easy to handle, but cannot offer the damage negation of a metal shield.
fields.description:
A small, wooden roundshield. It is light and easy to handle, but cannot offer the damage negation of a metal shield.

Its emblem is an ancient thorn design. Though it isn't much, it boosts fire damage negation.

fields.name: Redmane Greatshield
fields.short_description: Greatshield shaped like a fang, featuring the crest of red-maned lion. Carried by the Redmane Knights who fought alongside Radahn.
fields.description: Greatshield shaped like a fang, featuring the crest of red-maned lion. Carried by the Redmane Knights who fought alongside Radahn.

fields.name: Rickety Shield
fields.short_description: A creaky old wooden shield, circular in shape. Roughly reinforced with vines.
fields.description:
A creaky old wooden shield, circular in shape. Roughly reinforced with vines.

There are countless other shields available of better make. This piece of scrap isn't worth the effort of equipping.

fields.name: Rift Shield
fields.short_description: Small metal roundshield depicting a sinister rift.
fields.description:
Small metal roundshield depicting a sinister rift.

An antiquated charm that glares back at an enemy, it boosts focus.

fields.name: Riveted Wooden Shield
fields.short_description: Small wooden roundshield that has been reinforced with metal. It is light and easy to handle, but cannot offer the damage negation of a true metal shield.
fields.description:
Small wooden roundshield that has been reinforced with metal. It is light and easy to handle, but cannot offer the damage negation of a true metal shield.

The design riveted to the center represents both sword and tree.

fields.name: Round Shield
fields.short_description: A wooden roundshield that has been reinforced with metal.
fields.description:
A wooden roundshield that has been reinforced with metal.

Comparatively light for its size, this shield is easy to handle but lacks a true metal shield's ability to negate damage.

fields.name: Scorpion Kite Shield
fields.short_description: A standard medium-sized metal shield. Highly reputed for its solid build and reliability.
fields.description:
A standard medium-sized metal shield. Highly reputed for its solid build and reliability.

Emblazoned with a yellow scorpion, a warning of surprise attacks and sudden strikes.

fields.name: Scripture Wooden Shield
fields.short_description: A small, wooden roundshield. It is light and easy to handle, but cannot offer the damage negation of a metal shield.
fields.description:
A small, wooden roundshield. It is light and easy to handle, but cannot offer the damage negation of a metal shield.

An ancient cipher engraving lines the circumference. Though it isn't much, it boosts holy damage negation.

fields.name: Shield of the Guilty
fields.short_description: Shield made to venerate a maiden whose eyes were crushed by Briars of Sin before being reborn in these lands.
fields.description:
Shield made to venerate a maiden whose eyes were crushed by Briars of Sin before being reborn in these lands.

Venerating the repose of the soul, this shield boosts focus. The briars can be used to attack foes.

fields.name: Silver Mirrorshield
fields.short_description: Shield of radiant silver, festooned with amber and carried by Loretta, Knight of the Haligtree.
fields.description:
Shield of radiant silver, festooned with amber and carried by Loretta, Knight of the Haligtree.

The shape is said to imitate that of a sacred drop of dew, which inspired the absurd rumor that Loretta herself was an Albinauric.

fields.name: Smoldering Shield
fields.short_description: Small shield made upon Mt. Gelmir forged from uncooling lava.
fields.description:
Small shield made upon Mt. Gelmir forged from uncooling lava.

Resists frost with its heat, and can even be used to deal fire damage if wielded as a weapon.

fields.name: Spiked Palisade Shield
fields.short_description: A large wooden shield covered with spikes. Though relatively light, it lacks in damage negation.
fields.description:
A large wooden shield covered with spikes. Though relatively light, it lacks in damage negation.

Designed to perform shield bashes, these attacks riddle the enemy with holes, earning it the nickname of "pard shield."

fields.name: Spiralhorn Shield
fields.short_description: Small shield of antlers arranged in an eddy-like pattern. If used to attack a foe, the shield's antlers inflict blood loss. Once given to a Tarnished warrior who cultivated close ties to the ancest...
fields.description: Small shield of antlers arranged in an eddy-like pattern. If used to attack a foe, the shield's antlers inflict blood loss. Once given to a Tarnished warrior who cultivated close ties to the ancestral followers. Though the effect is only slight, it boosts immunity, robustness, and focus.

fields.name: Twinbird Kite Shield
fields.short_description: Shield featuring a vividly painted twinbird. The twinbird is said to be the envoy of an outer god, and mother of the Deathbirds.
fields.description:
Shield featuring a vividly painted twinbird. The twinbird is said to be the envoy of an outer god, and mother of the Deathbirds.

At dwindling levels of HP, this shield slightly boosts both attack and defense.

fields.name: Visage Shield
fields.short_description: Tricksome bronze shield depicting the face of a Fire Giant. Several tongues leap from its open mouth.
fields.description:
Tricksome bronze shield depicting the face of a Fire Giant. Several tongues leap from its open mouth.

The dreadful visage and burning flames are designed to remind one of the horror of facing a Fire Giant. In other words, this shield has an instructional function.

fields.name: Wooden Greatshield
fields.short_description: Wooden greatshield reinforced with a metal ornamentation.
fields.description:
Wooden greatshield reinforced with a metal ornamentation.

Greatshields boast high damage negation and guard capacity, making enemy attacks easy to repel.

fields.name: Adula_s Moonblade
fields.short_description: Sorcery of Adula, the Glintstone Dragon.
fields.description:
Sorcery of Adula, the Glintstone Dragon.

Conjures a cold magic greatsword, then delivers a sweeping blow that launches a blade-like projectile of frost. This sorcery can be cast repeatedly.

Adula, a devourer of sorcerers, was bested by Ranni and subsequently swore a knightly oath to her Dark Moon.

fields.name: Agheel_s Flame
fields.short_description: Superior incantation of Dragon Communion. Channels the power of the flying dragon Agheel.
fields.description:
