fields.name: Carian Glintstone Staff
fields.short_description: Staff embedded with a blue glintstone. One of two types of Carian staff.
fields.description:
Staff embedded with a blue glintstone. One of two types of Carian staff.

Given to sorcerers that they might enact the role of knight. Enhances Carian sword sorceries.

fields.name: Carian Regal Scepter
fields.short_description: Magic scepter of Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon. The glintstone is known as a Carian Blue, enhancing full moon sorceries.
fields.description:
Magic scepter of Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon. The glintstone is known as a Carian Blue, enhancing full moon sorceries.

Only those of the highest intelligence may wield this, the finest of all glintstone staves.

fields.name: Celebrant_s Cleaver
fields.short_description: Cleaver decorated with many-colored fabrics. Ceremonial tool used by dancers during the festivities of Dominula, Windmill Village.
fields.description:
Cleaver decorated with many-colored fabrics. Ceremonial tool used by dancers during the festivities of Dominula, Windmill Village.

Crafted from human bone. Grants trace amounts of runes upon landing attacks.

fields.name: Celebrant_s Rib-Rake
fields.short_description: Rake decorated with many-colored fabrics. Ceremonial tool used by dancers during the festivities of Dominula, Windmill Village.
fields.description:
Rake decorated with many-colored fabrics. Ceremonial tool used by dancers during the festivities of Dominula, Windmill Village.

Crafted from human bone. Grants trace amounts of runes upon landing attacks.

fields.name: Celebrant_s Skull
fields.short_description: Large bludgeon decorated with flowers and many-colored fabrics. Ceremonial tool used by dancers during the festivities of Dominula, Windmill Village.
fields.description:
Large bludgeon decorated with flowers and many-colored fabrics. Ceremonial tool used by dancers during the festivities of Dominula, Windmill Village.

The striking end is a skull too large in size to be human. Grants trace amounts of runes on landing attacks.

fields.name: Chainlink Flail
fields.short_description: A spiked iron tube attached by a chain wielded by Mad Pumpkin Heads.
fields.description:
A spiked iron tube attached by a chain wielded by Mad Pumpkin Heads.

Especially large for a flail, wielding it requires more strength than it does dexterity.

fields.name: Cipher Pita
fields.short_description: A relic catalogued from the Ashen archives.
fields.description: A fragment of a forgotten age, recorded by the Emporium. Its true purpose is veiled, but its presence is undeniable.

fields.name: Clawmark Seal
fields.short_description: Sacred seal granted by Gurranq, the Beast Clergyman. A rare trinket which allows incantations to be scaled with strength.
fields.description:
Sacred seal granted by Gurranq, the Beast Clergyman. A rare trinket which allows incantations to be scaled with strength.

The claw mark represents Gurranq's wrath. Enhances bestial incantations learned from Gurranq.

fields.name: Clayman_s Harpoon
fields.short_description: Harpoon with a tip made from a sharpened meteorite shard. Wielded by the claymen who infest dynastic remains.
fields.description:
Harpoon with a tip made from a sharpened meteorite shard. Wielded by the claymen who infest dynastic remains.

The blade emits a faint light and deals magic damage.

fields.name: Cleanrot Spear
fields.short_description: Spear of the Cleanrot Knights who fought alongside Malenia, Blade of Miquella.
fields.description:
Spear of the Cleanrot Knights who fought alongside Malenia, Blade of Miquella.

The winged golden blade deals holy damage. The diminutive shield is blessed with an incantation that wards off rot.

fields.name: Clinging Bone
fields.short_description: Horrific weapon made of a hardened skeletal arm. Wielded by Ensha of the Royal Remains.
fields.description:
Horrific weapon made of a hardened skeletal arm. Wielded by Ensha of the Royal Remains.

Fitted by placing one's hands into the fists' grips until they dig in. "O clinging creature. A king relinquishes not the hand."

fields.name: Composite Bow
fields.short_description: Bow composited from a mix of materials.
fields.description:
Bow composited from a mix of materials.

Demands high attributes, and is tricky to wield, but is a fearsome tool when mastered.

fields.name: Copy of Beastman_s Cleaver
fields.short_description: A relic catalogued from the Ashen archives.
fields.description: A fragment of a forgotten age, recorded by the Emporium. Its true purpose is veiled, but its presence is undeniable.

fields.name: Copy of Golden Order Greatsword
fields.short_description: A relic catalogued from the Ashen archives.
fields.description: A fragment of a forgotten age, recorded by the Emporium. Its true purpose is veiled, but its presence is undeniable.

fields.name: Cranial Vessel Candlestand
fields.short_description: Candlestand used in worship of Birac, the most hallowed Monk Prelate of the Giants' Flame. Concerned over the lazy arrogance with which the monks treated the Flame, Birac severed his own head as a ...
fields.description: Candlestand used in worship of Birac, the most hallowed Monk Prelate of the Giants' Flame. Concerned over the lazy arrogance with which the monks treated the Flame, Birac severed his own head as a lesson to the others, intending it be used as a candlestand. His faith yet smolders from within the cranial vessel.

fields.name: Crepus_s Black-Key Crossbow
fields.short_description: Black crossbow featuring a long stock. Used for sniping, it has a very long range.
fields.description:
Black crossbow featuring a long stock. Used for sniping, it has a very long range.

Weapon of Crepus, who served the Two Fingers from the shadows of the Roundtable as the head confessor.

fields.name: Crescent Moon Axe
fields.short_description: Greataxe with a large, arcing blade and long handle. The "Crescent Moon" of its name is said to have been spurred by nostalgia.
fields.description:
Greataxe with a large, arcing blade and long handle. The "Crescent Moon" of its name is said to have been spurred by nostalgia.

Specializes in sweeping through foes by making use of its long handle.

fields.name: Cross-Naginata
fields.short_description: Weapon consisting of a three-pronged blade affixed to a long pole. The long central blade closely resembles a katana.
fields.description:
Weapon consisting of a three-pronged blade affixed to a long pole. The long central blade closely resembles a katana.

A weapon of the Land of Reeds, known for its ability to be wielded as a spear while still being capable of performing slashing attacks.

fields.name: Crystal Spear
fields.short_description: Spear fashioned from pure crystal; a deed impossible for a human. Enwreathed with powerful magic, its attack scales with intelligence. The inscrutable Crystalians have but one clear purpose; to saf...
fields.description: Spear fashioned from pure crystal; a deed impossible for a human. Enwreathed with powerful magic, its attack scales with intelligence. The inscrutable Crystalians have but one clear purpose; to safeguard their crystals unto the end. One theory posits that they yearn for the return of their creator who will carve for them new brethren.

fields.name: Curved Great Club
fields.short_description: Large curved club of hard wood, shaped like a crescent moon.
fields.description:
Large curved club of hard wood, shaped like a crescent moon.

Wielded by Albinaurics lacking the dexterity demanded by a curved sword, and who prefer the added weight and destructive force.

fields.name: Death Ritual Spear
fields.short_description: Ritual spear used by priests of old who were permitted to come among the Deathbirds.
fields.description:
Ritual spear used by priests of old who were permitted to come among the Deathbirds.

The priests became guardians of the birds through the rite of Death, which also serves as an oath sworn to their distant resurrection.

fields.name: Demi-Human Queen_s Staff
fields.short_description: Glintstone staff styled as a scepter. A gift once given to the demi-humans to foster peace, it can be wielded even by those of low intelligence.
fields.description:
Glintstone staff styled as a scepter. A gift once given to the demi-humans to foster peace, it can be wielded even by those of low intelligence.

Sneered at by fools in the academy.

fields.name: Digger_s Staff
fields.short_description: Staff of a sorcerer-miner who extracts glintstone from crystal tunnels. The staff itself is a tool used to mine, and the ferrule is also embedded with a glintstone.
fields.description:
Staff of a sorcerer-miner who extracts glintstone from crystal tunnels. The staff itself is a tool used to mine, and the ferrule is also embedded with a glintstone.

Boosts the power of Stonedigger sorceries.

fields.name: Dragon Communion Seal
fields.short_description: Formless drakeblood seal with a dragon communion crest. Enhances Dragon Communion incantations.
fields.description:
Formless drakeblood seal with a dragon communion crest. Enhances Dragon Communion incantations.

The sacrificial devouring of the heart gives power. Indeed, Dragon Communion is too primal in nature for the term "incantation" to be appropriate. This seal scales incantations with one's arcane attribute.

fields.name: Dragon Greatclaw
fields.short_description: Weapon said to have been whittled from the claw of a great, ancient dragon, wielded by grotesque Tree Sentinels who yet serve the Erdtree.
fields.description:
Weapon said to have been whittled from the claw of a great, ancient dragon, wielded by grotesque Tree Sentinels who yet serve the Erdtree.

The claw is enwreathed with lightning, and tears through the dragons' feeble descendants with ease.

fields.name: Dragon Halberd
fields.short_description: Halberd shaped like a dragon, enwreathed with both ice and lightning.
fields.description:
Halberd shaped like a dragon, enwreathed with both ice and lightning.

Alas, the Dragonkin Soldiers never attained immortality, and perished as decrepit, pale imitations of their skyborn kin.

fields.name: Duelist Greataxe
fields.short_description: Greataxe designed for gladiatorial combat. Used by duelists who were exiled from the colosseum.
fields.description:
Greataxe designed for gladiatorial combat. Used by duelists who were exiled from the colosseum.

A weapon reserved for duelist champions, the charge attack is particularly ferocious.

fields.name: Envoy_s Greathorn
fields.short_description: Fanned golden horn of the Oracle Envoys. Profoundly weighty, its blows are sure to be felt.
fields.description:
Fanned golden horn of the Oracle Envoys. Profoundly weighty, its blows are sure to be felt.

Originally an instrument, but one that cannot be sounded by a mere human. Or perhaps it is too early to sound the call.

fields.name: Envoy_s Horn
fields.short_description: Golden horn of the Oracle Envoys. Profoundly weighty, its blows are sure to be felt.
fields.description:
Golden horn of the Oracle Envoys. Profoundly weighty, its blows are sure to be felt.

Originally an instrument, but one that cannot be sounded by a mere human. Or perhaps it is too early to sound the call.

fields.name: Envoy_s Long Horn
fields.short_description: Long golden horn of the Oracle Envoys. Profoundly weighty, its blows are sure to be felt.
fields.description:
Long golden horn of the Oracle Envoys. Profoundly weighty, its blows are sure to be felt.

Originally an instrument, but one that cannot be sounded by a mere human. Or perhaps it is too early to sound the call.

fields.name: Erdtree Bow
fields.short_description: Longbow featuring Erdtree styling. In times of old, when faith and battle went hand in hand, this weapon was created in tandem with the Golden Arrow.
fields.description:
Longbow featuring Erdtree styling. In times of old, when faith and battle went hand in hand, this weapon was created in tandem with the Golden Arrow.

Scales all arrow damage with faith, revealing its true worth when used with holy-infused arrows.

fields.name: Erdtree Greatbow
fields.short_description: Greatbow featuring Erdtree styling. In times of old, when faith and battle went hand in hand, this weapon was created in tandem with the Golden Great Arrow.
fields.description:
Greatbow featuring Erdtree styling. In times of old, when faith and battle went hand in hand, this weapon was created in tandem with the Golden Great Arrow.

Scales all arrow damage with faith, revealing its true worth when used with holy-infused arrows.

fields.name: Erdtree Seal
fields.short_description: A formless sacred seal decorated with an Erdtree crest, once the focus of religion in the Lands Between.
fields.description:
A formless sacred seal decorated with an Erdtree crest, once the focus of religion in the Lands Between.

Even though the Elden Ring is shattered, and the Erdtree has dulled from its former radiance, earnest faith continues to hold the answers.

fields.name: Executioner_s Greataxe
fields.short_description: Bulky cleaver welded to a long haft. Said to have been used to dispatch the remnants of defeated armies, felling them like timber.
fields.description:
Bulky cleaver welded to a long haft. Said to have been used to dispatch the remnants of defeated armies, felling them like timber.

Perhaps that is the reason it excels at critical hits.

fields.name: Fallingstar Beast Jaw
fields.short_description: Part of a Fallingstar Beast's jaw, hard and shining black, fashioned into a weapon.
fields.description:
Part of a Fallingstar Beast's jaw, hard and shining black, fashioned into a weapon.

With its sharp point, this colossal weapon can skewer foes.

fields.name: Finger Seal
fields.short_description: A sacred seal bestowed by Finger Maiden which serves as a catalyst for casting sacred incantations.
fields.description:
A sacred seal bestowed by Finger Maiden which serves as a catalyst for casting sacred incantations.

Incantations must be memorized first at a site of grace, and a sacred seal must be equipped to cast them.

fields.name: Frenzied Flame Seal
fields.short_description: Formless sacred seal bestowed by the maiden of the Three Fingers. Enhances incantations of the frenzied flame.
fields.description:
Formless sacred seal bestowed by the maiden of the Three Fingers. Enhances incantations of the frenzied flame.

This seal is the mark of the Lord of Frenzied Flame. Scales incantations using strength, dexterity, intelligence, and faith all together.

fields.name: Full Moon Crossbow
fields.short_description: One-of-a-kind enchanted crossbow of exquisitely detailed craftsmanship. Made to celebrate the matrimonial union, and reconciliation, between the houses of the Erdtree and the Full Moon, Leyndell an...
fields.description: One-of-a-kind enchanted crossbow of exquisitely detailed craftsmanship. Made to celebrate the matrimonial union, and reconciliation, between the houses of the Erdtree and the Full Moon, Leyndell and Raya Lucaria. The two rings dance when reloading the weapon. Reveals true worth when used with holy-infused bolts.

fields.name: Gargoyle_s Black Axe
fields.short_description: Bronze greataxe wielded by Valiant Gargoyle, mended with blackened corpse wax. Deals holy damage.
fields.description:
Bronze greataxe wielded by Valiant Gargoyle, mended with blackened corpse wax. Deals holy damage.

Such is the mark of those who serve Maliketh, the Black Blade.

fields.name: Gargoyle_s Black Halberd
fields.short_description: Bronze halberd wielded by Valiant Gargoyle, mended with blackened corpse wax. Deals holy damage.
fields.description:
Bronze halberd wielded by Valiant Gargoyle, mended with blackened corpse wax. Deals holy damage.

Such is the mark of those who serve Maliketh, the Black Blade.

fields.name: Gargoyle_s Great Axe
fields.short_description: Bronze greataxe wielded by Valiant Gargoyle.
fields.description:
Bronze greataxe wielded by Valiant Gargoyle.

Just like the wielder, the missing parts have been mended with corpse wax; a patchwork of champions.

fields.name: Gargoyle_s Halberd
fields.short_description: Bronze halberd wielded by Valiant Gargoyle.
fields.description:
Bronze halberd wielded by Valiant Gargoyle.

Just like the wielder, the missing parts have been mended with corpse wax; a patchwork of champions.

fields.name: Gelmir Glintstone Staff
fields.short_description: Staff with a forked tip, embedded with red glintstones. Enhances lava sorceries.
fields.description:
Staff with a forked tip, embedded with red glintstones. Enhances lava sorceries.

The Man-Serpents of Mt. Gelmir draw from faith in addition to intelligence to enhance the potency of their sorcery.

fields.name: Ghiza_s Wheel
fields.short_description: Great iron wheel lined with flesh-flaying blades. Device of torture used by Inquisitor Ghiza. As the wheel spins it causes severe pain and blood loss.
fields.description:
Great iron wheel lined with flesh-flaying blades. Device of torture used by Inquisitor Ghiza. As the wheel spins it causes severe pain and blood loss.

The design was adopted for use as the iconic weapon wielded by Iron Virgins.

fields.name: Giant_s Seal
fields.short_description: Sacred seal depicting the one-eyed god of the Fire Giants, adorned with braids of red hair.
fields.description:
Sacred seal depicting the one-eyed god of the Fire Giants, adorned with braids of red hair.

Sacred seal wielded by Fire Monks and Prelates, this catalyst enhances Giants' Flame incantations.

fields.name: Glaive
fields.short_description: Weapon comprised of a sharp blade affixed to a long grip. It is in fact a sickle repurposed to be a tool of war.
fields.description:
Weapon comprised of a sharp blade affixed to a long grip. It is in fact a sickle repurposed to be a tool of war.

This far-reaching weapon excels at slashing attacks.

fields.name: Godslayer_s Seal
fields.short_description: Sacred seal of the Godskin Apostles, inlaid with obsidian.
fields.description:
Sacred seal of the Godskin Apostles, inlaid with obsidian.

Said to represent the manipulation of black flame, this catalyst enhances godslayer incantations.

fields.name: Golden Order Seal
fields.short_description: A formless sacred seal depicting the ceremonial observation of Order. Enhances Golden Order Fundamentalist incantations.
fields.description:
A formless sacred seal depicting the ceremonial observation of Order. Enhances Golden Order Fundamentalist incantations.

Fundamentalism is scholarship in all but name. Scales incantations using both intelligence and faith.

fields.name: Golem Greatbow
fields.short_description: Greatbow of black stone crafted by a civilization now gone to ruin. Weapon of the Guardian Golem.
fields.description:
Greatbow of black stone crafted by a civilization now gone to ruin. Weapon of the Guardian Golem.

Extremely heavy, this greatbow requires enormous strength just to draw, suggesting it was not designed for human use.

fields.name: Golem_s Halberd
fields.short_description: A great halberd of black stone crafted by a civilization now gone to ruin. Wielded by the Guardian Golem.
fields.description: A great halberd of black stone crafted by a civilization now gone to ruin. Wielded by the Guardian Golem.

fields.name: Grave Scythe
fields.short_description: Greatscythe comprised of a large blade affixed to a crooked stick. Weapon wielded by the aged grave keepers who tend the forgotten graveyards throughout the Lands Between.
fields.description:
Greatscythe comprised of a large blade affixed to a crooked stick. Weapon wielded by the aged grave keepers who tend the forgotten graveyards throughout the Lands Between.

This weapon is said to have served as a charm against evil spirits in times of old.

fields.name: Gravel Stone Seal
fields.short_description: Sacred seal made from Gravel Stone thought to be an ancient dragon scale. Enhances Dragon Cult incantations of the Royal Capital.
fields.description:
Sacred seal made from Gravel Stone thought to be an ancient dragon scale. Enhances Dragon Cult incantations of the Royal Capital.

The worship of the ancient dragons does not conflict with belief in the Erdtree. After all, this seal, and lighting itself, are both imbued with gold.

fields.name: Great Club
fields.short_description: An enormous club of hard wood. Wildly hammering foes with this striking weapon requires no dexterity; only brute force. While it may seem sacrilegious, this weapon is said to be a withered branch o...
fields.description: An enormous club of hard wood. Wildly hammering foes with this striking weapon requires no dexterity; only brute force. While it may seem sacrilegious, this weapon is said to be a withered branch of the Erdtree. Imbued with holy power, this weapon will never snap.

fields.name: Great Mace
fields.short_description: Huge bludgeon with sharp protrusions. An enlarged version of its smaller cousin.
fields.description:
Huge bludgeon with sharp protrusions. An enlarged version of its smaller cousin.

Maintains all the advantages of smaller bludgeons, boasting few deficiencies while being very capable at breaking enemy guards and stances. A shrewd choice for simple slugging matches.

fields.name: Greataxe
fields.short_description: Greataxe akin to a huge lump of iron. Recognized as the weapon of choice of badland chieftains.
fields.description:
Greataxe akin to a huge lump of iron. Recognized as the weapon of choice of badland chieftains.

Too heavy to be wielded by those of merely ordinary strength, blows from this axe will flatten enemies, and the force of its charged attack is a sight to behold.

fields.name: Greatbow
fields.short_description: Enormous greatbow larger than any man. Can not be drawn with any ordinary level of strength, but the force of its shots is extraordinary.
fields.description:
Enormous greatbow larger than any man. Can not be drawn with any ordinary level of strength, but the force of its shots is extraordinary.

A greatbow can only fire great arrows.

fields.name: Greathorn Hammer
fields.short_description: Huge thick horn carved with tree ring-like markings adapted into a bludgeoning weapon. Wielded by ancestral follower warriors.
fields.description:
Huge thick horn carved with tree ring-like markings adapted into a bludgeoning weapon. Wielded by ancestral follower warriors.

The ancient horn is imbued with the power of ancestral spirits. A small amount of HP is restored upon defeating an enemy.

fields.name: Guardian_s Swordspear
fields.short_description: Weapon comprising a long handle and broad blade sharpened from the hard wood of old trees.
fields.description:
Weapon comprising a long handle and broad blade sharpened from the hard wood of old trees.

Wielded by guardians of the Minor Erdtrees, known as experts in the arts of combat. The power of this weapon scales greatly with dexterity.

fields.name: Halberd
fields.short_description: A long-handled polearm that combines the functions of both axe and spear.
fields.description:
A long-handled polearm that combines the functions of both axe and spear.

Can be used to press a single enemy with continuous thrusting attacks, or swept at groups, taking advantage of its great reach and cleaving blade. A versatile weapon for any situation.

fields.name: Halo Scythe
fields.short_description: War scythe of the Cleanrot Knights who fought alongside Malenia, Blade of Miquella.
fields.description:
War scythe of the Cleanrot Knights who fought alongside Malenia, Blade of Miquella.

This was the weapon of commanders in Malenia's army, and the half-halo blade deals holy damage.

fields.name: Hammer
fields.short_description: Hammer comprised of a large stone affixed to a metal handle. Originally a blacksmith's tool.
fields.description:
Hammer comprised of a large stone affixed to a metal handle. Originally a blacksmith's tool.

The art of smithing is said to have originated among the giants. This weapon's striking attacks boast ample weight behind them.

fields.name: Hand Axe
fields.short_description: Commonly known as a hatchet, this smaller variety of axe is an everyday work tool.
fields.description:
Commonly known as a hatchet, this smaller variety of axe is an everyday work tool.

Despite its short reach, it is easy to handle, exceling in successive attacks.

fields.name: Hand Ballista
fields.short_description: An unconventional ballistic device modelled on a weapon used to besiege castles. Only capable of firing greatbolts.
fields.description:
An unconventional ballistic device modelled on a weapon used to besiege castles. Only capable of firing greatbolts.

Perfect for reckless acts such as storming a castle or facing an entire army alone.

fields.name: Harp Bow
fields.short_description: Bow fashioned from a minstrel's harp. Sonorous tones still resound when firing arrows.
fields.description:
Bow fashioned from a minstrel's harp. Sonorous tones still resound when firing arrows.

Troubadours sing tales of champions, both in the honorable service of the Erdtree, and the one who spurns honor for blasphemy.

fields.name: Heavy Crossbow
fields.short_description: Heavy crossbow with iron limbs, increasing damage dealt.
fields.description:
Heavy crossbow with iron limbs, increasing damage dealt.

Commonly employed in the Shattering.

fields.name: Highland Axe
fields.short_description: Single-sided axe used by the warriors of the highlands.
fields.description:
Single-sided axe used by the warriors of the highlands.

Brave combatants begin battle by crying out their names. Roars are enhanced by this weapon.

fields.name: Hookclaws
fields.short_description: Weapon worn on the fist comprised of sharp parallel blades favored by those who lurk in the dark. Lacerations cause blood loss with great effect.
fields.description:
Weapon worn on the fist comprised of sharp parallel blades favored by those who lurk in the dark. Lacerations cause blood loss with great effect.

Claw weapons come in pairs, and two-handing this weapon will equip it to both hands.

fields.name: Horn Bow
fields.short_description: Longbow made from animal horn. Wielded by the master hunters of the ancestral followers.
fields.description:
Longbow made from animal horn. Wielded by the master hunters of the ancestral followers.

Imbues arrows fired with magic damage. Reveals its true worth when used with magic-infused arrows.

fields.name: Hoslow_s Petal Whip
fields.short_description: Metal whip formed of razor-sharp chain-link blades that have the appearance of flower petals. This work of art is handed down through the generations of the illustrious House Hoslow. High dexterity...
fields.description: Metal whip formed of razor-sharp chain-link blades that have the appearance of flower petals. This work of art is handed down through the generations of the illustrious House Hoslow. High dexterity is required to wield this weapon, but it excels at inflicting devastating blood loss. "The tale of House Hoslow is told in blood."

fields.name: Icerind Hatchet
fields.short_description: A hatchet with a frost-coated blade. One of several gifts given by Castle Sol in the distant north.
fields.description:
A hatchet with a frost-coated blade. One of several gifts given by Castle Sol in the distant north.

Known as "freezing fog," the blade is thought to be a dragon's scale. Inflicts a powerful frost effect.

fields.name: Inquisitor_s Girandole
fields.short_description: Instrument of torture used on nobles behind the curtain at the Volcano Manor of Mt. Gelmir.
fields.description:
Instrument of torture used on nobles behind the curtain at the Volcano Manor of Mt. Gelmir.

Its numerous spikes pierce the flesh, then singe the wounds with flame. The smell of burnt blood induces despair in the victim. A candlestick conceived by a thorough mind.

fields.name: Iron Ball
fields.short_description: Iron manifer of spherical shape. Big Boggart the blackguard's weapon of choice.
fields.description:
Iron manifer of spherical shape. Big Boggart the blackguard's weapon of choice.

Not a weapon to be taken lightly, as its weighty blows shatter bones with ease.

fields.name: Iron Cleaver
fields.short_description: Fairly large iron cleaver, commonly used by the maltreated Misbegotten.
fields.description:
Fairly large iron cleaver, commonly used by the maltreated Misbegotten.

Steeped in resentment, these weapons are swung wildly and relentlessly, often after rushing up to foes.

fields.name: Iron Spear
fields.short_description: Commonly used iron spear with no notable traits. The blade is severely rusted.
fields.description: Commonly used iron spear with no notable traits. The blade is severely rusted.

fields.name: Jar Cannon
fields.short_description: Jar cannon which uses explosives to fire greatbolts. Deals great damage but is slow to reload.
fields.description:
Jar cannon which uses explosives to fire greatbolts. Deals great damage but is slow to reload.

Experimental firearm brought to the assault on Volcano Manor, where it was discovered that no one knew how to use it.

fields.name: Jawbone Axe
fields.short_description: Axe made from a herbivore's skull. Weapon of the ancestral followers who disdain metal.
fields.description:
Axe made from a herbivore's skull. Weapon of the ancestral followers who disdain metal.

This axe is more of a bludgeon; it forgoes a bladed edge, instead using the beast's molar teeth to buffet foes, dealing strike damage.

fields.name: Katar
fields.short_description: Imported dagger design with a rather unique handle. The blade can be swung about as the extension of one's fist.
fields.description: Imported dagger design with a rather unique handle. The blade can be swung about as the extension of one's fist.

fields.name: Lance
fields.short_description: Considered a type of greatspear, this weapon has no blade, but instead features a long, conical body designed to pierce.
fields.description:
Considered a type of greatspear, this weapon has no blade, but instead features a long, conical body designed to pierce.

Though heavy and hard to wield, this weapon displays its worth in horseback combat whether mounted or even on foot.

fields.name: Large Club
fields.short_description: A thick, solid lump of wood. Wielding this striking weapon requires no skill.
fields.description:
A thick, solid lump of wood. Wielding this striking weapon requires no skill.

A simple, primitive weapon that requires only brute strength to swing about.

fields.name: Light Crossbow
fields.short_description: Ranged weapon made from a bow fixed to a stock. Deals good damage and is simple to use, but requires reloading after firing.
fields.description:
Ranged weapon made from a bow fixed to a stock. Deals good damage and is simple to use, but requires reloading after firing.

Bolts must be equipped to use a crossbow.

fields.name: Lion Greatbow
fields.short_description: Greatbow of black iron wielded by General Radahn. Decorated with a lion mane motif.
fields.description:
Greatbow of black iron wielded by General Radahn. Decorated with a lion mane motif.

Imbued with gravitational power of the Starscourge, when used along with Radahn's Spear, it becomes a true weapon of a champion.

fields.name: Longbow
fields.short_description: Longbow made to fire arrows over great distances. Compared to a shortbow, arrows fired reach further and deal more damage.
fields.description:
Longbow made to fire arrows over great distances. Compared to a shortbow, arrows fired reach further and deal more damage.

To use a bow, arrows must also be equipped.

fields.name: Longhaft Axe
fields.short_description: Large iron axe with a long handle. Weapon of the maltreated Misbegotten.
fields.description:
Large iron axe with a long handle. Weapon of the maltreated Misbegotten.

Making use of the force generated by its length, this weapon's resentment-charged blows are difficult to stop.

fields.name: Loretta_s War Sickle
fields.short_description: Intricately crafted silver war sickle wielded by Loretta, Knight of the Haligtree.
fields.description:
Intricately crafted silver war sickle wielded by Loretta, Knight of the Haligtree.

Originally given for service as a personal guard to Carian royalty, the weapon's blue glintstone has been replaced with unalloyed gold.

fields.name: Lucerne
fields.short_description: This polearm features a hard, sharpened beak-like spike attached to its head, designed to pierce armor.
fields.description:
This polearm features a hard, sharpened beak-like spike attached to its head, designed to pierce armor.

Though designed mainly as a thrusting weapon, its long handle can be utilized to get around an enemy's guard with a sideward sweeping attack.

fields.name: Lusat_s Glintstone Staff
fields.short_description: Staff of the primeval glintstone sorcerer Lusat. Only those who have glimpsed what lies beyond the wisdom of stone may wield it.
fields.description:
Staff of the primeval glintstone sorcerer Lusat. Only those who have glimpsed what lies beyond the wisdom of stone may wield it.

Enhances power of all sorceries, but consumes additional FP.

fields.name: Mace
fields.short_description: An iron bludgeon with sharp protrusions.
fields.description:
An iron bludgeon with sharp protrusions.

Striking attacks have few drawbacks, potent as they are at breaking through guards and stances. Most suited to head on slugging matches.

fields.name: Magma Whip Candlestick
fields.short_description: This ritual implement is a three pronged candlestick with solid flames formed of the magma of Mt. Gelmir.
fields.description:
This ritual implement is a three pronged candlestick with solid flames formed of the magma of Mt. Gelmir.

When wielded as a weapon, the flames become supple whips of lava.

fields.name: Marika_s Hammer
fields.short_description: Stone hammer made in the lands of the Numen, outside the Lands Between. The tool with which Queen Marika shattered the Elden Ring and Radagon attempted to repair it.
fields.description:
Stone hammer made in the lands of the Numen, outside the Lands Between. The tool with which Queen Marika shattered the Elden Ring and Radagon attempted to repair it.

The hammer partially broke upon shattering the Ring, becoming splintered with rune fragments.

fields.name: Meteorite Staff
fields.short_description: Staff embedded with a dark purple glintstone, said to be the fragment of a meteorite. Boasts high sorcery scaling and boosts gravity sorceries as well.
fields.description:
Staff embedded with a dark purple glintstone, said to be the fragment of a meteorite. Boasts high sorcery scaling and boosts gravity sorceries as well.

However, this staff cannot be strengthened in any way.

fields.name: Misbegotten Shortbow
fields.short_description: Shortbow wielded by Winged Misbegotten. Fine fur clings to it.
fields.description:
Shortbow wielded by Winged Misbegotten. Fine fur clings to it.

Designed to inflict additional damage by sacrificing range.

fields.name: Mohgwyn_s Sacred Spear
fields.short_description: Trident of Mohg, Lord of Blood. A sacred spear that will come to symbolize his dynasty.
fields.description:
Trident of Mohg, Lord of Blood. A sacred spear that will come to symbolize his dynasty.

As well as serving as a weapon, it is an instrument of communion with an outer god who bestows power upon accursed blood. The mother of truth desires a wound.

fields.name: Monk_s Flamemace
fields.short_description: Warhammer made to resemble flickering flames. Signature weapon of the Fire Monks, who hail from the Mountaintops of the Giants.
fields.description:
Warhammer made to resemble flickering flames. Signature weapon of the Fire Monks, who hail from the Mountaintops of the Giants.

The unique strong attack rouses fiery combative spirit.

fields.name: Morning Star
fields.short_description: Warhammer comprised of a globe attached to a handle. Though a bludgeon dealing strike damage, the appellative star is covered in spikes which cause blood loss.
fields.description:
Warhammer comprised of a globe attached to a handle. Though a bludgeon dealing strike damage, the appellative star is covered in spikes which cause blood loss.

Ironic given its graceful name, this weapon often reeks of blood.

fields.name: Nightrider Flail
fields.short_description: A flail with two additional bludgeoning heads. Weapon of the Night's Cavalry who ride funeral steeds.
fields.description:
A flail with two additional bludgeoning heads. Weapon of the Night's Cavalry who ride funeral steeds.

The large spikes make it highly effective at inducing blood loss, but also demand higher dexterity to wield.

fields.name: Nightrider Glaive
fields.short_description: A jet-black glaive with a blade as weighty as a bludgeon. Weapon of the Night's Cavalry who ride funeral steeds.
fields.description:
A jet-black glaive with a blade as weighty as a bludgeon. Weapon of the Night's Cavalry who ride funeral steeds.

This glaive excels at weighty slash attacks that crash into foes, making it a powerful weapon even on horseback.

fields.name: Nox Flowing Hammer
fields.short_description: Mace shaped like a suspended metal droplet wielded by monks of the Eternal City.
fields.description:
Mace shaped like a suspended metal droplet wielded by monks of the Eternal City.

Forged from liquid metal from a Silver Tear, it is thoroughly tempered until hardened.

fields.name: Partisan
fields.short_description: Spear with a wide tip.
fields.description:
Spear with a wide tip.

In addition to its thrusting attacks, this highly versatile weapon can be swung to sweep through foes.

fields.name: Pickaxe
fields.short_description: Large pickaxe designed to crack thick bedrock. Tool of sturdy miners.
fields.description:
Large pickaxe designed to crack thick bedrock. Tool of sturdy miners.

Not originally designed as a weapon, but very adept at piercing armor. "Little wretches, do you think your armor harder than stone?"

fields.name: Pike
fields.short_description: A longspear featuring an especially lengthy handle.
fields.description:
A longspear featuring an especially lengthy handle.

Specialized for use from long distances, it boasts the longest reach of any melee weapon. Incredibly useful even against foes on horseback, but hard to wield in cramped spaces.

fields.name: Prelate_s Inferno Crozier
fields.short_description: Colossal hammer with the appearance of roiling flames. Weapon of the Prelates who lead the Fire Monks. Its heft represents the weight of their guardianship.
fields.description:
Colossal hammer with the appearance of roiling flames. Weapon of the Prelates who lead the Fire Monks. Its heft represents the weight of their guardianship.

The hammer's head is unusually substantial, and strong attacks will fling foes into the air.

fields.name: Prince of Death_s Staff
fields.short_description: Staff embedded with sullied amber, said to be a very part of the Prince of Death. Enhances death sorceries.
fields.description:
Staff embedded with sullied amber, said to be a very part of the Prince of Death. Enhances death sorceries.

One of the staves deemed heretical by the academy for its ability to allow sorceries to be augmented through faith in addition to intelligence.

fields.name: Pulley Bow
fields.short_description: Longbow which utilizes a series of pulleys and springs. The complex mechanism, which required advanced mathematical and mechanical understanding to craft, was likely made by a certain genius who le...
fields.description:
Longbow which utilizes a series of pulleys and springs. The complex mechanism, which required advanced mathematical and mechanical understanding to craft, was likely made by a certain genius who learned Golden Order fundamentalism.

Enhances precision while shooting, enabling arrows to fly much further distances.

fields.name: Pulley Crossbow
fields.short_description: Crossbow made with pulleys and power springs. The complex mechanism, which required advanced mathematical and mechanical understanding to craft, was likely made by a certain genius who learned Gold...
fields.description: Crossbow made with pulleys and power springs. The complex mechanism, which required advanced mathematical and mechanical understanding to craft, was likely made by a certain genius who learned Golden Order fundamentalism. One touch fires a volley of bolts. Be warned; large stores of bolts can be quickly spent.

fields.name: Raptor Talons
fields.short_description: Claw comprised of two sharp, thin blades. Wielded by the assassins of ravenmount, this weapon allows them to imitate the attacks of Deathbirds.
fields.description:
Claw comprised of two sharp, thin blades. Wielded by the assassins of ravenmount, this weapon allows them to imitate the attacks of Deathbirds.

Besides excelling at airborne attacks, its charge attack mimics the vicious swoop of a bird of prey.

fields.name: Red Branch Shortbow
fields.short_description: Shortbow of polished red wood. Fashioned by a master craftsman and wielded by pages.
fields.description:
Shortbow of polished red wood. Fashioned by a master craftsman and wielded by pages.

A bow which requires dexterity rather than strength to master.

fields.name: Ripple Crescent Halberd
fields.short_description: Weapon wielded by young Albinaurics.
fields.description:
Weapon wielded by young Albinaurics.

The blade is said to resemble a partial image of a ripple, and its attack power scales with one's arcane attribute.

fields.name: Rotten Battle Hammer
fields.short_description: Large iron warhammer designed for gladiatorial combat, now festering with scarlet rot.
fields.description:
Large iron warhammer designed for gladiatorial combat, now festering with scarlet rot.

Weighty enough to crush armor and its wearer alike.

fields.name: Rotten Crystal Spear
fields.short_description: Spear fashioned from pure crystal; a deed impossible for a human.
fields.description:
Spear fashioned from pure crystal; a deed impossible for a human.

Enwreathed with powerful magic, its attack scales with intelligence. Though festering with scarlet rot, its magic remains potent.

fields.name: Rotten Crystal Staff
fields.short_description: Staff fashioned from pure crystal; a deed impossible for a human. It festers with scarlet rot.
fields.description:
Staff fashioned from pure crystal; a deed impossible for a human. It festers with scarlet rot.

Enhances Crystalian sorceries.

fields.name: Rotten Greataxe
fields.short_description: Greataxe designed for gladiatorial combat, now festering with scarlet rot.
fields.description:
Greataxe designed for gladiatorial combat, now festering with scarlet rot.

Used by duelists who were exiled from the colosseum.

fields.name: Rotten Staff
fields.short_description: Ceremonial staff depicting the Erdtree in its historic radiance. It festers with scarlet rot.
fields.description:
Ceremonial staff depicting the Erdtree in its historic radiance. It festers with scarlet rot.

Wielded by the avatars who protect the Minor Erdtrees.

fields.name: Scepter of the All-Knowing
fields.short_description: Scepter in the form of a hand grasping a pearl. Signature weapon of Sir Gideon Ofnir, the All-Knowing. The pearl stands for the world, the heavens, and an eye, representing the many forms of knowle...
fields.description: Scepter in the form of a hand grasping a pearl. Signature weapon of Sir Gideon Ofnir, the All-Knowing. The pearl stands for the world, the heavens, and an eye, representing the many forms of knowledge, never fully attainable. Even knowing that, the All-Knowing's hand grasps for it.

fields.name: Scythe
fields.short_description: Large scythe featuring a long, slender blade. Designed to reap, this weapon is capable of rapidly inflicting blood loss while also slipping through an enemy's guard.
fields.description:
Large scythe featuring a long, slender blade. Designed to reap, this weapon is capable of rapidly inflicting blood loss while also slipping through an enemy's guard.

In the hands of a highly dexterous wielder it is capable of striking fear into the heart of any foe.

fields.name: Serpent Bow
fields.short_description: Malformed bow in the shape of a pair of poisonous snakes. Imbues arrows with poison through pagan magic, revealing its true worth when used with poison-infused arrows.
fields.description:
Malformed bow in the shape of a pair of poisonous snakes. Imbues arrows with poison through pagan magic, revealing its true worth when used with poison-infused arrows.

Used by assassins known as the Formless Serpents.

fields.name: Short Spear
fields.short_description: A exceedingly plain spear of modest weight.
fields.description:
A exceedingly plain spear of modest weight.

Simple to wield compared to many of its peers, strong attack unleashes a series of successive piercing thrusts.

fields.name: Shortbow
fields.short_description: Small bow made to fire arrows over great distances. Other than its ability to fire off arrows in rapid succession, it is also well-suited for use on horseback.
fields.description:
Small bow made to fire arrows over great distances. Other than its ability to fire off arrows in rapid succession, it is also well-suited for use on horseback.

To use a bow, arrows must also be equipped.

fields.name: Soldier_s Crossbow
fields.short_description: A crossbow of simple make, usable by anyone, but lacking in both power and accuracy.
fields.description:
A crossbow of simple make, usable by anyone, but lacking in both power and accuracy.

Bolts must be equipped to use a crossbow.

fields.name: Spear
fields.short_description: Weapon comprised of a blade attached to a long haft.
fields.description:
Weapon comprised of a blade attached to a long haft.

A far-reaching piercing weapon, it can be wielded from behind the safety of a raised shield. Very effective against mounted foes.

fields.name: Spiked Club
fields.short_description: A club with beast fangs wrapped around the striking end. The uneven spread of fangs causes blood loss.
fields.description:
A club with beast fangs wrapped around the striking end. The uneven spread of fangs causes blood loss.

Given only to the toughest of demi-humans, this weapon is a badge of honor. Or so the demi-humans believe.

fields.name: Spiked Spear
fields.short_description: Weapon comprised of a spiked cylinder attached to a long pole. Capable of dealing strike damage when swung. The spikes induce blood loss.
fields.description:
Weapon comprised of a spiked cylinder attached to a long pole. Capable of dealing strike damage when swung. The spikes induce blood loss.

Weapon of the Marionette Soldiers employed by sorcerers.

fields.name: Staff of Loss
fields.short_description: Staff missing its glintstone. Wielded by sorcerers who believe that discovery comes through acts of asceticism.
fields.description:
Staff missing its glintstone. Wielded by sorcerers who believe that discovery comes through acts of asceticism.

This staff is only capable of casting invisibility sorceries, but that is reason enough for some to wield it.

fields.name: Staff of the Avatar
fields.short_description: Ceremonial staff depicting the Erdtree in its historic radiance. Wielded by the avatars who protect the Minor Erdtrees.
fields.description:
Ceremonial staff depicting the Erdtree in its historic radiance. Wielded by the avatars who protect the Minor Erdtrees.

The avatars, emerging in the wake of the Elden Ring's shattering, were determined to protect the withering Erdtree's offspring.

fields.name: Staff of the Guilty
fields.short_description: A heretical staff fashioned from a smoldering, withered sapling that turns the blood of sacrifices pierced by it into glintstone. Similar to hex magic.
fields.description:
A heretical staff fashioned from a smoldering, withered sapling that turns the blood of sacrifices pierced by it into glintstone. Similar to hex magic.

Sorceries are scaled with faith rather than intelligence when wielding this staff which enhances thorn sorceries in particular.

fields.name: Star Fist
fields.short_description: Spherical iron manifer covered in spikes which induce blood loss.
fields.description:
Spherical iron manifer covered in spikes which induce blood loss.

Used in brutal games of pugilism.

fields.name: Stone Club
fields.short_description: Signature weapon of battlemages, hewn from hard glintstone. This club is much heavier than its size suggests, but has no magic power.
fields.description:
Signature weapon of battlemages, hewn from hard glintstone. This club is much heavier than its size suggests, but has no magic power.

So that they not lose sight of the true essence of combat, battlemages prefer to feel the impact of their blows, fighting their opponents hand to hand.

fields.name: Stormhawk Axe
fields.short_description: Battle axe designed to resemble a hawk, with its wings comprising the blade. Signature weapon of warriors who strive to remain one with the storm, despite being so far from their place of birth.
fields.description:
Battle axe designed to resemble a hawk, with its wings comprising the blade. Signature weapon of warriors who strive to remain one with the storm, despite being so far from their place of birth.

Their hearts are proud, and thereby easily undone.

fields.name: Sun Realm Shield
fields.short_description: Shield of honor depicting a city crowned by the sun. It has seen better days.
fields.description:
Shield of honor depicting a city crowned by the sun. It has seen better days.

Much like the wear upon the shield, the Seat of the Sun is long faded away.

fields.name: Thorned Whip
fields.short_description: Hefty whip covered in crimson thorns. Weapon of the Prelates who lead the Fire Monks. A device of fearsome religious encouragement, it is fashioned in the image of the briars of sin.
fields.description:
Hefty whip covered in crimson thorns. Weapon of the Prelates who lead the Fire Monks. A device of fearsome religious encouragement, it is fashioned in the image of the briars of sin.

Very effective at inflicting blood loss.

fields.name: Torchpole
fields.short_description: Torch fastened to a long pole. Lights up dark areas, but cannot be raised overhead.
fields.description:
Torch fastened to a long pole. Lights up dark areas, but cannot be raised overhead.

Used by soldiers on watch, its attacks set foes aflame.

fields.name: Treespear
fields.short_description: Golden spear with tree-like design. Wielded by knights employed as palace guards in the Royal Capital of Leyndell. Deals holy damage.
fields.description:
Golden spear with tree-like design. Wielded by knights employed as palace guards in the Royal Capital of Leyndell. Deals holy damage.

Requiring superior dexterity to wield, this greatspear can perform consecutive thrust attacks despite its larger size.

fields.name: Troll_s Golden Sword
fields.short_description: Sword given to the giants who fought for the Erdtree during the War against the Giants long ago.
fields.description:
Sword given to the giants who fought for the Erdtree during the War against the Giants long ago.

Though the giants have lost their minds, they stay inseparable from their swords that are in sad shapesuch that the gold plating had flaked away.

fields.name: Troll_s Hammer
fields.short_description: Mining tool of stonedigger trolls used to crack bedrock.
fields.description:
Mining tool of stonedigger trolls used to crack bedrock.

Trolls are descended from the giants, and these were supposedly once used as ceremonial smithing tools. In the distant past, smithing was considered divine.

fields.name: Varr_s Bouquet
fields.short_description: A steel mace resembling a charming bouquet of roses. Each petal has a sharpened edge, leaving the roses perpetually colored with blood.
fields.description:
A steel mace resembling a charming bouquet of roses. Each petal has a sharpened edge, leaving the roses perpetually colored with blood.

This weapon reflects White Mask Varr's manner of speech rather well, enticing in its splendor, but full of deadly consequence.

fields.name: Venomous Fang
fields.short_description: One of the weapons designed for gladiatorial combat. Used by duelists who were exiled from the colosseum.
fields.description:
One of the weapons designed for gladiatorial combat. Used by duelists who were exiled from the colosseum.

The black fang protruding from the bronze snake head is coated in deadly poison.

fields.name: Vulgar Militia Saw
fields.short_description: A weapon comprised of a saw blade attached to a long grip. Brandished by the vulgar militia, its serrated edge is very effective at inflicting blood loss. The saw is said to also be used to cut up ...
fields.description: A weapon comprised of a saw blade attached to a long grip. Brandished by the vulgar militia, its serrated edge is very effective at inflicting blood loss. The saw is said to also be used to cut up bodies to feed the militia, but there are no firsthand witnesses to confirm the dire rumor.

fields.name: Vulgar Militia Shotel
fields.short_description: A hooked blade attached to a long handle. Wielded by the vulgar militia, its attacks can slip through an enemy's guard.
fields.description:
A hooked blade attached to a long handle. Wielded by the vulgar militia, its attacks can slip through an enemy's guard.

The vulgar militia are the undecorated stewards of rancid, scorched battlefields that none dare approach, and forbidden domains better forgotten by the rest of the world.

fields.name: Vyke_s War Spear
fields.short_description: War spear singed and blistered by fingers, used by Vyke, Knight of the Roundtable Hold.
fields.description:
War spear singed and blistered by fingers, used by Vyke, Knight of the Roundtable Hold.

Like Vyke himself, it has been tormented by the yellow flame of frenzy from within.

fields.name: Watchdog_s Staff
fields.short_description: Large stone staff embedded with glintstone. Wielded by Erdtree Burial Watchdogs who protect catacombs.
fields.description:
Large stone staff embedded with glintstone. Wielded by Erdtree Burial Watchdogs who protect catacombs.

The Watchdogs, battered and broken over their lengthy tenure, rule the catacombs and are even said to command the imps.

fields.name: Whip
fields.short_description: A leather whip. Not originally used for combat, but as an instrument of pain.
fields.description:
A leather whip. Not originally used for combat, but as an instrument of pain.

Though its supple attacks cannot be thwarted by parrying or even guarding, it is incapable of dealing critical hits.

fields.name: Winged Greathorn
fields.short_description: A unique horn in which the power of ancestral spirits fiercely dwells, this large, wing-shaped specimen is wielded as a weapon of spirit worship.
fields.description:
A unique horn in which the power of ancestral spirits fiercely dwells, this large, wing-shaped specimen is wielded as a weapon of spirit worship.

In the ancestral spirit-worshipping faith, these are considered envoys' wings, made to reap the lives of beings which experience no sprouting.

fields.name: Winged Scythe
fields.short_description: Sacred scythe resembling a pair of white wings. Deals holy damage.
fields.description:
Sacred scythe resembling a pair of white wings. Deals holy damage.

According to pagan belief, white-winged maidens are said to be Death's gentle envoys.

fields.name: Zweihander
fields.short_description: Just about the largest sword a mere man is capable of swinging. True to its name, it is designed to be wielded in both hands, but those of merely ordinary strength will still struggle to do so.
fields.description:
Just about the largest sword a mere man is capable of swinging. True to its name, it is designed to be wielded in both hands, but those of merely ordinary strength will still struggle to do so.

The long blade is heavy and sharp, sending foes reeling back with its broader strokes, while also capable of a devastating piercing thrust.

fields.name: Alberich_s Bracers
fields.short_description: Mad Tongue Alberich's bracers.
fields.description:
Mad Tongue Alberich's bracers.

Set with red glintstones, said to be formed by the blood of sacrifices. Strengthen thorn sorcery.

Alberich was an aloof yet disturbed heretical sorcerer said to have been driven mad by jeering tongues during his service to the Roundtable Hold long ago.

fields.name: Alberich_s Pointed Hat (Altered)
fields.short_description: A relic catalogued from the Ashen archives.
fields.description: A fragment of a forgotten age, recorded by the Emporium. Its true purpose is veiled, but its presence is undeniable.

fields.name: Alberich_s Pointed Hat
fields.short_description: Mad Tongue Alberich's pointed hat, a sign of a heretical practitioner.
fields.description:
Mad Tongue Alberich's pointed hat, a sign of a heretical practitioner.

Set with red glintstones, said to be formed by the blood of sacrifices. Strengthens thorn sorcery.

Alberich was an aloof yet disturbed heretical sorcerer said to have been driven mad by jeering tongues during his service to the Roundtable Hold long ago.

fields.name: Alberich_s Robe (Altered)
fields.short_description: Mad Tongue Alberich's robe.
fields.description:
Mad Tongue Alberich's robe.

Alberich was an aloof yet disturbed heretical sorcerer said to have been driven mad by jeering tongues during his service to the Roundtable Hold long ago.

fields.name: Alberich_s Robe
fields.short_description: Mad Tongue Alberich's robe.
fields.description:
Mad Tongue Alberich's robe.

Set with red glintstones, said to be formed by the blood of sacrifices. Strengthens thorn sorcery.

Alberich was an aloof yet disturbed heretical sorcerer said to have been driven mad by jeering tongues during his service to the Roundtable Hold long ago.

fields.name: Alberich_s Trousers
fields.short_description: Mad Tongue Alberich's trousers.
fields.description:
Mad Tongue Alberich's trousers.

Alberich was an aloof yet disturbed heretical sorcerer said to have been driven mad by jeering tongues during his service to the Roundtable Hold long ago.

fields.name: Albinauric Mask
fields.short_description: Mask made from the largely unaltered hide of a young Albinauric.
fields.description:
Mask made from the largely unaltered hide of a young Albinauric.

Raises arcane, but reduces the HP recovery effects of the Flask of Crimson Tears.

A far cry from godskin, this Albinauric hide mask is the product of malicious mockery.

fields.name: All-Knowing Armor (Altered)
fields.short_description: A relic catalogued from the Ashen archives.
fields.description: A fragment of a forgotten age, recorded by the Emporium. Its true purpose is veiled, but its presence is undeniable.

fields.name: All-Knowing Armor
fields.short_description: Armor set with countless eyes and ears. Worn by Gideon Ofnir, the All-Knowing.
fields.description:
Armor set with countless eyes and ears. Worn by Gideon Ofnir, the All-Knowing.

Knowledge begins with the recognition of one's ignorance. The realization that the search for knowledge is unending. But when Gideon glimpsed into the will of Queen Marika, he shuddered in fear.

At the end that should not be.

fields.name: All-Knowing Gauntlets
fields.short_description: Gauntlets set with countless eyes and ears. Worn by Gideon Ofnir, the All-Knowing.
fields.description:
Gauntlets set with countless eyes and ears. Worn by Gideon Ofnir, the All-Knowing.

Knowledge begins with the recognition of one's ignorance. The realization that the search for knowledge is unending. But when Gideon glimpsed into the will of Queen Marika, he shuddered in fear.

At the end that should not be.

fields.name: All-Knowing Greaves
fields.short_description: Greaves set with countless eyes and ears. Worn by Gideon Ofnir, the All-Knowing.
fields.description:
Greaves set with countless eyes and ears. Worn by Gideon Ofnir, the All-Knowing.

Knowledge begins with the recognition of one's ignorance. The realization that the search for knowledge is unending. But when Gideon glimpsed into the will of Queen Marika, he shuddered in fear.

At the end that should not be.

fields.name: All-Knowing Helm
fields.short_description: Helm set with countless eyes and ears. Worn by Gideon Ofnir, the All-Knowing.
fields.description:
Helm set with countless eyes and ears. Worn by Gideon Ofnir, the All-Knowing.

Knowledge begins with the recognition of one's ignorance. The realization that the search for knowledge is unending. But when Gideon glimpsed into the will of Queen Marika, he shuddered in fear.

At the end that should not be.

fields.name: Aristocrat Boots
fields.short_description: Boots made from tanned leather. Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital.
fields.description:
Boots made from tanned leather. Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital.

Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.

fields.name: Aristocrat Coat
fields.short_description: Tanned leather coat adorned with fine gold embroidery. Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital, and the belonging of a family which claims a knight as an ancestor.
fields.description:
Tanned leather coat adorned with fine gold embroidery. Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital, and the belonging of a family which claims a knight as an ancestor.

Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.

fields.name: Aristocrat Garb (Altered)
fields.short_description: A relic catalogued from the Ashen archives.
fields.description: A fragment of a forgotten age, recorded by the Emporium. Its true purpose is veiled, but its presence is undeniable.

fields.name: Aristocrat Garb
fields.short_description: High quality garb adorned with fine golden embroidery. Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital. Terribly faded and tattered.
fields.description:
High quality garb adorned with fine golden embroidery. Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital. Terribly faded and tattered.

Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.

fields.name: Aristocrat Hat
fields.short_description: Leather hat decorated with a withered feather. Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital, and the belonging of a family which claims a knight as an ancestor.
fields.description:
Leather hat decorated with a withered feather. Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital, and the belonging of a family which claims a knight as an ancestor.

Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.

fields.name: Aristocrat Headband
fields.short_description: Valuable headband featuring fine goldwork. Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital.
fields.description:
Valuable headband featuring fine goldwork. Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital.

Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.

fields.name: Ash-of-War Scarab
fields.short_description: Gray scarab worn directly on the head. These scarabs roll clumps of Ashes of War during their labors.
fields.description:
Gray scarab worn directly on the head. These scarabs roll clumps of Ashes of War during their labors.

Slightly reduces the FP cost of skills, but increases damage taken.

fields.name: Astrologer Gloves
fields.short_description: Gloves fashioned from fine, supple cloth. Worn by those who look to the cosmos above.
fields.description:
Gloves fashioned from fine, supple cloth. Worn by those who look to the cosmos above.

They read fate in the stars, and are said to be heirs of the glintstone sorcerers.

But alas, the night sky no longer cradles fate.

fields.name: Astrologer Hood
fields.short_description: Hood fashioned from supple cloth. Worn by those who look to the cosmos above.
fields.description:
Hood fashioned from supple cloth. Worn by those who look to the cosmos above.

They read fate in the stars, and are said to be heirs of the glintstone sorcerers.

But alas, the night sky no longer cradles fate.

fields.name: Astrologer Robe (Altered)
fields.short_description: A relic catalogued from the Ashen archives.
fields.description: A fragment of a forgotten age, recorded by the Emporium. Its true purpose is veiled, but its presence is undeniable.

fields.name: Astrologer Robe
fields.short_description: Robe fashioned from supple cloth. Worn by those who look to the cosmos above.
fields.description:
Robe fashioned from supple cloth. Worn by those who look to the cosmos above.

They read fate in the stars, and are said to be heirs of the glintstone sorcerers.

But alas, the night sky no longer cradles fate.

fields.name: Astrologer Trousers
fields.short_description: Trousers worn inside a robe. Worn by those who look to the cosmos above.
fields.description:
Trousers worn inside a robe. Worn by those who look to the cosmos above.

They read fate in the stars, and are said to be heirs of the glintstone sorcerers.

But alas, the night sky no longer cradles fate.

fields.name: Azur_s Glintstone Crown
fields.short_description: Crown of Azur, primeval current sorcerer, set with a prominent blue-green glintstone.
fields.description:
Crown of Azur, primeval current sorcerer, set with a prominent blue-green glintstone.

This crown replaced Azur's brain and skull altogether, and now, removed from his body, it is all but dead. What power remains within raises the potency of Azur's primeval current sorceries at the cost of additional FP consumption.

fields.name: Azur_s Glintstone Robe
fields.short_description: A robe reserved for grand masters at the Academy of Raya Lucaria. Corroded by blue-green glintstones.
fields.description:
A robe reserved for grand masters at the Academy of Raya Lucaria. Corroded by blue-green glintstones.

Since the grand masters Azur and Lusat were driven from the academy, no one has achieved their formerly-held rank.

fields.name: Azur_s Manchettes
fields.short_description: Manchettes corroded by blue-green glintstones. Worn by Azur, primeval current sorcerer.
fields.description:
Manchettes corroded by blue-green glintstones. Worn by Azur, primeval current sorcerer.

Azur had reached a near-inorganic state.

fields.name: Bandit Boots
fields.short_description: Leather boots worn by bandits.
fields.description:
Leather boots worn by bandits.

Light for ease of movement, and supple for masking sound. In trade, they offer little damage negation.

fields.name: Bandit Garb
fields.short_description: Leather garb worn by bandits.
fields.description:
Leather garb worn by bandits.

Light for ease of movement, and supple for masking sound. In trade, they offer little damage negation.

fields.name: Bandit Manchettes
fields.short_description: Manchettes made by simply wrapping dirty cloth around the arms. Worn by bandits.
fields.description: Manchettes made by simply wrapping dirty cloth around the arms. Worn by bandits.

fields.name: Bandit Mask
fields.short_description: Mask of black cloth that covers the mouth.
fields.description:
Mask of black cloth that covers the mouth.

Favored by bandits for hiding their faces, it also provides some protection against poison.

fields.name: Banished Knight Armor (Altered)
fields.short_description: A relic catalogued from the Ashen archives.
fields.description: A fragment of a forgotten age, recorded by the Emporium. Its true purpose is veiled, but its presence is undeniable.

fields.name: Banished Knight Armor
fields.short_description: Thick, full set of armor covering the entire body. This armor was worn by knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes.
fields.description:
Thick, full set of armor covering the entire body. This armor was worn by knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes.

These fierce warriors were each and all accomplished. Perhaps that is why, despite their territorial losses, they were still named knights.

fields.name: Banished Knight Gauntlets
fields.short_description: Thick, full set of armor covering the entire body. These gauntlets were worn by knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes.
fields.description:
Thick, full set of armor covering the entire body. These gauntlets were worn by knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes.

These fierce warriors were each and all accomplished. Perhaps that is why, despite their territorial losses, they were still named knights.

fields.name: Banished Knight Greaves
fields.short_description: Thick, full set of armor covering the entire body. These greaves were worn by knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes.
fields.description:
Thick, full set of armor covering the entire body. These greaves were worn by knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes.

These fierce warriors were each and all accomplished. Perhaps that is why, despite their territorial losses, they were still named knights.

fields.name: Banished Knight Helm (Altered)
fields.short_description: Thick, full set of armor covering the entire body. This helm was worn by knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes.
fields.description:
Thick, full set of armor covering the entire body. This helm was worn by knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes.

These fierce warriors were each and all accomplished. Perhaps that is why, despite their territorial losses, they were still named knights.

fields.name: Banished Knight Helm
fields.short_description: Thick, full set of armor covering the entire body. This helm was worn by knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes.
fields.description:
Thick, full set of armor covering the entire body. This helm was worn by knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes.

Perhaps the deep-red scarf was used to block the winds, for on the outskirts, the winds bite with a stinging fierceness.

fields.name: Battlemage Legwraps
fields.short_description: Legwraps worn by scholars of the Raya Lucaria Academy, tattered from being worn on the battlefield.
fields.description: Legwraps worn by scholars of the Raya Lucaria Academy, tattered from being worn on the battlefield.

fields.name: Battlemage Manchettes
fields.short_description: Manchettes worn by scholars of the Raya Lucaria Academy, tattered from being worn on the battlefield.
fields.description: Manchettes worn by scholars of the Raya Lucaria Academy, tattered from being worn on the battlefield.

fields.name: Battlemage Robe
fields.short_description: Robe worn by scholars of the Raya Lucaria Academy scholar, tattered from being worn on the battlefield.
fields.description:
Robe worn by scholars of the Raya Lucaria Academy scholar, tattered from being worn on the battlefield.

Whenever war broke out and the academy sealed its gates, only Haima's scholars dared venture outside. Seclusion is no way to foster discovery; it is only a convenient form of escape.

fields.name: Beast Champion Armor (Altered)
fields.short_description: A relic catalogued from the Ashen archives.
fields.description: A fragment of a forgotten age, recorded by the Emporium. Its true purpose is veiled, but its presence is undeniable.

fields.name: Beast Champion Armor
fields.short_description: Silver armor engraved with tiny beasts. Worn by Bernahl the Recusant.
fields.description:
Silver armor engraved with tiny beasts. Worn by Bernahl the Recusant.

Beasts are drawn to champions, and to lords. And this armor befits a champion worthy of becoming a lord. And that is what Bernahl was.

Until his maiden threw herself into the fire.

fields.name: Beast Champion Gauntlets
fields.short_description: Silver gauntlets engraved with tiny beasts. Worn by Bernahl the Recusant.
fields.description:
Silver gauntlets engraved with tiny beasts. Worn by Bernahl the Recusant.

Beasts are drawn to champions, and to lords. And this armor befits a champion worthy of becoming a lord. And that is what Bernahl was.

Until his maiden threw herself into the fire.

fields.name: Beast Champion Greaves
fields.short_description: Silver greaves engraved with tiny beasts. Worn by Bernahl the Recusant.
fields.description:
Silver greaves engraved with tiny beasts. Worn by Bernahl the Recusant.

Beasts are drawn to champions, and to lords. And this armor befits a champion worthy of becoming a lord. And that is what Bernahl was.

Until his maiden threw herself into the fire.

fields.name: Beast Champion Helm
fields.short_description: Silver helm engraved with tiny beasts. Worn by Bernahl the Recusant.
fields.description:
Silver helm engraved with tiny beasts. Worn by Bernahl the Recusant.

The beasts, their eyes and ears covered, represent an oath: "See nothing, hear nothing, doubt nothing, and carry on, along the path set in stone."

fields.name: Black Dumpling
fields.short_description: Mask forced on a victim's head to lend torture an extra degree of cruelty. It magnifies one's fears and makes them acutely aware of all forms of pain.
fields.description:
Mask forced on a victim's head to lend torture an extra degree of cruelty. It magnifies one's fears and makes them acutely aware of all forms of pain.

Raises attack power when the wearer suffers from madness.

When the Black Dumpling goes on, the torturer no longer seeks answers; only to inflict suffering without hope of relief.

fields.name: Black Hood
fields.short_description: Hood of lusterless black fabric that conceals its wearer's identity.
fields.description:
Hood of lusterless black fabric that conceals its wearer's identity.

In this world, there is very little that must necessarily be known.

fields.name: Black Knife Armor (Altered)
fields.short_description: Armor used by the Black Knife Assassins. Crafted with scale armor that makes no sound.
fields.description:
Armor used by the Black Knife Assassins. Crafted with scale armor that makes no sound.

The assassins that carried out the deeds of the Night of the Black Knives were all women, and rumored to be Numen who had close ties with Marika herself.

fields.name: Black Knife Armor
fields.short_description: Scale armor used by the Black Knife Assassins, forged to make no sound.
fields.description:
Scale armor used by the Black Knife Assassins, forged to make no sound.

Traces of power yet remain in its concealing veil, which muffles the sound of footsteps.

The assassins that carried out the deeds of the Night of the Black Knives were all women, and rumored to be Numen who had close ties with Marika herself.

fields.name: Black Knife Gauntlets
fields.short_description: Gauntlets used by the Black Knife Assassins. Crafted with scale armor that makes no sound.
fields.description:
Gauntlets used by the Black Knife Assassins. Crafted with scale armor that makes no sound.

The assassins that carried out the deeds of the Night of the Black Knives were all women, and rumored to be Numen who had close ties with Marika herself.

fields.name: Black Knife Greaves
fields.short_description: Greaves used by the Black Knife Assassins. Crafted with scale armor that makes no sound.
fields.description:
Greaves used by the Black Knife Assassins. Crafted with scale armor that makes no sound.

The assassins that carried out the deeds of the Night of the Black Knives were all women, and rumored to be Numen who had close ties with Marika herself.

fields.name: Black Knife Hood
fields.short_description: Hood used by the Black Knife Assassins.
fields.description:
Hood used by the Black Knife Assassins.

The assassins that carried out the deeds of the Night of the Black Knives were all women, and rumored to be Numen who had close ties with Marika herself.

fields.name: Black Wolf Mask
fields.short_description: A mask fashioned after the head of a black wolf.
fields.description:
A mask fashioned after the head of a black wolf.

Relic of an assassin who assumed the guise of Ranni the Witch's loyal shadow. The likeness is striking.

fields.name: Blackflame Monk Armor
fields.short_description: Black iron armor adorned with ashen cloth. Attire of the Blackflame Monks.
fields.description:
Black iron armor adorned with ashen cloth. Attire of the Blackflame Monks.

The Blackflame Monks, enthralled by the god-slaying black flame, became traitors, abandoning their posts as guardians. The seduction of a taboo is never easily spurned.

fields.name: Blackflame Monk Gauntlets
fields.short_description: Black iron gauntlets featuring a flame motif. Attire of the Blackflame Monks.
fields.description:
Black iron gauntlets featuring a flame motif. Attire of the Blackflame Monks.

The Blackflame Monks, enthralled by the god-slaying black flame, became traitors, abandoning their posts as guardians. The seduction of a taboo is never easily spurned.

fields.name: Blackflame Monk Greaves
fields.short_description: Black iron greaves featuring a flame motif. Attire of the Blackflame Monks.
fields.description:
Black iron greaves featuring a flame motif. Attire of the Blackflame Monks.

The Blackflame Monks, enthralled by the god-slaying black flame, became traitors, abandoning their posts as guardians. The seduction of a taboo is never easily spurned.

fields.name: Blackflame Monk Hood
fields.short_description: Mail hood of iron links covering a headband engraved with flames. Attire of the Blackflame Monks.
fields.description:
Mail hood of iron links covering a headband engraved with flames. Attire of the Blackflame Monks.

The Blackflame Monks, enthralled by the god-slaying black flame, became traitors, abandoning their posts as guardians. The seduction of a taboo is never easily spurned.

fields.name: Blackguard_s Iron Mask
fields.short_description: Iron mask forced on convicted prisoners. Worn by the blackguard Big Boggart.
fields.description:
Iron mask forced on convicted prisoners. Worn by the blackguard Big Boggart.

To Boggart, the mask made him all the more threatening, and helped him get what he wanted. But it was also a mirror of his emptiness.

fields.name: Blaidd_s Armor (Altered)
fields.short_description: Well-worn black armor of the man-wolf Blaidd.
fields.description:
Well-worn black armor of the man-wolf Blaidd.

Blaidd, who served as Ranni's shadow, was a loyal ally who would defy destiny itself if it would have him turn upon his Lady.

fields.name: Blaidd_s Armor
fields.short_description: Well-worn black armor of the man-wolf Blaidd.
fields.description:
Well-worn black armor of the man-wolf Blaidd.

The pelt serves as a cape, protecting from cold. Blaidd was the blade of Ranni, but the cold bothered him anyway.

fields.short_description: Well-worn black gauntlets of the man-wolf Blaidd.

fields.name: Bloodhound Knight Armor
fields.short_description: Metal armor with a jutting breastplate. Worn by the Bloodhound Knights.
fields.description:
Metal armor with a jutting breastplate. Worn by the Bloodhound Knights.

The Bloodhound Knights are trained as hunters and known to be unshakable trackers.

Without the use of language, each knight chooses his own master. Once the decision has been made, the knight stays loyal for life.

fields.short_description: Metal gauntlets of the Bloodhound Knights.
