fields.name: Marais Mask
fields.short_description: Mask in the image of a white-haired young noble. Customarily worn by the head of House Marais. Increases arcane.
fields.description:
Mask in the image of a white-haired young noble. Customarily worn by the head of House Marais. Increases arcane.

The Marais family has a dual history spanning generations, serving as both executioners and castellans of the Shaded Castle. This mask bears the likeness of the first of their line.

fields.name: Marais Robe
fields.short_description: Robe with a black mantle across the shoulders. Customarily worn by the head of House Marais.
fields.description:
Robe with a black mantle across the shoulders. Customarily worn by the head of House Marais.

The sons of House Marais are all sickly born. Little wonder that Maleigh Marais would be so beguiled by the beautiful and fierce goddess who was born into rot.

fields.name: Marionette Soldier Armor
fields.short_description: Armor of metal bands arranged in a lattice. Worn by marionette soldiers, crafted to serve the sorcerers.
fields.description:
Armor of metal bands arranged in a lattice. Worn by marionette soldiers, crafted to serve the sorcerers.

The construction of this armor is remarkably crude, now rusted over and severely dented.

For a doll, the only thing that matters is that it does not break.

fields.name: Marionette Soldier Birdhelm
fields.short_description: Metal helm formed in the likeness of the face of a bird. Worn by avionette soldiers, crafted to serve the sorcerers.
fields.description:
Metal helm formed in the likeness of the face of a bird. Worn by avionette soldiers, crafted to serve the sorcerers.

The construction of this helm is remarkably crude.

For a doll, the only thing that matters is that it does not break.

fields.name: Marionette Soldier Helm
fields.short_description: Cylindrical helm of plate metal reinforced with a lattice. Worn by marionette soldiers, crafted to serve the sorcerers.
fields.description:
Cylindrical helm of plate metal reinforced with a lattice. Worn by marionette soldiers, crafted to serve the sorcerers.

The construction of this helm is remarkably crude.

For a doll, the only thing that matters is that it does not break.

fields.name: Mask of Confidence
fields.short_description: Mask with the mouth sewn shut with gold thread. Increases arcane.
fields.description:
Mask with the mouth sewn shut with gold thread. Increases arcane.

When Radagon married Rennala, he ordered the Carian magic preceptors to don these masks. To make it clear that all of their matters were to be kept strictly private.

fields.name: Mausoleum Gauntlets
fields.short_description: Gauntlets worn by headless soldiers who endlessly guard the Wandering Mausoleum. Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.
fields.description: Gauntlets worn by headless soldiers who endlessly guard the Wandering Mausoleum. Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.

fields.name: Mausoleum Greaves
fields.short_description: Greaves worn by headless soldiers who endlessly guard the Wandering Mausoleum. Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.
fields.description: Greaves worn by headless soldiers who endlessly guard the Wandering Mausoleum. Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.

fields.name: Mausoleum Knight Armor (Altered)
fields.short_description: A relic catalogued from the Ashen archives.
fields.description: A fragment of a forgotten age, recorded by the Emporium. Its true purpose is veiled, but its presence is undeniable.

fields.name: Mausoleum Knight Armor
fields.short_description: Armor worn by headless knights who endlessly guard the Wandering Mausoleum.
fields.description:
Armor worn by headless knights who endlessly guard the Wandering Mausoleum.

The wing-shaped ornaments on its back evoke the Deathbird. A self-inflicted curse that ties the spirits of these loyal knights to the land, having willingly beheaded themselves so that they may serve their masters in death.

fields.name: Mausoleum Knight Gauntlets
fields.short_description: Gauntlets worn by headless knights who endlessly guard the Wandering Mausoleum. Time has yet to dull their luster.
fields.description: Gauntlets worn by headless knights who endlessly guard the Wandering Mausoleum. Time has yet to dull their luster.

fields.name: Mausoleum Knight Greaves
fields.short_description: Greaves worn by headless knights who endlessly guard the Wandering Mausoleum. Time has yet to dull their luster.
fields.description: Greaves worn by headless knights who endlessly guard the Wandering Mausoleum. Time has yet to dull their luster.

fields.name: Mausoleum Surcoat
fields.short_description: Armor worn by headless soldiers who endlessly guard the Wandering Mausoleum.
fields.description:
Armor worn by headless soldiers who endlessly guard the Wandering Mausoleum.

The surcoat depicts the mausoleum bell, which rings in constant mourning for the soulless demigods.

fields.name: Mushroom Arms
fields.short_description: Mushrooms found growing all over the body. These overgrown mushrooms have colonized the arms.
fields.description:
Mushrooms found growing all over the body. These overgrown mushrooms have colonized the arms.

To those enraptured by the scarlet rot, they are holy vestments that root one to the earth.

fields.name: Mushroom Body
fields.short_description: Mushrooms found growing all over the body. These overgrown mushrooms have colonized the torso.
fields.description:
Mushrooms found growing all over the body. These overgrown mushrooms have colonized the torso.

To those enraptured by the scarlet rot, they are holy vestments that root one to the earth.

fields.name: Mushroom Crown
fields.short_description: Mushrooms found growing all over the body. These overgrown mushrooms form a towering headpiece.
fields.description:
Mushrooms found growing all over the body. These overgrown mushrooms form a towering headpiece.

Raises attack power when something nearby suffers from poison or rot.

Long ago, great lords served the scarlet rot. Perhaps such fungal bodies served as their crowns.

fields.name: Mushroom Head
fields.short_description: Mushrooms found growing all over the body. These overgrown mushrooms have colonized the head.
fields.description:
Mushrooms found growing all over the body. These overgrown mushrooms have colonized the head.

To those enraptured by the scarlet rot, they are holy vestments that root one to the earth.

fields.name: Mushroom Legs
fields.short_description: Mushrooms found growing all over the body. These overgrown mushrooms have colonized the legs.
fields.description:
Mushrooms found growing all over the body. These overgrown mushrooms have colonized the legs.

To those enraptured by the scarlet rot, they are holy vestments that root one to the earth.

fields.name: Navy Hood
fields.short_description: A hooded cloak of deep navy. Worn by expatriated royalty. Increases mind.
fields.description:
A hooded cloak of deep navy. Worn by expatriated royalty. Increases mind.

Such cloaks were gifted to those who departed on missions to faraway lands, from which they would never return. But what choice did they have, having seen the guidance of grace?

fields.name: Night Maiden Armor
fields.short_description: Armor worn by the nightmaidens of the Eternal City. Indicates the highest clerical rank, and includes a silk cape.
fields.description:
Armor worn by the nightmaidens of the Eternal City. Indicates the highest clerical rank, and includes a silk cape.

Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

fields.name: Night Maiden Twin Crown
fields.short_description: Twin crowns worn by the nightmaidens of the Eternal City. Indicates the highest clerical rank, and hides the eyes with silk.
fields.description:
Twin crowns worn by the nightmaidens of the Eternal City. Indicates the highest clerical rank, and hides the eyes with silk.

Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

fields.short_description: A relic catalogued from the Ashen archives.
fields.description: A fragment of a forgotten age, recorded by the Emporium. Its true purpose is veiled, but its presence is undeniable.

fields.name: Night_s Cavalry Armor
fields.short_description: Pitch-black armor thinly painted with dried blood. Worn by the Night's Cavalry who ride funeral steeds.
fields.description:
Pitch-black armor thinly painted with dried blood. Worn by the Night's Cavalry who ride funeral steeds.

The Night's Cavalry, who now wander the dim roads of night, were once led by the Fell Omen and were deliverers of death for great warriors, knights, and champions.

fields.name: Night_s Cavalry Gauntlets
fields.short_description: Pitch-black gauntlets thinly painted with dried blood. Worn by the Night's Cavalry who ride funeral steeds.

fields.name: Noble_s Gloves
fields.short_description: Gloves of plush leather. Worn by expatriated royalty.
fields.description:
Gloves of plush leather. Worn by expatriated royalty.

A gift of such rare beauty, a royal wouldn't disgrace their illustrious heritage even if found dead, in a ditch, in the middle of nowhere, while wearing such splendid raiment.

fields.name: Noble_s Traveling Garb
fields.short_description: Traveling attire fashioned from metallic white silk thread. Worn by expatriated royalty.
fields.description:
Traveling attire fashioned from metallic white silk thread. Worn by expatriated royalty.

A gift of such rare beauty, a royal wouldn't disgrace their illustrious heritage even if found dead, in a ditch, in the middle of nowhere, while wearing such splendid raiment.

fields.name: Noble_s Trousers
fields.short_description: White trousers of superior craftsmanship. Worn by expatriated royalty.
fields.description:
White trousers of superior craftsmanship. Worn by expatriated royalty.

A gift of such rare beauty, a royal wouldn't disgrace their illustrious heritage even if found dead, in a ditch, in the middle of nowhere, while wearing such splendid raiment.

fields.name: Nomadic Merchant_s Chapeau
fields.short_description: Chapeau of the nomadic merchants. Decorated with tiny gems in a wide spectrum of colors.
fields.description:
Chapeau of the nomadic merchants. Decorated with tiny gems in a wide spectrum of colors.

These merchants once thrived as the Great Caravan, but after being accused of heretical beliefs, their entire clan was rounded up and buried alive far underground.

Then, they chanted a curse of despair, and summoned the flame of frenzy.

fields.name: Nomadic Merchant_s Finery (Altered)
fields.short_description: A relic catalogued from the Ashen archives.
fields.description: A fragment of a forgotten age, recorded by the Emporium. Its true purpose is veiled, but its presence is undeniable.

These merchants once thrived as the Great Caravan, but after being accused of heretical beliefs, their entire clan was rounded up and buried alive far underground.

Then, they chanted a curse of despair, and summoned the flame of frenzy.

fields.name: Nox Mirrorhelm
fields.short_description: Helm fashioned from a crystal looking-glass. One among the Eternal City's ritual implements. Easily broken and weak against striking attacks.
fields.description:
Helm fashioned from a crystal looking-glass. One among the Eternal City's ritual implements. Easily broken and weak against striking attacks.

Worn by those committed to high treason, it wards off the intervention of the Greater Will and its vassal Fingers.

fields.short_description: Armor worn by the monks of the Eternal City.
fields.description:
Armor worn by the monks of the Eternal City.

Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

fields.short_description: Armor worn by the monks of the Eternal City, with a silk cape attached.
fields.description:

fields.short_description: Armor worn by swordstresses of the Eternal City. These women are the personal guards of the nightmaidens.
fields.description:

Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

fields.short_description: Armor worn by swordstresses of the Eternal City. These women are the personal guards of the nightmaidens, and wear silk capes.

Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

fields.short_description: Crown worn by swordstresses of the Eternal City. The silk eye covering is removed, flaunting convention.

Crown worn by swordstresses of the Eternal City. The silk eye covering is removed, flaunting convention.

Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

fields.short_description: Crown worn by swordstresses of the Eternal City. These women are the personal guards of the nightmaidens, and the silk hides their eyes.

Crown worn by swordstresses of the Eternal City. These women are the personal guards of the nightmaidens, and the silk hides their eyes.

Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

fields.name: Octopus Head
fields.short_description: A land octopus whelp worn directly on the head. Has a lingering warmth reminiscent of human skin.
fields.description:
A land octopus whelp worn directly on the head. Has a lingering warmth reminiscent of human skin.

Those who can withstand the smell will find its organic elasticity excellent for negating strikes.

fields.name: Official_s Attire
fields.short_description: Grubby blue robe worn by magisterial officials to carry out their grim tasks.
fields.description:
Grubby blue robe worn by magisterial officials to carry out their grim tasks.

Surveillance, executions, gruesome rituals The darkest duties drive the wheels of mankind.

fields.name: Okina Mask
fields.short_description: A wooden mask that depicts an old man bearing his teeth. The source of the sobriquet of the great swordsman of the Land of Reeds. Raises dexterity as it lowers focus.
fields.description:
A wooden mask that depicts an old man bearing his teeth. The source of the sobriquet of the great swordsman of the Land of Reeds. Raises dexterity as it lowers focus.

The more he sharpened his mind, the more the absurdities of the world came into stark relief. And so Okina renounced it all, and rose to a higher plane. There was only himself. His katana. And its mastery.

Before long, Okina became a demon of a swordsman.

fields.name: Old Aristocrat Cowl
fields.short_description: Cowl made of soft cloth. Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital. Garb favored by the aged.
fields.description:
Cowl made of soft cloth. Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital. Garb favored by the aged.

Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.

fields.name: Old Aristocrat Gown
fields.short_description: Gown of soft cloth adorned with fine gold embroidery. Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital. Garb favored by the aged.
fields.description:
Gown of soft cloth adorned with fine gold embroidery. Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital. Garb favored by the aged.

Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.

fields.short_description: Hard-wearing shoes made of leather. Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital. Garb favored by the aged.
fields.description:
Hard-wearing shoes made of leather. Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital. Garb favored by the aged.

Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.

fields.name: Old Sorcerer_s Legwraps
fields.short_description: Ragged waistcloth that extends to the thighs. Common amongst old-fashioned sorcerers.
fields.description: Ragged waistcloth that extends to the thighs. Common amongst old-fashioned sorcerers.

fields.name: Olivinus Glintstone Crown
fields.short_description: One of the glintstone crowns bestowed upon Raya Lucaria scholars whose pursuits were deemed worthy.
fields.description:
One of the glintstone crowns bestowed upon Raya Lucaria scholars whose pursuits were deemed worthy.

Increases intelligence to the detriment of HP.

The lineage of the Olivinus Conspectus began with the sorcerer Lusat, and its adherents continue his study of meteors.

fields.name: Omen Armor
fields.short_description: Malformed armor resembling an Omen with its horns cut off.
fields.description:
Malformed armor resembling an Omen with its horns cut off.

Worn by the Dung Eater. The heavy, sun-shaped medallion represents both the guidance he once saw, and the ring to which it will one day lead.

fields.name: Omen Gauntlets
fields.short_description: Malformed gauntlets resembling an Omen with its horns cut off.
fields.description:
Malformed gauntlets resembling an Omen with its horns cut off.

Worn by the Dung Eater, their form is a vision of the landscape of his mind, and of his appearance as he wished to see it.

The heart of an Omen without the body to match; could there be any crueler existence? What does it matter, then, if the curse claims it all?

fields.name: Omen Greaves
fields.short_description: Malformed greaves resembling an Omen with its horns cut off.
fields.description:
Malformed greaves resembling an Omen with its horns cut off.

Worn by the Dung Eater, their form is a vision of the landscape of his mind, and of his appearance as he wished to see it.

The heart of an Omen without the body to match; could there be any crueler existence? What does it matter, then, if the curse claims it all?

fields.name: Omen Helm
fields.short_description: Malformed helm resembling an Omen with its horns cut off.
fields.description:
Malformed helm resembling an Omen with its horns cut off.

Worn by the Dung Eater, its form is a vision of the landscape of his mind, and of his appearance as he wished to see it.

The heart of an Omen without the body to match; could there be any crueler existence? What does it matter, then, if the curse claims it all?

fields.name: Omenkiller Boots
fields.short_description: Stiff leather boots worn by the Omenkillers.
fields.description: Stiff leather boots worn by the Omenkillers.

fields.name: Omenkiller Long Gloves
fields.short_description: Long, stiff leather gloves worn by the Omenkillers.
fields.description: Long, stiff leather gloves worn by the Omenkillers.

fields.name: Omenkiller Robe
fields.short_description: Robe worn by the Omenkillers, butchers of twisted conscience.
fields.description:
Robe worn by the Omenkillers, butchers of twisted conscience.

Its thick apron is worn in remembrance of Rollo, the progenitor of the Omenkillers and a perfumer of antiquity.

fields.name: Omensmirk Mask
fields.short_description: Mask with long, hideously twisted horns worn by the Omenkillers. Increases strength.
fields.description:
Mask with long, hideously twisted horns worn by the Omenkillers. Increases strength.

Bears the smirking face of an elder, twisted in wicked delight.

This visage is carved in the image of the evil spirits that haunt the Omen in their nightmares.

fields.name: Page Garb (Altered)
fields.short_description: A relic catalogued from the Ashen archives.
fields.description: A fragment of a forgotten age, recorded by the Emporium. Its true purpose is veiled, but its presence is undeniable.

fields.name: Page Garb
fields.short_description: Garb worn by pages who serve the nobility and are mindful to keep them out of harm's way.
fields.description:
Garb worn by pages who serve the nobility and are mindful to keep them out of harm's way.

Traveling wear tailored with exquisite precision, to avoid any undue shame for the page's master.

fields.name: Page Hood
fields.short_description: Hood worn by pages who serve the nobility and are mindful to keep them out of harm's way.
fields.description:
Hood worn by pages who serve the nobility and are mindful to keep them out of harm's way.

The unassuming sack-like appearance befits their unseen and unknown stature.

fields.name: Page Trousers
fields.short_description: Trousers worn by pages who serve the nobility and are mindful to keep them out of harm's way.
fields.description:
Trousers worn by pages who serve the nobility and are mindful to keep them out of harm's way.

Traveling wear tailored with exquisite precision, to avoid any undue shame for the page's master.

fields.name: Perfumer Gloves
fields.short_description: Gloves of an Erdtree Capital perfumer.
fields.description:
Gloves of an Erdtree Capital perfumer.

In times past, the role of perfumer was much respected; a blessed apothecary in the eyes of the many. But after entering the battlefields of the Shattering they performed no such role, trading their aromatics for poisons and explosives.

fields.name: Perfumer Hood
fields.short_description: Hood of an Erdtree Capital perfumer.
fields.description:
Hood of an Erdtree Capital perfumer.

In times past, the role of perfumer was much respected; a blessed apothecary in the eyes of the many. But after entering the battlefields of the Shattering they performed no such role, trading their aromatics for poisons and explosives.

fields.name: Perfumer Robe (Altered)
fields.short_description: A relic catalogued from the Ashen archives.
fields.description: A fragment of a forgotten age, recorded by the Emporium. Its true purpose is veiled, but its presence is undeniable.

fields.name: Perfumer Robe
fields.short_description: Robe of an Erdtree Capital perfumer.
fields.description:
Robe of an Erdtree Capital perfumer.

The thick front apron embroidered with a depiction of the Erdtree is proof of mastery of the apothecarial arts, and its weight symbolizes the onus of both pride and responsibility.

fields.name: Perfumer Sarong
fields.short_description: Sarong of an Erdtree Capital perfumer.
fields.description:
Sarong of an Erdtree Capital perfumer.

In times past, the role of perfumer was much respected; a blessed apothecary in the eyes of the many. But after entering the battlefields of the Shattering they performed no such role, trading their aromatics for poisons and explosives.

fields.name: Perfumer_s Traveling Garb (Altered)
fields.short_description: A relic catalogued from the Ashen archives.
fields.description: A fragment of a forgotten age, recorded by the Emporium. Its true purpose is veiled, but its presence is undeniable.

fields.name: Perfumer_s Traveling Garb
fields.short_description: Garb of a traveling perfumer of no renown.
fields.description:
Garb of a traveling perfumer of no renown.

The thick front apron, the badge of a perfumer, has been replaced with a more simple one made from soft leather.

fields.name: Preceptor_s Big Hat
fields.short_description: Large hat with the movements of the stars drawn on the inside of the brim. Worn by the magic preceptors who served the Carian royals.
fields.description:
Large hat with the movements of the stars drawn on the inside of the brim. Worn by the magic preceptors who served the Carian royals.

Increases mind to the detriment of stamina.

Glintstone sorcerers are the descendants of astrologers, a fact that the Carians remain aware of. Even if their fate has been long severed from the stars.

fields.name: Preceptor_s Gloves
fields.short_description: Gloves of the magic preceptors who serve the Carian royals. Black and perfectly discreet.
fields.description: Gloves of the magic preceptors who serve the Carian royals. Black and perfectly discreet.

fields.name: Preceptor_s Long Gown (Altered)
fields.short_description: Modest garb, previously worn under a long, bright blue gown with the movements of the stars drawn upon it.
fields.description: Modest garb, previously worn under a long, bright blue gown with the movements of the stars drawn upon it.

fields.name: Preceptor_s Long Gown
fields.short_description: A long, bright blue gown with the movements of the stars drawn upon it. Worn by the magic preceptors who served the Carian royals.
fields.description:
A long, bright blue gown with the movements of the stars drawn upon it. Worn by the magic preceptors who served the Carian royals.

Glintstone sorcerers are the descendants of astrologers, a fact that the Carians remain aware of. Even if their fate has been long severed from the stars.

fields.name: Preceptor_s Trousers
fields.short_description: Trousers of the magic preceptors who serve the Carian royals. Black and perfectly discreet.
fields.description: Trousers of the magic preceptors who serve the Carian royals. Black and perfectly discreet.

fields.name: Prisoner Clothing
fields.short_description: Tattered clothing. Worn by a prisoner convicted of an appalling crime.
fields.description:
Tattered clothing. Worn by a prisoner convicted of an appalling crime.

Never once washed, every fiber is filthy.

fields.name: Prisoner Iron Mask
fields.short_description: Iron mask forced on a prisoner convicted of an appalling crime. Thick, heavy, and utterly stifling.
fields.description:
Iron mask forced on a prisoner convicted of an appalling crime. Thick, heavy, and utterly stifling.

A foul creation designed to torment the wearer, either slowly fermenting hatred within their heart, or a spiritual fervor that is near indistinguishable from it.

fields.name: Prisoner Trousers
fields.short_description: Tattered trousers. Worn by a prisoner convicted of an appalling crime.
fields.description:
Tattered trousers. Worn by a prisoner convicted of an appalling crime.

Never once washed, every fiber is filthy. The smell is beyond belief.

fields.name: Prophet Blindfold
fields.short_description: Blindfold of exiled prophets who foretold misfortuneand were persecuted and driven from their homes as a result.
fields.description:
Blindfold of exiled prophets who foretold misfortuneand were persecuted and driven from their homes as a result.

Why hesitate, if the path leading to the future is clear? Just close your eyes, and walk.

fields.name: Prophet Robe (Altered)
fields.short_description: Robe of exiled prophets who foretold misfortuneand were persecuted and driven from their homes as a result.
fields.description:
Robe of exiled prophets who foretold misfortuneand were persecuted and driven from their homes as a result.

Made from rough fabric that scrapes against the skin like a sharpening file.

fields.name: Prophet Robe
fields.short_description: Robe of exiled prophets who foretold misfortuneand were persecuted and driven from their homes as a result.
fields.description:
Robe of exiled prophets who foretold misfortuneand were persecuted and driven from their homes as a result.

The shackles around the neck warn passersby not to lend an ear to their sermons.

fields.name: Prophet Trousers
fields.short_description: Trousers of exiled prophets who foretold misfortuneand were persecuted and driven from their homes as a result.
fields.description:
Trousers of exiled prophets who foretold misfortuneand were persecuted and driven from their homes as a result.

Made from rough fabric that scrapes against the skin like a sharpening file.

fields.name: Pumpkin Helm
fields.short_description: An oval helm large enough to cover any head. Very heavy and very hard.
fields.description:
An oval helm large enough to cover any head. Very heavy and very hard.

Reduces damage from headshots and impacts.

The inside of the helm is pitch black, keeping the crazed warrior within from panicking. Perhaps its rather roomy interior also helps alleviate feelings of pressure and claustrophobia.

fields.name: Queen_s Bracelets
fields.short_description: Bracelets indicating the highest order of sorcerer. Worn by Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon.
fields.description:
Bracelets indicating the highest order of sorcerer. Worn by Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon.

When Rennala, head of both the Academy of Raya Lucaria and the Carian royal family, lost her husband Radagon, her heart went along with him.

And then, those at the academy realized. That Rennala was no champion, after all.

fields.name: Queen_s Crescent Crown
fields.short_description: A tall crown depicting the moon. Worn by Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon. Increases intelligence.
fields.description:
A tall crown depicting the moon. Worn by Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon. Increases intelligence.

When Rennala, head of both the Academy of Raya Lucaria and the Carian royal family, lost her husband Radagon, her heart went along with him.

And then, those at the academy realized. That Rennala was no champion, after all.

fields.name: Queen_s Leggings
fields.short_description: Leggings indicating the highest order of sorcerer. Worn by Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon.
fields.description:
Leggings indicating the highest order of sorcerer. Worn by Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon.

When Rennala, head of both the Academy of Raya Lucaria and the Carian royal family, lost her husband Radagon, her heart went along with him.

And then, those at the academy realized. That Rennala was no champion, after all.

fields.name: Queen_s Robe
fields.short_description: Robe indicating the highest order of sorcerer. Worn by Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon.
fields.description:
Robe indicating the highest order of sorcerer. Worn by Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon.

When Rennala, head of both the Academy of Raya Lucaria and the Carian royal family, lost her husband Radagon, her heart went along with him.

And then, those at the academy realized. That Rennala was no champion, after all.

fields.name: Radahn Soldier Gauntlets
fields.short_description: Gauntlets worn by soldiers who fought by General Radahn's side. Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.
fields.description: Gauntlets worn by soldiers who fought by General Radahn's side. Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.

fields.name: Radahn Soldier Greaves
fields.short_description: Greaves worn by soldiers who fought by General Radahn's side. Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.
fields.description: Greaves worn by soldiers who fought by General Radahn's side. Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.

fields.name: Radahn Soldier Helm
fields.short_description: Helm worn by soldiers who fought by General Radahn's side. Its visor is fashioned after a lion's fangs.
fields.description: Helm worn by soldiers who fought by General Radahn's side. Its visor is fashioned after a lion's fangs.

fields.name: Radahn_s Gauntlets
fields.short_description: Gauntlets depicting the golden lion. Worn by General Radahn.
fields.description:
Gauntlets depicting the golden lion. Worn by General Radahn.

The golden lion is said to symbolize Godfrey, the first Elden Lord, and his beast regent, Serosh. From his youngest years, Radahn was naturally captivated by the Lord of the Battlefield.

fields.name: Radahn_s Greaves
fields.short_description: Greaves depicting the golden lion. Worn by General Radahn.
fields.description:
Greaves depicting the golden lion. Worn by General Radahn.

The golden lion is said to symbolize Godfrey, the first Elden Lord, and his beast regent, Serosh. From his youngest years, Radahn was naturally captivated by the Lord of the Battlefield.

fields.name: Radahn_s Lion Armor (Altered)
fields.short_description: A relic catalogued from the Ashen archives.
fields.description: A fragment of a forgotten age, recorded by the Emporium. Its true purpose is veiled, but its presence is undeniable.

fields.name: Radahn_s Lion Armor
fields.short_description: Armor depicting the golden lion. Worn by General Radahn.
fields.description:
Armor depicting the golden lion. Worn by General Radahn.

The golden lion is said to symbolize Godfrey, the first Elden Lord, and his beast regent, Serosh. From his youngest years, Radahn was naturally captivated by the Lord of the Battlefield.

fields.name: Radahn_s Redmane Helm
fields.short_description: Helm of the golden lion, with flowing red hair. Worn by General Radahn.
fields.description:
Helm of the golden lion, with flowing red hair. Worn by General Radahn.

Radahn inherited the furious, flaming red hair of his father Radagon, and is fond of its heroic implications.

"I was born a champion's cub. Now I am the Lord of the Battlefield's lion."

fields.name: Radiant Gold Mask
fields.short_description: A mask designed to resemble a blazing golden halo. Created and left behind by Lord Goldmask, a staunch pursuer of Golden Order fundamentalism.
fields.description:
A mask designed to resemble a blazing golden halo. Created and left behind by Lord Goldmask, a staunch pursuer of Golden Order fundamentalism.

Strengthens Golden Order incantations.

Its striking design represents both the brilliant inspiration that once shone upon him, and the vision of a ring that he will surely find at the end of his pursuit.

"To you who seek to shine as I do, wear it well!"

fields.name: Raging Wolf Armor (Altered)
fields.short_description: A relic catalogued from the Ashen archives.
fields.description: A fragment of a forgotten age, recorded by the Emporium. Its true purpose is veiled, but its presence is undeniable.

fields.name: Raging Wolf Armor
fields.short_description: Armor worn by Vargram the Raging Wolf, one of the first Tarnished to visit the Roundtable Hold.
fields.description:
Armor worn by Vargram the Raging Wolf, one of the first Tarnished to visit the Roundtable Hold.

According to the old legends, wolves are the shadows of the Empyrean, and this is what Vargram aspired to be.

fields.name: Raging Wolf Gauntlets
fields.short_description: Gauntlets worn by Vargram the Raging Wolf, one of the first Tarnished to visit the Roundtable Hold.
fields.description:
Gauntlets worn by Vargram the Raging Wolf, one of the first Tarnished to visit the Roundtable Hold.

According to the old legends, wolves are the shadows of the Empyrean, and this is what Vargram aspired to be.

fields.name: Raging Wolf Greaves
fields.short_description: Greaves worn by Vargram the Raging Wolf, one of the first Tarnished to visit the Roundtable Hold.
fields.description:
Greaves worn by Vargram the Raging Wolf, one of the first Tarnished to visit the Roundtable Hold.

According to the old legends, wolves are the shadows of the Empyrean, and this is what Vargram aspired to be.

fields.name: Raging Wolf Helm
fields.short_description: Helm worn by Vargram the Raging Wolf, one of the first Tarnished to visit the Roundtable Hold.
fields.description:
Helm worn by Vargram the Raging Wolf, one of the first Tarnished to visit the Roundtable Hold.

Vargram's nickname comes from the white wolf's mane that decorates this helm.

fields.name: Raptor_s Black Feathers
fields.short_description: Robe crafted with the black feathers of a bird of prey. Worn by the assassins of Ravenmount.
fields.description:
Robe crafted with the black feathers of a bird of prey. Worn by the assassins of Ravenmount.

A ritual implement for transforming into a Deathbird, if only by imitation. Strengthens jump attacks.

"We are birds of prey, bringers of death."

fields.name: Raya Lucarian Gauntlets
fields.short_description: Gauntlets worn by Raya Lucaria Academy soldiers. Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.
fields.description: Gauntlets worn by Raya Lucaria Academy soldiers. Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.

fields.name: Raya Lucarian Greaves
fields.short_description: Greaves worn by Raya Lucaria Academy soldiers. Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.
fields.description: Greaves worn by Raya Lucaria Academy soldiers. Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.

fields.name: Raya Lucarian Helm
fields.short_description: Helm worn by Raya Lucaria Academy soldiers. Its brow is adorned with a single cuckoo's feather.
fields.description: Helm worn by Raya Lucaria Academy soldiers. Its brow is adorned with a single cuckoo's feather.

fields.name: Raya Lucarian Robe
fields.short_description: Robe worn by Raya Lucaria's scholars of sorcery.
fields.description:
Robe worn by Raya Lucaria's scholars of sorcery.

Those who dedicate themselves to the study of glintstones formed from starry amber receive this modest yet elegant deep navy garb after making their vows of virtue and austerity.

But with extended life, one is apt to forget old vows.

fields.name: Redmane Knight Armor (Altered)
fields.short_description: A relic catalogued from the Ashen archives.
fields.description: A fragment of a forgotten age, recorded by the Emporium. Its true purpose is veiled, but its presence is undeniable.

fields.name: Redmane Knight Armor
fields.short_description: Armor worn by knights who fought by General Radahn's side.
fields.description:
Armor worn by knights who fought by General Radahn's side.

When they were driven to defeat by Malenia's scarlet rot, the Redmane Knights burned the crest on the left breast of their armor to indicate their resolve.

"Alas, dear home, I shan't see you again! For our duty is to remain here, a bulwark against the blight."

fields.name: Redmane Knight Gauntlets
fields.short_description: Black iron gauntlets worn by knights who fought by General Radahn's side. Time has yet to dull their luster.
fields.description: Black iron gauntlets worn by knights who fought by General Radahn's side. Time has yet to dull their luster.

fields.name: Redmane Knight Greaves
fields.short_description: Black iron greaves worn by knights who fought by General Radahn's side. Time has yet to dull their luster.
fields.description: Black iron greaves worn by knights who fought by General Radahn's side. Time has yet to dull their luster.

fields.name: Redmane Knight Helm
fields.short_description: Helm worn by knights who fought by General Radahn's side.
fields.description:
Helm worn by knights who fought by General Radahn's side.

The red plume is a symbol of Radahn's pedigree as Lord Radagon's sonthe mane of the proud Red Lion.

fields.name: Redmane Surcoat
fields.short_description: Armor worn by soldiers who fought by General Radahn's side.
fields.description:
Armor worn by soldiers who fought by General Radahn's side.

The surcoat depicts a red-maned lion raising a sword in the image of Radahn. Thus, they were Redmanes, and all proved they were worthy of the name.

fields.name: Ronin_s Armor (Altered)
fields.short_description: A relic catalogued from the Ashen archives.
fields.description: A fragment of a forgotten age, recorded by the Emporium. Its true purpose is veiled, but its presence is undeniable.

fields.name: Ronin_s Armor
fields.short_description: Armor of the man who calls himself Shabriri. Highly functional and heavily worn.
fields.description:
Armor of the man who calls himself Shabriri. Highly functional and heavily worn.

The man, once known as Yura, kept a woman in the deepest reaches of his heart.

fields.name: Ronin_s Gauntlets
fields.short_description: Gauntlets of the man who calls himself Shabriri. Highly functional and heavily worn.
fields.description:
Gauntlets of the man who calls himself Shabriri. Highly functional and heavily worn.

The man, once known as Yura, kept a woman in the deepest reaches of his heart.

fields.name: Ronin_s Greaves
fields.short_description: Greaves of the man who calls himself Shabriri. Highly functional and heavily worn.
fields.description:
Greaves of the man who calls himself Shabriri. Highly functional and heavily worn.

The man, once known as Yura, kept a woman in the deepest reaches of his heart.

fields.name: Rotten Duelist Greaves
fields.short_description: Greaves wrapped with bronze snakes, eaten through by scarlet rot.
fields.description:
Greaves wrapped with bronze snakes, eaten through by scarlet rot.

Worn by gladiators who were driven from the colosseum. The wearer becomes a slightly easier target for foes.

fields.name: Rotten Duelist Helm
fields.short_description: Bronze helm decorated with innumerable snakes, eaten through by scarlet rot.
fields.description:
Bronze helm decorated with innumerable snakes, eaten through by scarlet rot.

Worn by gladiators who were driven from the colosseum. The wearer becomes a slightly easier target for foes.

fields.name: Rotten Gravekeeper Cloak (Altered)
fields.short_description: Cloak wrapped with bronze snakes, eaten through by scarlet rot.
fields.description:
Cloak wrapped with bronze snakes, eaten through by scarlet rot.

Worn by gladiators who were driven from the colosseum. The wearer becomes a slightly easier target for foes.

fields.name: Rotten Gravekeeper Cloak
fields.short_description: Thick, bristly cloak eaten through by scarlet rot.
fields.description:
Thick, bristly cloak eaten through by scarlet rot.

The symbol of an underground gravekeeper's station.

fields.name: Royal Knight Armor (Altered)
fields.short_description: Silver armor of Loretta, a knight who served Miquella's Haligtree.
fields.description:
Silver armor of Loretta, a knight who served Miquella's Haligtree.

Loretta, once a royal Carian knight, went on a journey in search of a haven for Albinaurics, and determined that the Haligtree was their best chance for eventual salvation.

fields.name: Royal Knight Armor
fields.short_description: Silver armor of Loretta, a knight who served Miquella's Haligtree.
fields.description:
Silver armor of Loretta, a knight who served Miquella's Haligtree.

Loretta was once a royal Carian knight, and her lapis-lazuli blue cape is the emblem of the knightly pride that continues to guide her.

fields.name: Royal Knight Gauntlets
fields.short_description: Silver gauntlets of Loretta, a knight who served Miquella's Haligtree.
fields.description:
Silver gauntlets of Loretta, a knight who served Miquella's Haligtree.

Loretta, once a royal Carian knight, went on a journey in search of a haven for Albinaurics, and determined that the Haligtree was their best chance for eventual salvation.

fields.name: Royal Knight Greaves
fields.short_description: Silver greaves of Loretta, a knight who served Miquella's Haligtree.
fields.description:
Silver greaves of Loretta, a knight who served Miquella's Haligtree.

Loretta, once a royal Carian knight, went on a journey in search of a haven for Albinaurics, and determined that the Haligtree was their best chance for eventual salvation.

fields.name: Royal Knight Helm
fields.short_description: Silver helm of Loretta, a knight who served Miquella's Haligtree.
fields.description:
Silver helm of Loretta, a knight who served Miquella's Haligtree.

Loretta, once a royal Carian knight, went on a journey in search of a haven for Albinaurics, and determined that the Haligtree was their best chance for eventual salvation.

fields.name: Royal Remains Armor
fields.short_description: Armor graced with gold human bones. Worn by the unspeaking adherent of Sir Gideon the All-Knowing.
fields.description:
Armor graced with gold human bones. Worn by the unspeaking adherent of Sir Gideon the All-Knowing.

Slowly replenishes HP when HP is reduced.

It is said that the bones belong to an ancient lordthe soulless king. The lord of the lost and desperate, who was known as Ensha.

fields.name: Royal Remains Gauntlets
fields.short_description: Gauntlets graced with gold human bones. Worn by the unspeaking adherent of Sir Gideon the All-Knowing.
fields.description:
Gauntlets graced with gold human bones. Worn by the unspeaking adherent of Sir Gideon the All-Knowing.

Slowly replenishes HP when HP is reduced.

It is said that the bones belong to an ancient lordthe soulless king. The lord of the lost and desperate, who was known as Ensha.

fields.name: Royal Remains Greaves
fields.short_description: Greaves graced with gold human bones. Worn by the unspeaking adherent of Sir Gideon the All-Knowing.
fields.description:
Greaves graced with gold human bones. Worn by the unspeaking adherent of Sir Gideon the All-Knowing.

Slowly replenishes HP when HP is reduced.

It is said that the bones belong to an ancient lordthe soulless king. The lord of the lost and desperate, who was known as Ensha.

fields.name: Royal Remains Helm
fields.short_description: Helm graced with gold human bones. Worn by the unspeaking adherent of Sir Gideon the All-Knowing.
fields.description:
Helm graced with gold human bones. Worn by the unspeaking adherent of Sir Gideon the All-Knowing.

Slowly replenishes HP when HP is reduced.

It is said that the bones belong to an ancient lordthe soulless king. The lord of the lost and desperate, who was known as Ensha.

fields.name: Ruler_s Mask
fields.short_description: Mask in the image of a wizened sage. Customary dress among lords in a smaller nation. Increases faith.
fields.description:
Mask in the image of a wizened sage. Customary dress among lords in a smaller nation. Increases faith.

Such a mask illustrates the qualities of an ideal lord: chiefly, wise and possessing a certain defanged geniality. One at the center of society often finds these qualities most expedient.

fields.name: Ruler_s Robe
fields.short_description: Luxurious robe worn by lords in a smaller nation. Its fine blue mantle serves to prove its wearer's status.
fields.description: Luxurious robe worn by lords in a smaller nation. Its fine blue mantle serves to prove its wearer's status.

fields.name: Sacred Crown Helm
fields.short_description: Flanged iron cap adorned with a crown of unalloyed gold. Increases faith.
fields.description:
Flanged iron cap adorned with a crown of unalloyed gold. Increases faith.

Worn by foot soldiers sworn to the Haligtree.

Who is it that Miquella shall bless, if not the low and the meek?

fields.name: Sage Hood
fields.short_description: A burgundy pointed hood. Attire of the wise sages who were deemed heretical.
fields.description:
A burgundy pointed hood. Attire of the wise sages who were deemed heretical.

Evidence that the wearer was driven from town.

fields.name: Sage Robe
fields.short_description: Thick burgundy robe. Attire of the wise sages who were deemed heretical.
fields.description:
Thick burgundy robe. Attire of the wise sages who were deemed heretical.

Evidence that the wearer was driven from town.

fields.name: Sage Trousers
fields.short_description: Thick burgundy trousers. Attire of the wise sages who were deemed heretical.
fields.description:
Thick burgundy trousers. Attire of the wise sages who were deemed heretical.

Evidence that the wearer was driven from town.

fields.name: Sanguine Noble Hood
fields.short_description: Hood of dyed black cloth featuring gold embroidery. Worn by the nobles who serve the Lord of Blood.
fields.description:
Hood of dyed black cloth featuring gold embroidery. Worn by the nobles who serve the Lord of Blood.

Known to strike from pools of blood, these assassins are missionaries come to share the gospel of accursed blood.

fields.name: Sanguine Noble Robe
fields.short_description: Robe of dyed black cloth featuring gold embroidery. Worn by the nobles who serve the Lord of Blood.
fields.description:
Robe of dyed black cloth featuring gold embroidery. Worn by the nobles who serve the Lord of Blood.

The grand metallic pattern on the shoulder is a signifier of the noble rank they intend to claim upon the advent of the new dynasty they are working to install.

fields.name: Sanguine Noble Waistcloth
fields.short_description: Waistcloth sewn from black cloth. Worn by the nobles who serve the Lord of Blood.
fields.description:
Waistcloth sewn from black cloth. Worn by the nobles who serve the Lord of Blood.

Known to strike from pools of blood, these assassins are missionaries come to share the gospel of accursed blood.

fields.name: Scale Armor
fields.short_description: Armor reinforced with small metal scales.
fields.description:
Armor reinforced with small metal scales.

The cape covering the shoulders is made with treated rock lizard skin, and provides ample protection against fire.

fields.name: Scaled Armor (Altered)
fields.short_description: A relic catalogued from the Ashen archives.
fields.description: A fragment of a forgotten age, recorded by the Emporium. Its true purpose is veiled, but its presence is undeniable.

fields.name: Scaled Armor
fields.short_description: Armor worn by Old Knight Istvan. The corroded metal is reinforced with rock-hard scales, making it highly effective against non-physical attacks.
fields.description:
Armor worn by Old Knight Istvan. The corroded metal is reinforced with rock-hard scales, making it highly effective against non-physical attacks.

Istvan is one of a few wizened Tarnished who survive to this day.

fields.name: Scarlet Tabard
fields.short_description: Padded cloth armor with the telltale stains of the scarlet rot.
fields.description:
Padded cloth armor with the telltale stains of the scarlet rot.

Worn by foot soldiers in General Radahn's army.

fields.name: Shaman Furs
fields.short_description: Raiment fashioned from a bristly pelt. Worn by ancestral follower shamans.
fields.description:
Raiment fashioned from a bristly pelt. Worn by ancestral follower shamans.

The ancestral followers live a distance from the Erdtree, awaiting new buds. They are certain to sprout from their very flesh, and indeed, their souls.

fields.name: Shaman Leggings
fields.short_description: Leggings fashioned from bristly pelts. Worn by ancestral follower shamans.
fields.description:
Leggings fashioned from bristly pelts. Worn by ancestral follower shamans.

The ancestral followers live a distance from the Erdtree, awaiting new buds. They are certain to sprout from their very flesh, and indeed, their souls.

fields.name: Shining Horned Headband
fields.short_description: Headband decorated by a pair of shining horns. Worn by ancestral follower shamans.
fields.description:
Headband decorated by a pair of shining horns. Worn by ancestral follower shamans.

Horns with buds that also shine are ideal ceremonial items for ancestral worship. Strengthens Ancestral Infant's Head.

fields.name: Silver Tear Mask
fields.short_description: Mask fashioned from the corpse of a formless Silver Tear, supported by its hardened, shed husk.
fields.description:
Mask fashioned from the corpse of a formless Silver Tear, supported by its hardened, shed husk.

Greatly increases arcane to the detriment of physical attack power.

To imitate the imitator is a cunning play indeed.

fields.name: Skeletal Mask
fields.short_description: Skeletal mask that tightly grips the face. Worn by the assassins of Ravenmount.
fields.description:
Skeletal mask that tightly grips the face. Worn by the assassins of Ravenmount.

This ritual implement relentlessly digs into the wearer's face, preserving one's human instincts while dressed in imitation of the Deathbirds.

fields.name: Snow Witch Hat
fields.short_description: Witch's pointed hat, frigid and frozen through. Of a style associated with practitioners of heretical sorcery. Strengthens cold sorcery.
fields.description:
Witch's pointed hat, frigid and frozen through. Of a style associated with practitioners of heretical sorcery. Strengthens cold sorcery.

Once worn by the snowy crone who the young Ranni encountered deep in the woods. She was a witch, and well versed in cold sorceries. It is said that the doll that houses Ranni's soul was modeled after her.

That old witch was Ranni's secret mentor.

fields.name: Snow Witch Robe (Altered)
fields.short_description: A relic catalogued from the Ashen archives.
fields.description: A fragment of a forgotten age, recorded by the Emporium. Its true purpose is veiled, but its presence is undeniable.

fields.name: Snow Witch Robe
fields.short_description: Witch's robe in the color of snow.
fields.description:
Witch's robe in the color of snow.

Once worn by the snowy crone who the young Ranni encountered deep in the woods. She was a witch, and well versed in cold sorceries. It is said that the doll that houses Ranni's soul was modeled after her.

That old witch was Ranni's secret mentor.

fields.description: Leggings worn by Raya Lucaria's scholars of sorcery. Made by wrapping a simple cloth around the legs.

fields.description: Manchettes worn by Raya Lucaria's scholars of sorcery. Made by wrapping a simple cloth around the forearms.

fields.name: Spellblade_s Gloves
fields.short_description: Glintstone sorcerer Rogier's gloves, graced with an intricate, aristocratic decoration. Strengthen glintstone sorcery skills.
fields.description:
Glintstone sorcerer Rogier's gloves, graced with an intricate, aristocratic decoration. Strengthen glintstone sorcery skills.

Rogier spent his entire life behaving with utter detachment. No one noticed the anger, grief, regret, or fear that existed along with it.

fields.name: Spellblade_s Pointed Hat
fields.short_description: Glintstone sorcerer Rogier's pointed hat, a sign of a heretical practitioner. Strengthens glintstone sorcery skills.

fields.short_description: Light yet sturdy leather boots.
fields.description:
Light yet sturdy leather boots.

Worn by young women who set off into the world to confront their fate.

fields.name: Traveler_s Clothes
fields.short_description: Light yet sturdy clothes.
fields.description:
Light yet sturdy clothes.

Worn by young women who set off into the world to confront their fate.

fields.name: Traveler_s Gloves
fields.short_description: Gloves of a traveling perfumer of no renown.
fields.description:
Gloves of a traveling perfumer of no renown.

An associate of a healer, he is said to be in search of new aromatics and flower gardens, in hopes of treating Misbegotten, Omen, and all those seen as impure.

fields.short_description: Hat of a traveling perfumer of no renown.

fields.short_description: Boots worn by traveling maidens.
fields.description:
Boots worn by traveling maidens.

Maidens traversed the Lands Between for different reasons. Some to seek audience with the Fingers. Others, to find the Tarnished who they were destined to guide.

fields.description:
Golden armor of the heavy cavalry Tree Sentinels who serve the Erdtree.

Imposingly sturdy and nigh unbreakable, the grace of old yet lingers.

fields.short_description: Golden armor of the heavy cavalry Tree Sentinels who serve the Erdtree.
fields.description:
Golden armor of the heavy cavalry Tree Sentinels who serve the Erdtree.

Adorned with a cape featuring the mark of the sacred tree.

Imposingly sturdy and nigh unbreakable, the grace of old yet lingers.

fields.description:
Golden helm of the heavy cavalry Tree Sentinels who serve the Erdtree.

Very few are permitted to wear a golden wood crest of such size as seen on this helm.

fields.name: Tree Surcoat
fields.short_description: Blue surcoat draped over chainmail.
fields.description:
Blue surcoat draped over chainmail.

The tree insignia emblazoned on the front depicts the Erdtree, and is a design beloved throughout the Lands Between.

fields.name: Twinned Armor (Altered)
fields.short_description: A relic catalogued from the Ashen archives.
fields.description: A fragment of a forgotten age, recorded by the Emporium. Its true purpose is veiled, but its presence is undeniable.

fields.name: Twinned Armor
fields.short_description: Armor depicting entwined twins of gold and silver.
fields.description:
Armor depicting entwined twins of gold and silver.

The two known as D are inseparable twins. They are of two bodies and two minds, but one single soul. Not once do they stand together; not one word do they speak to one another.

Perhaps this armor longs to find its way to the other D.

fields.short_description: Gauntlets depicting entwined twins of gold and silver.
fields.description:
Gauntlets depicting entwined twins of gold and silver.

The two known as D are inseparable twins. They are of two bodies and two minds, but one single soul. Not once do they stand together; not one word do they speak to one another.

fields.short_description: One of the glintstone crowns bestowed upon Raya Lucaria scholars whose pursuits were deemed worthy.
fields.description:
One of the glintstone crowns bestowed upon Raya Lucaria scholars whose pursuits were deemed worthy.

Greatly increases intelligence to the detriment of HP and stamina.

Scholars of the Twinsage Conspectus were the elites of the academy, permitted to study and excel in sorceries of all kinds.

fields.name: Upper-Class Robe
fields.short_description: Embroidered, bright green robe worn by noble children. Donning such a robe is traditionally the child's first show of burgeoning independence.
fields.description: Embroidered, bright green robe worn by noble children. Donning such a robe is traditionally the child's first show of burgeoning independence.

fields.short_description: A relic catalogued from the Ashen archives.
fields.description: A fragment of a forgotten age, recorded by the Emporium. Its true purpose is veiled, but its presence is undeniable.

fields.name: Vagabond Knight Armor
fields.short_description: Chest piece of a knight banished from their motherland. Dirty and battered after enduring a lengthy vagabond journey.
fields.description:
Chest piece of a knight banished from their motherland. Dirty and battered after enduring a lengthy vagabond journey.

The crest emblazoned on the front is worn and dingy, no longer able to evoke sentiment.

Metal armor is heavy, but also sturdy, offering significant damage negation.

fields.short_description: Gauntlets of a knight banished from their motherland. Dirty and battered after enduring a lengthy vagabond journey.

fields.description:
Helm of a knight banished from their motherland. Dirty and battered after enduring a lengthy vagabond journey.

The visor is broken and can no longer be lowered.

Metal armor is heavy, but also sturdy, offering significant damage negation.

fields.short_description: A relic catalogued from the Ashen archives.
fields.description: A fragment of a forgotten age, recorded by the Emporium. Its true purpose is veiled, but its presence is undeniable.

fields.name: Veteran_s Armor
fields.short_description: Old armor that has seen many battles. Worn by Niall, the veteran general of Sol.
fields.description:
Old armor that has seen many battles. Worn by Niall, the veteran general of Sol.

Niall was a lone survivor who commanded spirits to defend his long-passed master.

This aging general could not die, nor did he have anywhere to fade away.

fields.name: Veteran_s Gauntlets
fields.short_description: Old gauntlets that have seen many battles. Worn by Niall, the veteran general of Sol.

fields.name: Vulgar Militia Armor
fields.short_description: Armor worn by lean, mean, and filthy militiamen.
fields.description:
Armor worn by lean, mean, and filthy militiamen.

Freshly-singed battlegrounds effusing with the stench of the dead. Forbidden lands that will be excised from the memory of history. This is where the vulgar militia serve, as untiring, unsung watchkeepers.

fields.short_description: Gauntlets worn by lean, mean, and filthy militiamen.

fields.description:
Helm worn by lean, mean, and filthy militiamen.

The upward extension serves to create an appearance of larger size, however slightly.

fields.name: War Surgeon Gloves
fields.short_description: Bloodstained white gloves of the war surgeons who were effectively mercy killers.
fields.description:
Bloodstained white gloves of the war surgeons who were effectively mercy killers.

Of the surgeons that were abducted by the Lord of Blood, none were able to tame the accursed blood. None but Varr, that is; though he was an exception.

fields.description: Greaves of a nomadic warrior. Crafted from sturdy leather.

fields.name: White Mask
fields.short_description: Bloodstained, faintly grinning white mask. Worn by war surgeons who were effectively mercy killers.
fields.description:
Bloodstained, faintly grinning white mask. Worn by war surgeons who were effectively mercy killers.

The Lord of Blood's curse enlivens the wearer when bloodletting occurs. Slightly raises attack power when there is blood loss nearby.

fields.name: White Reed Armor
fields.short_description: Armor of the White Reeds, fashioned from banded iron plates. Worn by the Inaba, head disciples of the great swordsman Okina.
fields.description:
Armor of the White Reeds, fashioned from banded iron plates. Worn by the Inaba, head disciples of the great swordsman Okina.

The Inaba traveled in pursuit of not only the master who abandoned them, but also proper deaths, won honorably through hard-fought combat. To be a White Reed is to seek death; fitting for the Inaba, who desired nothing more than to die by the sword.

fields.name: White Reed Gauntlets
fields.short_description: Gauntlets of the White Reeds, fashioned from banded iron plates. Worn by the Inaba, head disciples of the great swordsman Okina.

fields.name: Witch_s Glintstone Crown
fields.short_description: One of the glintstone crowns bestowed upon Raya Lucaria scholars whose pursuits were deemed worthy.
fields.description:
One of the glintstone crowns bestowed upon Raya Lucaria scholars whose pursuits were deemed worthy.

Increases intelligence and arcane to the detriment of stamina.

This gentle-looking crown was granted to a scholar who excelled in her studies, which also merited the title of "witch."

fields.name: Zamor Armor
fields.short_description: Armor worn by knights of Zamor, hailed as heroes in the War against the Giants.
fields.description:
Armor worn by knights of Zamor, hailed as heroes in the War against the Giants.

These long-lived warriors, clad in biting, freezing winds, are said to have been the mortal enemies of the Fire Giants since time immemorial.

fields.name: Zamor Bracelets
fields.short_description: Bracelets worn by knights of Zamor, hailed as heroes in the War against the Giants.
fields.description:
Bracelets worn by knights of Zamor, hailed as heroes in the War against the Giants.

These long-lived warriors, clad in biting, freezing winds, are said to have been the mortal enemies of the Fire Giants since time immemorial.

Mask worn by knights of Zamor, hailed as heroes in the War against the Giants.
